01 01 01 01
[1-11] Opening frame establishing textual authority. Triple ornamental shad marks treasury genre. Sanskrit incipit positions Indian origin while Tibetan rendering claims coexistent authority. Standard mdzod colophon formula. Bzhugs so signals presence-marker, not mere location. Samantabhadra as primordial dharmakāya remains Samantabhadra in translation, not reduced to All-Good. IAST conventions for Sanskrit restoration.
[12-15] Fivefold refuge mandala structure. Samantabhadra with five perfections in nature, five family regents as sambhogakāya, five vidyādharas of aural lineage, three worlds with gods as retinue. Anaphoric chains building hierarchical ascent. Five perfections formula condenses teacher, retinue, place, teaching, time. Snyan brgyud as unbroken whispered transmission. Preserve mandala ascent, not mere list.
[16-19] Dharmakāya register shift. Primordial purity, cessation of elaboration, dharmatā, clear light, seven horses sun metaphor. Non-abiding in existence or peace, uncompounded, spontaneously accomplished. Vajra-point and Sugata-essence culmination. Technical Dzogchen terms anchor the view: gdod nas as from the primordial, spros kun zhi ba as cessation of elaboration, srid zhir mi gnas as transcendence of dichotomy. Lhun gyis grub as spontaneously accomplished without fabrication.
[20-23] Vehicle hierarchy establishment. Dharma-sun vast and immeasurable. Unsurpassed secret vajra vehicle supreme among paths. Great Perfection at apex. Prayer for mind-lotus protection as conventional frame. Stratification clear: causal vehicles below, resultant tantra above, Atiyoga supreme. Rang bzhin as self-existing, not practice-constructed. Bde gshegs snying po as Sugata-essence signals Buddha-nature doctrine.
[24-27] Composition declaration. Makara throne as mythological place, vajra essence sphere as nature, profound and vast abodes as subject. Future tense establishes autocommentary genre. Fourfold structure: place, essence, clarification, action. Makara throne signals non-ordinary setting. Rnam par bshad bya in future tense marks shift from homage to exposition. Preserve architectural clarity.
[28-35] Autocommentary prose transition. Trikāya manifestation as basis for threefold classification: teacher, place, teaching. Perfect place as dharmatā luminous-clarity ground. Uncompounded qualities spontaneously manifest in precious field. Trikāya universal Buddhist framework, not unique to Dzogchen. Gzhi as ground for saṃsāra and nirvāṇa. Teacher-place-teaching classification follows standard commentarial convention.
[36-40] Perfect teacher exposition. Samantabhadra with complete dominion, wisdom-ocean retinue. Body and wisdom non-dual in intention. Teaching beyond cause-effect and effort characterizes dharmakāya. Temporal frame in dharmatā beyond effort, primordial sphere of inner clarity-wisdom. Negation rgyu 'bras bya rtsol las 'das pa definitive Dzogchen marker requiring both cause-effect and action-effort. Body-wisdom inseparability as non-dual ground state. Primordial sphere as atemporal non-beginning.
[41-45] Perfect place exposition. Ground-nature or blessing as source of self-appearing field. Dense self-appearance adorned with outer clarity five lights. Five family teachers self-appearing as mandala play. Teaching: dharmatā luminous-clarity Great Perfection spontaneously accomplished. Great self-arisen wisdom beyond pure trainees' objects. Ambiguity ngang ngam allows nature or blessing. Rang snang excludes external existence and mental construction. Las dag pa'i gdul bya as advanced practitioners who cannot objectify this level.
[46-51] Sambhogakāya enumeration. Sixth teacher Vajradhara of complete marks in Akanishta through strength and blessing. Fivefold retinue: earth-dwellers, awareness-holders, ḍākiṇīs, accomplished ones, self-appearances. Teaching result-vajra vehicle tantra sections ocean-like. Sixth teacher as sambhogakāya Buddha distinct from five dhyāni Buddhas. Retinue includes pure and impure realm beings. Result vehicle marks tantric path distinct from causal.
[52-56] Nirmāṇakāya exposition. Perfect place appearing to beings' self-appearances. Perfect teacher as emanation-body manifesting as holy guides adapting to capacity. Teaching perfections as three baskets when karma and aspiration pure. Transition from tantric to sutric structural, not chronological. Individual self-appearances signal subjective perception, not objective reality. Three baskets as causal vehicle below resultant path.
[57-58] Vehicle hierarchy conclusion. Three causal characteristic vehicles as cause and method for result-vajra vehicle. Secret mantra vajra vehicle as completely complete peak. Supreme result as natural Great Perfection, unsurpassable vehicle. Stratification explicit: Causal below, Tantric intermediate, Dzogchen supreme. Rgyu mtshan nyid as svabhāvavāda or causal characteristics. Rang bzhin rdzogs pa chen po as supreme result not acquired through practice.
[59-60] Definitive place determination. Luminous-clarity vajra-essence teaching as definitive realm. Unsurpassable mind-secret of all Tathāgatas, great completely-complete vajra place of wondrous marvelous self-nature. Tantric authority through epistemological definiteness. Gnas nges pa as technical term for definitive ground specification. Thugs kyi gsang ba marks innermost dimension requiring transmission. Ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba as standard tantric epithet of wonder. Self-nature as marvelous signals primordial perfection without contrivance.
[61-64] Guhyagarbha Tantra citation. Threefold cosmogonic presentation: primordial protector's manifest enlightenment and field arrangement, peaceful attainment through Vajradhara's emanation, Dharma-wheel turning through emanation-body elaboration. Sequential trikāya emanation structure. Guhyagarbha as supreme Nyingma tantric authority warranting this cosmogony. Threefold manner as process description, not ontological assertion. Trikāya sequence: dharmakāya to sambhogakāya to nirmāṇakāya.
[65-71] Cosmogony narrative. Before all, without saṃsāra-nirvāṇa division. Complete sovereign teacher Samantabhadra. Self-arising wisdom of expanse from primordial ground as ground-appearance. Moment of transcending basis, recognizing self-appearance. Three self-arising dharmas spontaneously accomplishing precious cavity. Primordial exhaustion-place of great primordial purity. Youth vase body field, conquered ground seized. Abandonment-realization qualities complete, Buddha in dharmakāya nature, abiding in inner clarity. Primordial enlightenment preceding all manifestation. Gzhi snang as spontaneous display from ground. Youth vase body as form of spontaneous presence. Inner clarity as dharmakāya abiding mode. [72] Sambhogakāya field description. Pervaded by five wisdoms. Self-appearing spontaneous mandala to sky limits. Five families as individual self-appearances beyond trainee objects. Five wisdoms manifest as five Buddha aspects. Sambhogakāya field as spontaneous display, not constructed visualization. Beyond trainee objects signals transcendence of conceptual practice. Field extends to nam mkha'i mtha' klas pa, sky's limit.
[73-75] Compassion narrative. Long after primordial awakening, ground-appearance potency sees beings move like dreams without confusion cause. Compassion arising for beings' benefit. Field arrangement from self-appearing enjoyment-body appearance aspect. Five-family Buddhas as great ocean bodies pervading to sky limits. Temporal gap de nas ring zhig na separates primordial enlightenment from compassionate response. 'Khrul rgyu med without confusion cause is key Dzogchen point. Compassion arises from recognition, not suffering. Sambhogakāya display as compassionate response to non-existent confusion.
[76-80] Mandala enumeration. Precious mudra wheel, vajra, jewel, lotus, cross patterns in hollow spaces. Lotus from center supports twenty-five fields in dimensional hierarchy. Five emblems: vajra (Akṣobhya), jewel (Ratnasambhava), lotus (Amitābha), crossed vajra (Amoghasiddhi), Buddha Vairocana implicit. Architectural description requiring spatial relationship preservation, not inventory flattening.
[81-87] Pore-mandala cosmology. Pore-holes flow scented water streams as great oceans. Earth, water, fire, wind particles, all spaces contain Buddha blessings and beings' karma-fields distinct. Ba spu'i khung as pore-holes signals micro-macrocosm identity. Gar khyab as pervasive presence dissolves ordinary spatial limits. Two field types: blessed by Buddhas and karmic, operating simultaneously without confusion.
[88-97] Infinite field manifestations. Round, square, oblong, crescent shapes with immeasurable forms and arrangements appearing inconceivably. Sky-pervasion corresponds to body, speech, mind, qualities, activities and arising fields. Geometric forms reference traditional Indian cosmology. Fields emerging from five aspects parallels five Buddha wisdoms. Rtag pa rgyun gyi 'khor mor as perpetual wheel of benefit.
[98-105] Cosmic scope and timelessness. All benefit as original Samantabhadra's field activity. Vast as dharmadhātu and space. Cannot be measured by years, eons, dust-oceans of fields. Neither beginning nor end determinable. Unmoving spontaneously accomplished great field-ocean essence. Natural spontaneous Buddha as saṃsāra-nirvāṇa teacher since beginningless time. Temporal language paradoxically describes atemporal reality. Mi g.yo as unmoving signals unchanging ground.
[106-111] Trikāya field classification. Dharmakāya time: Luminous-clarity vajra-essence field. Sambhogakāya time: Brahmā drum-sound field. Nirmāṇakāya time: Great Brahmā eon or field. Samantabhadra's emanation-Buddhas, those blessed by him, teachers gone to three times. Threefold temporal classification maintains trikāya structure throughout. Time as dimension, not chronological sequence. Emanation hierarchy: direct emanations and blessed manifestations.
[112-114] Universal sentient being realm. All sentient being realms exist, extremely vast as field to be tamed. Earth, water, fire, wind, space pervade everywhere, contained within great Brahmā eon. Gdul zhing as field-to-be-tamed implies pedagogical relationship, not ontological category. Spatial elements as containers reference traditional cosmology. Thams cad tshangs chen gyi bskal pa'i khongs su 'dul as macrocosmic containment.
[115-122] Micro-macrocosm identity in deluded perception. Within beings' deluded appearance, even one atom's scope shows immeasurable fields beyond count. Pure karma appearance shows great Buddha activities variously: passing beyond sorrow, teaching remaining, path accomplishment. Impure experience shows teaching decline, lower realms appearance, eon destruction, happiness-suffering varieties. All like dream. Rdul phran re'i go na as scope of one atom signals infinite worlds within each point. Las dag pa'i snang ba as karmically purified perception revealing Buddha activity.
[123-124] Epistemological status of appearances. Even one atom's scope shows great fields with mountains, islands: beings' deluded appearance. Actually non-existent clear appearance, therefore tenable. 'Gro ba'i 'khrul snang as beings' deluded perception frames all experience as misperception. Don la med pa as actually non-existent signals emptiness. Gsal snang as clear appearance maintains luminous quality despite emptiness.
[125-134] Samādhirāja Sūtra citation opening. Proofs of inconceivable Buddha-fields: hair-tip space contains many Buddhas as Ganges sand-grains. Equal number of fields for those victorious ones. Different characteristics, unequal eons. Hair-tip contains five realms: hell beings, animals, Yama world, gods, humans. Non-mixed, non-harmful. Detailed enumeration demonstrates simultaneous presence of contradictory realms within single space.
[135-161] Samādhirāja citation continuation. Abodes with lakes, oceans, rivers, pools, non-mixed, non-harmful. Victor's Dharma inconceivable. Mountains surrounding Meru, Sumeru, Btang zung, great Btang zung, Vulture Peak, Snow Mountain. Unbearable hell beings, hot and very hot, experiencing unpleasant suffering. Gods' measureless palaces, twelve leagues delightful, thousands experiencing great divine bliss. Buddhas arise, world-knowing teachings blaze. Same abodes show Dharma decline, guide's passing. Impure beings in homes like dream, enjoying desirable qualities, waking to not see those desires. Known as dream. Seen, heard, known, distinguished, all like dream, untrue. Hair-tip as microcosm containing macrocosm. Non-mixing despite proximity maintains karmic separateness. [162] Citation conclusion. One dust-mote's world, appearing subtle dusts contain sentient being fields and arrangements immeasurable. Reiterates micro-macrocosm principle established through scripture.
[163-170] Inconceivable Buddha-Field and Wisdom Sūtra citation. Hierarchical vision capacity: gods and humans of three thousand worlds fewer than one outsider ṛṣi with clairvoyance sees beings within cart-wheel's extent. Exceeds śrāvakas' eight liberations, one dhyāna practitioner sees more. Exceeds bodhisattvas' eight liberations, one dhyāna practitioner sees more. Exceeds Tathāgata's vision sees more within cart-wheel's extent. Progressive hierarchy establishes Buddha-vision as supreme. Cart-wheel as limited scope containing infinite content. Comparative structure demonstrates quantitative transcendence at each level.
[171-174] Cosmic pervasion and emanation. Wherever sky pervades as place, sentient beings pervade. Pervaded by Buddha emanations doing benefit. Some directly by Samantabhadra's emanations, some by Buddhas in other tantras, all from Samantabhadra first showing path, generating mind. Samantabhadra's tantric benefit. Emanation hierarchy distinguishes direct from indirect manifestation. Rgyud as tantra or continuum signals unbroken lineage.
[72-72] Transitional passage. The Tibetan text moves from previous topic to next. Wylie: '/de'i rtsal lam byin rlabs las ye shes lngas gdal ba'i zhing...' This structural marker serves as bridge between doctrinal expositions. The lotsawa recognizes the transition and prepares the reader for the next topic. Structural function: transitional clarity. Register: structural awareness.
[162-162] Transitional passage. The Tibetan text moves from previous topic to next. Wylie: '/de ltar rdul gcig gi go sa'i 'jig rten de na snang ba'i rdu...' This structural marker serves as bridge between doctrinal expositions. The lotsawa recognizes the transition and prepares the reader for the next topic. Structural function: transitional clarity. Register: structural awareness.
01 01 02 01
[175-176] Cosmic pervasion and emanation. Wherever sky pervades as place, sentient beings pervade. Pervaded by Buddha emanations doing benefit. Some directly by Samantabhadra's emanations, some by Buddhas in other tantras, all from Samantabhadra first showing path, generating mind. Samantabhadra's tantric benefit. Emanation hierarchy distinguishes direct from indirect manifestation. Rgyud as tantra or continuum signals unbroken lineage.
[177-179] Canonical reference. These meanings in some treatises: Buddha from Dharma, Dharma from Saṅgha of Āryas. Sequence of arising intention. Dependent origination formula applied to three jewels hierarchy.
[180-182] Transition to second topic. In this field Vajradhara's peaceful attainment, some think from primordial protector, different tantra sentient beings generate mind. Incorrect. Polemical refutation establishing correct view. Kha cig signals opponent position to be rejected.
[183-189] Guhyagarbha citation. First victorious one, earth-victorious one, great being, great destroyer. This teacher Vajradhara, Buddha before all Buddhas. Contradicts opponent view. Root tantra as authoritative refutation.
[190-191] Resolution. For this field's beings' benefit, from primordial time Samantabhadra's emanations taught like ordinary beings generating mind, manner of becoming Buddha, great activities play. Such manner renowned in common sūtras too. Synthesizes apparent contradiction: emanations appear as ordinary while primordially enlightened.
[192-199] Meeting of Father and Son citation. Great hero skillful means, for completely ripening sentient beings, becoming victorious one, appearing as Buddha billions of times, still guiding, showing many Buddhas. Sutra proof of emanation principle: Buddhas appear multiple times while remaining essentially unchanged.
[200-206] Avataṃsaka citation. Having attained enlightenment-ocean, for ripening sentient-being-ocean, showing bodhicitta-ocean generation, showing non-decreasing conduct-ocean at all times. Thus Sugatas' emanations. Ocean metaphor signals vastness and depth. Non-decreasing conduct maintains continuous activity despite enlightenment.
[207-210] Historical narrative introduction. Primordial protector, thinking to tame this field, emanated manner of generating mind. Good Eon, immeasurable eons before, field called naturally arranged, Buddha called Great Beautiful Flower, offered golden vajra, first mind generation supreme bodhicitta. Specific historical reference grounding emanation theory in narrative. Bskal pa bzang po as Good Eon frames temporal context.
[211-214] Second birth narrative. Second birth in north called Wind-Movement Arrangement, became householder Legs-sbyin's son called Jewel-Garland. Near Buddha called Wheel-Beautiful-Practice, heard Dharma. Transferred, born in Bliss-Intoxicated Island as son called Lightning-Light, brahmin youth called Legs-byin. Sequential rebirths demonstrating progressive cultivation. Geographic names signal cosmological scope.
[215-218] Enlightenment narrative. Five years heard Dharma from Buddha dGe-ba'i-blo-gros, seven years single-pointed samādhi equipoise. Seventy-five years on Jewel-Pile-Arrangement Mountain peak showed manner of completely manifestly becoming Buddha. From dharmakāya intention abiding one great eon, victorious one sambhogakāya ornament and color wheel self-arisen. From light rays' projection and gathering, thirty-six tantras self-arisen. Thirty-six tantras enumerate specific teachings arising spontaneously. Self-arisen signals non-human composition.
[219-223] Abiding as light-drop, abiding in sixty perfections. Buddha bodies hundred-thousands myriads immeasurable, unutterable, self-appearing. Five-family Buddha appearing ones from tongue sense-power rays immeasurable projecting, all self-arisen six syllables' sound renowned, non-acting compassion pervaded directions. From that nature Buddha Vairocana great body, chief with retinue, immeasurable, gathering into dharmatā Samantabhadra's enjoyment, blazing as Great Perfection body. Technical enumeration: sixty perfections, six syllables. Light-drop as bindu signals dharmakāya essence. Self-arisen sound negates human composition.
[224-228] Five-family mandala completion. Akṣobhya, Ratnasambhava, Amitābha, Amoghasiddhi, etc., each with mandala, immeasurable, unspeakable, gathering into own enjoyment, blazing as Great Perfection body. Four remaining dhyāni Buddhas completing five-family structure. So so'i dkyil 'khor as individual mandalas maintains distinct yet unified display.
[229-237] Specific abode and teacher description. Light-Mansion completely pure, excellently arranged, stacked dwelling, teacher called Completely-Pure Self-Knowing Awareness King Vairocana Great-Ocean, arising as sovereign of all mandalas, body-speech-mind non-made teaching precious nature unmoving, non-arising, non-abiding, non-taking, non-relinquishing, non-disturbing, self-arisen. Six-fold negation characterizes dharmakāya. Negations are positive predicates of non-dual nature.
[238-243] Retinue description. Retinue not-to-be-tamed taming-beautiful-jewel, gathering groups hundred-thousands immeasurable also, from own body, speech, mind, qualities, activities projecting and gathering. Gdul bya ma yin 'dul byed as those who tame without being disciples signals advanced bodhisattvas. Five aspects as source of retinue maintains identity of teacher and taught.
[244-248] Universal purity declaration. All appearances above, below, ten-directions worlds non-existent, all completely pure densely arranged, blissful field, self-appearing completely pure self-arisen Buddha-field purely apparent. From that appearance aspect marks and signs perfect Vajradhara qualities-complete body arising. De ltar snang ba kun kyang as all appearances signals ontological transformation. Worlds as non-existent yet purely apparent maintains emptiness-form identity.
[249-252] Causal origin of teacher. Arising from offering vajra as support for generating mind. Merit completely pure, body-appearance essenceless, accumulation completely pure, mind's great wisdom engaging in knowing all aspects. Decomposing teacher's manifestation into pure causes: merit, wisdom, accumulation. Maintains causal logic while asserting spontaneous nature.
[253-256] Dharmakāya time perfection. Dharmakāya time, place dharmadhātu conception thought completely pure. Teacher Samantabhadra nature activities all complete and abiding, with retinue upon one dust, dust-numbered Buddhas immeasurable together with teaching actual natural Great Perfection dharmatā vajra uncompounded by anyone, time dharmatā seeing completely pure engaging five perfections. Five perfections at dharmakāya level. Upon one dust signals micro-macrocosm.
[257-267] Thirty-six activities: body. Body-speech-mind inexhaustible ornament wheel's thirty-six activities. Body outer four: non-changing, non-coming, non-going, non-abiding. Inner four: non-appearing, non-doing, non-projecting, non-gathering. Secret four: clear, complete, outstanding, flowing. Detailed enumeration of body activities. Four sets of four reference standard tantric classification. Technical terms require precise rendering.
[268-282] Thirty-six activities: speech. Speech outer four: inexpressible, unshowable, unseeable, nothing-at-all. Inner four: as essence, as communication, not subject, not multiple. Secret four: fresh, innate, natural, unfabricated. Speech activities parallel body structure. Gyin 'da' as communication signals dynamic aspect. So ma, gnyug ma, rnal ma, ma bcos pa as secret four require careful semantic preservation.
[283-298] Thirty-six activities: mind. Mind outer four samādhis: Stainless, Lion's Play, Heroic Going, Wish-fulfilling Jewel Top. Inner four samādhis: Banner Peak Play, Lightning Garland, Great Wheel, Blazing Light. Secret four listed at page break. Samādhi names reference standard tantric meditation deities. Sequential enumeration maintains systematic structure.
[299-304] Mind secret four samādhis and activity nature. Mudra-overpowering, Great-blazing Equality, Dharmatā-various, Self-appearing Play Display. Not purposeful doing activities, but essence of qualities and strength-arising rain becoming, therefore called activity. Thirty-six activities complete with mind section. Don bya byed kyi mdzad pa negated as purposive action. Yon tan gyi ngo bo as essence of qualities signals spontaneous display.
[305-311] Sambhogakāya self-arising. Sambhogakāya self-arisen. From previous appearance and compassion's arising manner unceasing strength play, completely pure place densely arranged. Teacher Vairocana Great-Ocean samādhi hand-palm from lotus trunk arising, petals and stamens upon twenty-five fields stacked one above another, different colors and forms like water-moon. Stacked vertically overlapping like layers. Architectural description requires spatial precision. Chu zla 'dra ba as like water-moon signals reflection-like insubstantiality.
[312-316] Mandala hierarchy continued. Below crossed legs immeasurable scented water streams, sixteen fields sixteen abiding also stacked. Vertically jewel umbrellas stacked, mutually grain-piles spread, five-family Buddhas etc. immeasurable. Ba spu'i khung bu as pore-holes emitting light rays, within those expanse fields and teachers' varieties endless, immeasurable. Layered cosmology with stacked fields maintains dimensional hierarchy.
[317-322] Sambhogakāya teaching and activities. Sambhogakāya field, teaching actual self-arisen syllable no one made, all teachings' sons together appearing, those abiding time dharmatā unchanging. Sambhogakāya body-speech-mind inexhaustible ornament wheel thirty-six activities self-arisen. Body outer four activities: body-appearance essenceless, obscuration with basis completely pure. Self-arisen syllable as natural sound negates human authorship. Teaching-sons as retinue maintains genealogical metaphor.
[323-335] Sambhogakāya body activities enumeration. Threefold face-hand perfection: wisdom, light, and discerning. Each completing body, self-appearance liberation, and knowledge. Four inner activities: thirty-two marks, eighty signs, light-rays emanation, all-direction face pervasion. Four secret activities: no front/back, inner-to-outer clarity, outer-to-inner clarity, tip pervading all directions. Face-hand formula denotes enlightened activity display. Marks and signs as symbolic perfection, not anatomy. Three levels maintain systematic structure: outer, inner, secret.
[336-349] Speech activities enumeration. Four outer: six self-arisen syllables from tongue, entering father's face, emerging from mother's space, emanating-gathering. Four inner: self-nature explained, non-word, understood meaning appearance, light-rays from face. Four secret: pure body<span class="term">/speech/</span>mind practice. Six self-arisen syllables denote natural mantra, not composed. Yab yum as father-mother signals dharmakāya-dharmadhātu union. Three vajras as body-speech-mind purity complete the structure.
[350-365] Sambhogakāya activities completion. Face union purity perfecting all-knowing Dharma enjoyment. Four outer mind activities: non-composite samādhi, pure wisdom vision samādhi, dharmatā purity samādhi, samādhi of suchness. Four inner: mirror-like wisdom, equality, discriminating, all-accomplishing. Four secret: dharmatā clarity-emptiness non-dual, appearance-emptiness non-dual, awareness-emptiness non-dual, object-mind non-dual. Non-dual formulations are structural unities, not sequential stages. Clarity-emptiness dbyer med as key Dzogchen formulation signals primordial unity.
[366-380] Nirmāṇakāya emanation analysis. Twelve emanations from blessing of Vajradhara complete qualities. Body forms arisen from one hundred one precious causes without maker. Three emanations of body-speech-mind indestructible. Blessing self-arisen, immeasurable miracles and qualities. Contact liberation activity. Twelve emanations as standard set in tantric cosmology. Self-arisen negates constructed nature. Liberation through contact demonstrates blessing power.
[381-397] Emanation-body supports and dwelling places. Mind support vajra as wish-fulfilling jewel curing beings' diseases, fulfilling desires, connecting to liberation. Speech support self-arisen syllable, contact and hearing sound alone liberates. Written book holding also effortless liberation activity. Body contact liberates body into clear light. Three supports located differently according to body-speech-mind teaching times. Dwelling various locations not fixed to one earth.
[398-410] Three emanation supports detailed locations. Vajra at Malaya mountain, vajra place, yakṣa kings pay homage. Letters in sky above Vajrasana held by ḍākiṇīs. Body not fixed to one earth, circling Jambudvīpa. Divine and human special assemblies make offering fields. When teaching harm arises, body light, face hūṃ, eyes fire arise reversing. Mind teaching time vajra dwells in Vajrasana sky. Letters in angry sage cave. Body in thirty-three gods' measureless palace, stacked Vajra-holding house. Three emanations dwelling thus makes Jambudvīpa supreme among others. Geographical specificity grounds cosmology in sacred geography.
[411-425] Twelve emanations in twelve locations structure. Vajradhara from sambhogakāya as nirmāṇakāya, for purifying beings' five aggregates, five perfections' nature twelve times appearing. First: field Kuśavati, perfect place lotus flower center, teacher youth Svaraprabhāsa Inconceivable came. Good Eon this, thousand Buddhas and two bodhisattvas taming, indicated by thousand light-appearance Buddhas and two hundred surrounding, perfect retinue. Teaching root all sgra thal 'gyur tantra. Life-span immeasurable time taught. Divine son Joy-Power-Lord and Sun-Great-Light compiler. Second: field world Unpleasant, teacher youth Akṣobhya light from five-colored egg born. Sequential structure enumerates specific teachers, places, teachings.
[426-435] Third to fourth emanations. Third: perfect place heat-moisture gathering light-surrounded, teacher fear-protecting-mind, retinue two hundred-thousand bodhisattvas, teachings Khor ba dong sprugs, rMa bya mjing bsnol, four elements exhaustion tantras, life-span hundred million. Fourth: perfect place desire-arising womb-appearance, teacher youth play variously compassionate, retinue yakṣas and rock-demons thousand one, teachings mind section root five tantras, branch six tantras, eleven, life-span eighty thousand. Sequential narrative maintains cosmological structure.
[436-455] Fifth to sixth emanations. Fifth: perfect place life-sustaining youth garden, teacher sixth Vajradhara, retinue seven Buddha lineages appearing self-arranged, teachings six pāramitās, life-span seventy thousand. Sixth: perfect place Meru north charnel ground Mirage-Blazing, teacher youth hero great powerful, retinue bodhisattvas cloud-momentum seven, ḍākiṇīs, gods, nāgas immeasurable, teachings rig pa rang shar chen po tantra etc., manifest luminous tantras, other immeasurable, life-span sixty thousand. Continuation maintains fivefold perfection structure.
[456-460] Seventh emanation. Perfect place rākṣasa land Ru-lu sound-having cave, teacher sage angry king, retinue rākṣasas hundred million, teachings rags pa 'dul ba'i rgyud ten etc. Sequential enumeration continues with specific details.
[461-473] Eighth to tenth emanations. Eighth: perfect place Vulture Peak, teacher gSer 'od dam pa, retinue immeasurable noble śrāvakas, teachings vinaya hundred-thousand, life-span five thousand. Ninth: perfect place Mongolian turquoise eyebrow land, Bodhi tree location, teacher brTse bas rol pa'i blo gros, retinue immeasurable bodhisattvas, teachings 'Phra rgyud seven etc., life-span thousand. Tenth: perfect place Vulture Peak, teacher 'Od srung bgres po, retinue seven āyuṣmat etc., teachings sūtra, kriyā, lung a nu etc. eighty-thousand, life-span five hundred. Sequential narrative continues with specific geographic and doctrinal details.
[474-509] Eleventh to twelfth emanations and verse citation. Eleventh: perfect place Vajrasana, teacher mNgon rdzogs rgyal po, retinue three-family protectors, teachings nges pa don gyi theg pa only, life-span three hundred. Twelfth: perfect place Vārāṇasī etc., teacher Śākya thub pa, teachings three baskets etc., retinue śrāvakas, bodhisattvas, gods, nāgas etc., time life-span hundred. These from Rig pa rang shar chen po'i rgyud, beginningless time: My jewel treasure lost, from lost jewel nature, from dark-light interval came, four conditions impure view, came to Kuśavati field, support pure lotus, secret mantra great tantra teaching established, close retinue Akṣobhya, tantra king thal 'gyur explained. Citation from root tantra establishes authority for emanation sequence.
[510-518] Reference to Ati bkod pa chen po as extensive source. Thirty-six inexhaustible body-speech-mind ornament wheel activities. Body outer four activities: birth, struggle, illusion contest, manifestation, mendicant practice—all intending abandonment of four sufferings. 'Di dag gi'ang signals continuation of activity enumeration. Sdug bsngal gyi chu bo bzhi as four rivers of suffering establishes pedagogical purpose behind activities.
[519-531] Body inner and secret four activities. Inner four: abandoning retinue and enjoyment, best horse, abandoning vehicle, going to Bodhi essence, opening light rays, transforming weapon rain to flowers—all intending abandonment. Secret four: intending final teaching samādhi taming, doing asceticism, samādhi sound hundred-thousand twenty in Gser ldan mountain in single moment manifesting, always abiding in rin po che za ma tog samādhi, vajra-like samādhi attaining enlightenment. Detailed samādhi names require technical precision.
[532-546] Speech activities enumeration. Outer four: sūtra section, verse teaching, prophecy, verse section. Inner four: extensive, birth stories, episode narratives, thus-arisen. Secret four: intentional teaching, realization expression, established teaching, marvelous section. Twelvefold scripture classification structure. Technical terms for scripture categories must be preserved.
[547-564] Mind activities and trikāya activity synthesis. Mind outer four samādhis: Heroic Going, Jewel Top, Various Play, Za ma tog. Inner four: entering all objects, manifest appearance, crown jewel, Banner Peak arrangement. Secret four: moving purity, profound appearance, Jewel Lamp, Supreme Excellent. Emanation body, sambhogakāya, dharmakāya combined activities one hundred eight appearing. Complete enumeration of thirty-six activities times three kāyas.
[565-573] Single essence multiple emanations. These called Victor's intention transmission sequence. Single Vajradhara appearing at different times, contained in one intention or tantra. Future Good Eon guides different emanations but single essence Vajradhara nature. Dgongs pas brgyud pa as mind transmission signals direct non-verbal lineage. Ngo bo gcig pa as single essence maintains unity despite diversity. Future Buddhas share same essence.
[574-576] Transition to field arrangement topic. From Treasury of Supreme Vehicle, origin manner establishment, first chapter. Having explained taming teacher's history, now teacher's taming place determination, first field and vessel-content sequence. Marks transition from teacher enumeration to cosmological description.
[577-577] Cosmogonic narrative. Vajradhara qualities-complete nature becoming enlightened, from dharmakāya arising as sambhogakāya, from five-family bodies, immeasurable fields arranged, central Vairocana adorned essence supported, from numberless fields, upon jewel lotus twenty-five stacked appearing thirteenth abides Jambudvīpa. Sequential cosmogony: dharmakāya to sambhogakāya to specific field manifestation.
01 01 03 01
[578-584] Cosmogonic narrative. Vajradhara qualities-complete nature becoming enlightened, from dharmakāya arising as sambhogakāya, from five-family bodies, immeasurable fields arranged, central Vairocana adorned essence supported, from numberless fields, upon jewel lotus twenty-five stacked appearing thirteenth abides Jambudvīpa. Sequential cosmogony: dharmakāya to sambhogakāya to specific field manifestation. dharmakāya register—primordial nature spontaneously displaying.
[585-594] Thirteen field enumeration from sGra thal 'gyur. Above-below-directions-intermediate spaces adorned luminous-clarity jewel fields thirteen exist. First field below this world called Thal ba dbyangs, extent immeasurable beautifully adorned, cause-condition-nature, teacher's teaching retinue, above-below-directions-intermediate spaces, small delightful beautifully adorned. Enumeration establishing topology of recognition. Numbers pedagogical, not ontological.
[595-605] Second field enumeration. Six worlds below called Thal ba 'dzin, wheel-form pervading, teacher's teaching truth, beautifully adorned second. From this world three to the right called Thal ba skyob, mother maiden fully adorned, light color clearly distinct, teacher's teaching taming field, individual karma and marks. Thal ba retained as technical term. Etymology addressed in commentary layer.
[606-614] Third field enumeration. Six worlds above called Thal ba brdal, lotus-expanded form-like, very pervading equal dwelling, various blazing colors, white-red appearance swirling, coarse form reflections not appearing, teacher's teaching Abhidharma expanded, eon complete Thal called. Field names must remain consistent across all sections.
[615-622] Fourth field enumeration. From this world above, nineteen passed above, called Thal ba'i be con, completely surrounded delightful, jewel fragments various, certainly adorned heap manner, teacher's teaching complete two possessing, skull garland arrangement.
[623-634] Fifth to seventh fields enumeration. From this world north-east intermediate called Thal ba'i rgyun, stūpa form-like steps beautiful, five arrangements fully adorned, sound melodies various arising basis, teacher's teaching time-arising by that. Above that twenty-one called completely Thal pervading, conception pure nature, outer-inner without completely pervading appearance, teacher's teaching arising showing, doing cause-condition pervading. Detailed cosmological geography with thirteen fields enumerated. All 58 source lines covered. No translation risks identified beyond standard cosmological terminology.
01 02 01 01
[635-644] Field continuation verse. From this world south-east left, world-realm six beyond, Thal ba'i sgra called, savior 'Phan fully trained, victory banner umbrella etc. raised, flower fragment rain and scent, teacher himself and teaching, beautiful form reflections surrounding, bliss play arising. From this world south-west right, six below Thal ba wind, moving shaking space within, mutually moving hovering and, shaking from sounds arising, teacher's teaching wind moving, five possessing entering three. Detailed directional cosmology continues. The phrase five possessing entering three is ambiguous in Tibetan. Commentary interprets as five elements or aggregates and three doors of body, speech, and mind, but could also reference five wisdoms entering three realms. Context suggests the former interpretation fits the cosmological exposition, mapping elemental emergence to the three doors of action.
[645-657] Remaining fields enumeration. Above that thirteen stacked, rin chen thal ba called, auspicious suns adorned, desirable qualities ornamented, magical letters marks beautiful, teacher's teaching form reflection complete, Ldal ldhi lotus eyes beautiful. Thal-ba retained as technical term rather than translating as dust or powder. While thal literally means dust or ashes, in this context it functions as a proper name for the field category. Scholar layer provides etymological analysis. Ldal ldhi, also written lda ldi, is a plant said to grow in pure lands with no standardized English equivalent. Retaining phonetic rendering with explanatory note in commentary.
[658-665] North-west intermediate field. From this north-west intermediate, world-realm six, 'Dul ba'i thal ba called, offering complete with goddess, light filled sandalwood scent, teacher's teaching partial equal, sixteen years possessing beautiful form, very youthful surrounded. The directional schema combines cardinal points with intermediate spaces. This reflects Indian cosmological models adapted to Tibetan understanding. The six transcendent realms consistently mark field locations, suggesting a vertical coordinate system overlaid on directional geography.
[666-682] Final two fields. Below that nine world, Dung ldan thal ba'i lha called, faith protecting scent intoxicated, swirling very blazing light, very flaming fire blazing, teacher himself and teaching, that retinue and enjoyment complete. From this world six, Star thal ba called, wheel stacked form, five and nine fully stacked, moon water waves ornamented, thunder sound lightning red tongues emitting, teacher's teaching scripture surrounded, light arising garland naga lineage, directions and intermediate all illuminating. Cosmological verse concludes detailed field description. The pattern of five-and-nine appears in multiple field descriptions. Five represents five elements, wisdoms, or perfections. Nine represents nine vehicles or stages. Stacked together they form complete path structure. The Tibetan preference for enumerative completeness manifests in these multiplied combinations.
[683-693] Twenty-five stacked lotus dwelling directions-intermediate-above-below numberless fields pervading. Like scattered stars. From immeasurable fields explaining this Jambudvīpa sequence. Citation: external elements from wind, joining space element, then water, then earth. Extent 100,000 yojanas, thickness even. Four immeasurables and 100,000. One is four parts empty. Cosmological formation from elements: wind to space to water to earth. Yojana rendered as league following standard Buddhist lexicography, though actual measurement varies. The text's cosmological measurements are symbolic rather than empirical, suggesting retention of traditional units rather than metric conversion. The elemental sequence follows Abhidharmakośa cosmogony with tantric elaboration. The four immeasurables here refers to spatial directions, distinct from the brahmavihāras, though the pun may be intentional.
[694-711] Continued cosmological description. Continents arrangement and Meru, wish-fulfilling tree and jewel possessing, sun moon individual gods and, great ocean method surrounded, small mountains and water-small, seven jewels certainly surrounded. Inside formless first from, form realm clear light, distant desire realm also, stainless moon and, sun great illuminating from, world realm expanded, other-power etc. above sequentially, then asura abodes, four continents humans sequentially, afflictions self possessing, lower realm abodes sequentially established. Standard Buddhist cosmology enumerated. Method surrounded uses thabs typically translated as method or skillful means but here functions as a verb meaning surrounded by or encircled by. Contextual interpretation: surrounded by the ocean which is the method or condition for world's existence. Other-power equals Paranirmitavaśavartin, rendered traditionally. Asura equals not-gods, maintaining Tibetan etymology where possible. Systematic decision to preserve Tibetan technical terms where English equivalents lack nuance.
[712-730] Mu tig phreng ba'i rgyud citation. Sky wind supported, upon that water, hundred-thousand eleven, round coiling indeed established, from milk cream arising like, earth hundred-thousand twelve. Wind number 100,000. Wind gathering-contracting-projecting-lifting. Water pervading-holding-ripening three. Earth grinding-subtle-coarse three. Stirred down becoming like, mountain between mountain king, four steps great pinnacle, encircling ocean and mountains seven, continents and surrounding established, three thousand etc. realms. Desire form formless by, three realms that depending, neither existence nor nothing and, consciousness slight without, formless realm that from arisen. Pure abodes etc. embodied, above to below dripping manner, Akanishta etc. desire. Gods asuras humans, high then three abodes, animals hungry ghosts hells, those sentient beings birth four. That also eon first humans, form and youth marks possessing, self-light radiance body pervading, desire-increasing etc. merit food, beings life 80,000, male and female organs without. Then confusion cause two from, desire etc. afflictions, gradually coarse indeed became, senses etc. doors solid, merit exhausted therefore light etc. diminish, then gradually earth oil, Sālu etc. food eat. Detailed cosmological and anthropological narrative from pearl garland tantra. Muktikā or Mu tig phreng ba, the Pearl Garland Tantra, citation confirmed in various Tibetan collections. The embryological-cosmological parallel of cream from milk equaling earth from churning reflects traditional Indian homological thinking of microcosm-macrocosm correspondence. Wind 110,000 versus Earth 120,000 presents measurement discrepancy. Commentary addresses symbolic numerology while literal interpretation risks reification. Earth oil refers to primordial nutrient, sometimes translated as earth-essence or ground-nectar. Context suggests pre-agricultural sustenance. Sālu is a rice variety, rendered simply as rice with note that this marks transition to agricultural food sources in degeneration narrative.
[731-756] Transition to specific Jambudvīpa cosmology. Common sūtras describe general features; uncommon tantras measure extensively. Here explained according to unsurpassed vehicle Vajra Pinnacle. From Ati bkod pa chen po establishing unmistaken meaning of actually-abiding entities. Great Brahmā field containing sky, Great Ocean hand lotus center pistils twenty-five trichiliocosms stacked abiding fields called ground-essence flower-adorned field. From within that thirteenth heart-center dPal gyi be'u nearby abides secret mantra vajra vehicle field Jambudvīpa this arrangement. Eon first forming, middle abiding, final destroying, finally empty four knowable. First forming vessel-content two sequences, vessel forming sequence: near here previously arisen world empty intermediate eon twenty passed below, element seed particles unclear color five arising sphere sky empty, above formless realm consciousness apprehending object arising element seed particles with dripping manner content above forming like, below vessel sequence stūpa steps like forming manner. The triad of sources of common, uncommon, and unsurpassed established at 757-760 guides translation approach. Unsurpassed vehicle perspective privileges Dzogchen interpretation over literal cosmography. Ati koṭa chen po or Great Ati Arrangement is a key Dzogchen source text. Retaining Sanskrit-Tibetan hybrid as established convention. Hand lotus center pistils presents complex mandala geometry. Pistils equals lotus heart or essence. Multiple nested spatial metaphors require careful English layering to avoid confusion. Element seed particles refers to subtle matter preceding manifest elements. Translation attempts to preserve seed metaphor while indicating pre-manifest state.
[757-780] Hermeneutical triad establishing framework. Common sutras describe general features; uncommon tantras measure extensively. Here explained according to unsurpassed vehicle Vajra Pinnacle. From Ati bkod pa chen po establishing unmistaken meaning of actually-abiding entities. Actually-abiding uses dngos po meaning entity, thing, or reality, contrasted with dngos med meaning non-thing or emptiness. The unmistaken claims ontological correspondence between description and reality, a claim Delusion layer appropriately problematizes. Retain actually-abiding to preserve philosophical precision, though reality or entities might read more smoothly. Scholar layer addresses ontological implications.
[781-806] Detailed wind formation. Seed syllable A uṃ sound three times renowned gives rise to suppressing-appearance wind, mouse black mouth's breath just rising, clouding sky like mist-cloud mass. Various vajra crossed form center yaṃ marked, four wind goddesses holding wind banners, color various blazing light, wind realm green indranīla form, vast thick forming, eon duration unmoving lifting strength showing. Extent dpag tshad 108,000, width 160,000. Water formation: gold essence cloud seven years rain stream, clear unmoving silt water round like full moon, water goddess dancing immeasurable, extent 112,000, width 5,000. Intermediate eon wind maṇḍala below grinding wind crushing sound, stirring water and wind, cream like gold ground 5,000, earth-forming earth 5,000, earth's fire 20,000. A uṃ or A-um rendering indicates sacred syllable status. Alternative AH-ŪṂ would be Sanskritized. Selected former as closer to Tibetan pronunciation while maintaining recognition as seed syllable. Mouse black mouth's breath presents vivid but bizarre imagery. Mouse-striped or speckled mouse modifying breath. Context suggests subtlety of mouse breath barely perceptible. Retained literal rendering with note in commentary. Wind 108,000 equals 100,000 plus 8,000. Tibetan sa ya equals 100,000. Systematic rendering maintains numerical integrity for scholar analysis.
[807-841] Ocean wave separation. Sky wind particles immeasurable descend like space snow, become 100,000. Above that earth-supporting space turquoise color, sky particles fall swirling, natural action like ocean cloth, pervading equal dwelling, four-cornered form, four corners earth goddess four gold vases holding, four sides nāga sons powerful holding. Extent 110,000, depth 41,000. Element maṇḍalas like stūpa steps dependent formation. Sūtras explain intermediate sky divided equally. Fire maṇḍala 5,000 lifted, center fire extent 1,000 width 50,000, red light, common element ripening action. Water pervading shows beings' action particular. Fire ripening clarifies beings' body color. Wind particle completes beings' senses. Sky space opening abides beings' mind. Earth pressing shows beings' action and merit. These called vessel benefiting content. Nāga retained versus serpent spirit as established Buddhist technical term. Maṇḍala used throughout for dkyil 'khor meaning center-periphery or wholeness. Vessel benefiting content uses snod kyis bcud la phan pa where container benefits contained. Cosmological physiology: world-system as vessel creates conditions for beings as contents. The five elemental actions of water-ripening, fire-clarifying, wind-completing, space-opening, and earth-stabilizing establish homological framework connecting cosmos and body, addressed extensively in commentary layer.
[842-872] Meru formation. Golden wheel form self-nature shaking power rising churns earth-water, like butter from milk dust impurity becomes gold sinking ground-base, clear rising center Meru 160,000 high, down gold ground pierced 320,000 total. Some tantras: down 12,400. Meru four directions: east silver, south vaiḍūrya, west padmarāga, north gold, sky colors harmonious. Meru gold ground 80,000 half below water, above half four steps stacked, lower wind step turquoise vajra crossed called g.yu'i rdo rje can, extent 80,000 equal to water, outside Meru 16,000 high, depth triple equal, width each up 10,000. Second step water lotus heap crystal blazing, outside Meru 8,000. Third step wheel stacked gold, outside 4,000. Fourth step jewel blazing coral fire light red, outside 2,000, showing rain falling or not by beings' action. Meru height discrepancy between main text at 320,000 total and some tantras at 12,400. Both preserved as textual evidence of variant traditions. Four directions equal four elements or precious substances: silver for east and clarity, vaidūrya for south and expansion, padmarāga for west and passion transformed, gold for north and wealth. Colors correspond to directional psychology. Step or bang rim equals stūpa terrace. Four steps equal four stages of material manifestation from wind to water to fire to earth ascending. Commentary provides symbolic interpretation.
[873-891] Seven gold mountains and oceans. Seven gold mountains inside sequential: gNya' shing 'dzin, gShol mda' 'dzin, Seng ldeng can, Blta na sdug, Rta rna, Rnam 'dud, Mu khyud 'dzin, from water gap rising: 40,000, 20,000, 5,000, 2,500, 1,350, 625. Width each equals height. Between eight oceans surrounding, great nāga eight sporting. First play ocean width 80,000, subsequent half by half, depth triple. Outer surrounding iron formed, equal to gNya' shing 'dzin, some equal to Mu khyud 'dzin. Outer ocean four directions width 120,000. Continents: east lus 'phags moon-land protrusion 350, other sides 2,000, lus and lus 'phags right left supporting main half half. Jambudvīpa srog mkhar three sides 2,000 each long, short outside 4.5, right and left rnga yab main half half. West ba glang spyod round 7,500 surrounding, right g.yo ldan left lam mchog 'gro half half. North sgra mi snyan four corners four sides 2,000, right and left sgra mi snyan half half. This section contains the most intricate measurements in the text. Seven mountains with varying dimensions following halving sequence from 40,000 to 20,000 to 5,000 to 2,500 to 1,350 to 625. Continental geometries precise to fractional yojanas at 4.5. Tibetan proper names for mountains retained with descriptive translations available in commentary. Continent names standardized: Lū 'phags as Pūrvavideha, Ba lang spyod as Aparagodānīya, Sgra mi snyan as Uttarakuru. The measurement precision creates scientific impression that Delusion layer warns against literalizing. Translation preserves precision while commentary and other layers provide interpretive context.
[892-891] Completing cosmological description. Sun moon course and palace, four continents supporting etc. twenty-five features. Gods' palaces and sports, seven gold mountains up to Brahmā, four continents eight thousand, eight great oceans immeasurable extent, Meru king's all abodes features perfect, completely pure from five poisons. Ocean-like extent of great fields explanation. The twenty-five features mark completion of cosmological exposition. This completes cognitive documentation for section 01-02-01-01. All major line ranges covered with translator decisions, challenges, and source identifications noted for audit trail.
01 02 01 02
[892-898] Second section on half and quarter measures. Height and width dimensions continue in proportional divisions. Outer great surrounding iron ring composed of iron equal in height to Yoke-Holder mountain or according to some sources equal to Rim-Holder mountain.
[899-914] Outer ocean four directions each measure 120,000 leagues width. From the continents: east Pūrvavideha continent moon-land protrusion showing outward 350 leagues, other three sides 2,000 each. Lū and Pūrvavideha support right and left each half of main. Jambudvīpa srog mkhar three long sides 2,000 each, short outer side 4.5 leagues, right and left rnga yab each half of main. West Aparagodānīya round surrounding 7,500 leagues, right g.yo ldan left lam mchog 'gro each half. North Uttarakuru four corners four sides 2,000 each, right and left Uttarakuru each half.
[915-926] Within these scope sentient beings' abodes specifically explained countless even to mention, summarized roughly: lower realms and higher realms, two. Lower realms first hells: below Gang ri Ti se down 20,000 leagues measured yang sos etc. eight hot hells and chu bur can etc. eight cold hells side surrounding. Nearby realms: earth water fire wind various without certainty. Nearby surrounding: two sets of eight surrounding. Pretas: king's city below 500 leagues root abode exists, branches in gods-humans' world also. Animals: deep abiding great ocean butter spread merely, scattered gods-humans' land also.
[927-941] Asuras: Mount Meru's water gap below hollow space. Gods: Mount Meru's steps above upper increasingly exist. Also seven mountains four great kings lineage gods' city and parks immeasurable. Particularly great yakṣas gser rkang, stobs ldan, 'jug srid, grags pa'i dpal, ri 'degs, mchog srid seven stacked houses each with surrounding city, in Jambudvīpa sending human disease, livestock disease, weapons, famine eons doing good and bad. Their surrounding rengs byed ma mo seven abiding controlling individual actions.
[942-952] Eight oceans eight nāga kings' palaces: dGa' bo, nye dga', rta'i gzhi, btang bzung, gzī can, yul 'khor srung, nag po chen po, e la'i 'dab showing rain.
[953-959] These show Jambudvīpa great rain, small rain etc. actions. Mount Meru's step four corners: four powerful yakṣas holding time palaces exist. These do four seasons sequential actions: summer rain falling, autumn grain, flower ripening, winter cold cool, spring warm ripening.
[960-975] Also wind goddesses four etc. beings: content beings common superior, collective action accomplished, existence action beings called. First world forming equal, finally destroying equal, life eon-abiding called. Asuras root abode Mount Meru's hollow, gods rivaling fortune possessing. Gold ground above asuras' city gser ldan various jewels composed center: dbang po'i khang bzang gdams pa can, 'dun sa nor bzang, directional parks good joy, rab tu dga', kun dga' ra ba, dga' ba'i kun dga' ra ba. Ground name also like that, trees' best ci tri pa, stone slab rab tu bzang, elephants' best Ti se snow, bzod par dka', horses' best rab myur.
[976-996] Enjoyment joy, trees, parks, horses, elephants, clothes, jewels, nectar drinks etc. also immeasurable. Desire gods' abode six: four great kings seven mountains eight surrounding, sun moon planets nine, four continents' center snow mountain parks city ten sporting. Four steps also exist: first step yol go holding gods, second flower garland, third bee honey intoxicated, fourth 'phags skyes po, spyan mi bzang, rnam thos, yul 'khor srung with retinues.

[997-997] Single-line subsection marker. Wylie: gnyis pa la me tog gi phreng ba thogs pa'i lha dang*/ Structural function: section transition. Register: structural marker.
01 02 01 04
[998-998] Single-line subsection marker. Wylie: gsum pa la sbrang chang gis rtag tu myos pa'i lha dang*/ Structural function: section transition. Register: structural marker.
01 02 01 05
[999-1002] Structural function establishes the four directional guardians ('phags skyes po, spyan mi bzang, rnam thos kyi bu, yul 'khor srung) as cosmological boundary markers within the thirty-three god realm framework. These four great kings (rgyal chen bzhi) serve as both protective deities and pedagogical symbols for meditative visualization practice, representing the administrative structure of the desire realm cosmos. Each guardian maintains specific directional responsibilities with attendant retinues that establish the outer boundary of the Trayastrimsa heaven. View register presents these beings as embodiments of the four immeasurables—loving-kindness, compassion, sympathetic joy, and equanimity—manifested in form to protect practitioners and maintain cosmic order. Translation risks obscure the technical classification of these beings as lha yi gtso bo (divine chiefs) rather than mere mythological figures, potentially reducing their significance to folkloric status when they actually represent sophisticated psychological principles. Preservation requirements maintain the precise enumeration of their retinues and spatial positioning as essential for ritual cosmology reconstruction, ensuring that future practitioners can accurately visualize the protective mandala structure.
[1003-1007] Structural function details the architectural specifications of divine palaces ('khor) and parks (skye mos tshal) through measurable material descriptions that serve as supports for meditation practice. The gold ground (gser gyi sa gzhi) spread with sandalwood water (tsan dan gyi chu) creates an environment of sensory refinement that corresponds to the mental pliancy achieved in advanced concentration states. The divine mandara flowers covering the ground to knee depth establish a specific visual field for meditation, while the beautiful ponds filled with flowers provide cooling water features that symbolize the pacification of afflictive emotions. View register presents these as visualization supports rather than literal geographical claims, emphasizing the pedagogical function of precise measurement in training the mind's capacity for vivid mental creation. Translation risks misrepresent gser gyi sa gzhi and tsan dan gyi chu as merely poetic flourishes rather than technical terminology for meditative concentration objects that correspond to specific mental factors. Preservation requirements note the specific dimensions and material compositions serve as standardized references for generation stage practice, ensuring consistency across translation traditions and meditation lineages.
[1008-1019] Structural function establishes the sun and moon palaces with precise measurements (51 and 50 yojanas respectively) as foundational cosmological elements that structure the entire desire realm. The sun palace's base of fire crystal (me shel) and the moon's self-arisen water crystal (chu shel las rang byung) embody the complementary principles of method and wisdom, heat and coolness, activity and stability. The gold and silver fences surrounding these celestial residences, along with the four jewels at their pinnacles and divine city adornments, create a complete mandala structure that mirrors the inner architecture of subtle body channels and chakras. View register presents these celestial bodies as both physical entities and symbolic representations of method and wisdom in dynamic interplay, demonstrating how external cosmos reflects internal psychophysical processes. Translation risks obscure the technical distinction between nyi ma'i gzhal med khang and zla ba chu shel las rang byung, potentially conflating them with generic astronomical references when they actually represent specific stages of meditative experience. Preservation requirements maintain the specific materials (me shel, chu shel) and measurements that establish the hierarchical cosmological structure and its correspondence to subtle body geography.
[1020-1037] Structural function centers on Mount Meru as the cosmological axis with the thirty-three god realm (sum cu rtsa gsum pa) situated at its summit, establishing the administrative center of the desire realm. The fivefold classification of abodes—city (grong), park (tshal), ground (sa gzhi), trees (shing), and assembly hall ('dun sa)—creates a comprehensive architectural grammar for understanding divine realms and their functional differentiation. The central Victorious Palace (rnam par rgyal ba'i khang bzangs) with its eight-layer foundation and seven-story structure, surrounded by four parks with jewel trees, birds, and ponds, establishes a complete mandala environment for divine activity. View register presents Meru rtsa mo as the unified field from which all manifestation extends, reflecting the Dzogchen principle of spontaneous presence where all appearance arises from the single ground of being without ever departing from it. Translation risks reduce dbang po'i pho brang 'khor to merely Indra's palace rather than recognizing it as the central organizing principle of the desire realm that demonstrates how merit and concentration create experiential environments. Preservation requirements note the fivefold classification establishes the architectural grammar for understanding divine realms, providing the template for visualization practices and cosmological understanding.
[1038-1058] Structural function details the four equal parks (skye mos tshal) surrounding the central city with specific directional attributes and aesthetic qualities that complete the mandala structure. Each park extends twenty yojanas in the four directions from the central city, creating a balanced environment of 250 yojanas width where divine beings engage in playful activity (rol pa) without attachment. The parks feature wish-fulfilling trees, divine musical instruments, nectar, jewel nets, and divine sons and daughters engaged in song and cymbals, creating an environment of total sensory satisfaction that transcends yet includes ordinary sense pleasures. View register presents these as the playful display (rol pa) of enlightened appearance, emphasizing enjoyment without attachment as the natural expression of realized awareness rather than something to be rejected or suppressed. Translation risks misrepresent blta na sdug as merely beautiful rather than technically referring to the quality of immediate aesthetic satisfaction that arises when perception is free from grasping. Preservation requirements maintain the precise measurements (250 yojanas width) and the specific directional parks that constitute the complete mandala structure, ensuring that the cosmological template remains intact for ritual and meditative purposes.
[1059-1067] Structural function introduces the cosmic tree yongs 'dus brtol as a central axis marker with specific measurements (5 yojanas down, 100 up) and surrounding canopy (50 yojanas) that establishes a vertical dimension to the horizontal mandala layout. The jewel net and divine garments adorning the tree represent the spontaneous display of rigpa, while the ar moni stone slab beneath serves as the specific meditation seat (dbang po'i khri) for the chief deity. The flower rain falling from above creates an atmosphere of continuous blessing and purification that permeates the entire environment. View register presents this tree as the union of space and awareness, with its extensive root system representing the profound depth of wisdom and its spreading branches embodying the vast extent of compassionate activity. Translation risks obscure the technical significance of the ar moni stone slab beneath the tree as a specific meditation seat, potentially reducing it to merely a mythological detail when it actually represents the immovable ground of realization. Preservation requirements note the tree's branches forming an umbrella-like canopy establishes a spatial metaphor for enlightened activity radiating in all directions while remaining centered in non-dual awareness.
[1068-1075] Structural function describes the arrangement of desire and form realm gods above the celestial bodies like arrays of stars and planets, establishing a hierarchical stacking that extends upward through increasingly refined states of consciousness. The width doubling at each level creates a pyramidal structure where the distance from Jambudvipa to the Thirty-Three equals the distance from Thirty-Three to Conflict-Free heaven, demonstrating proportional relationships throughout the cosmos. This spatial arrangement reflects the graduated refinement of consciousness, where higher realms correspond to subtler states of meditative absorption and less coarse manifestation. View register presents this hierarchical stacking as illustrating the graduated refinement of consciousness, demonstrating how meditative stability creates corresponding experiential environments free from the grosser afflictions of lower realms. Translation risks misrepresent the spatial relationships as literal geographical distances rather than qualitative distinctions in consciousness that reflect different degrees of conceptual grasping and mental stability. Preservation requirements maintain the precise measurements (80,000 yojanas) that establish proportional relationships between realms, creating a coherent cosmological system that maps internal meditative experience to external spatial descriptions.
[1076-1082] Structural function presents the cosmological vessel world (snod kyi 'jig rten) during the intermediate eon as empty of beings but filled with mountains, trees, grass, flowers, and forests, creating the prepared environment awaiting consciousness habitation. The sequential description of elemental interaction—rain falling from the sky, jewel trees expanding, nectar rain producing earth vapor—establishes the dependent origination framework for understanding how world systems emerge from the interdependence of elements and consciousness. This process demonstrates the Buddhist understanding of cosmological evolution as driven by collective karma rather than divine creation or random accident. View register emphasizes this as the ground of potentiality before manifestation, reflecting the Dzogchen view of spontaneous presence awaiting recognition, where the world exists as the display of awareness ready to be cognized but not yet fixated upon as external. Translation risks reduce the description to mere geological formation rather than recognizing it as the preparation of the vessel for consciousness habitation, the stage where the stage is set for the play of appearance to begin. Preservation requirements note the sequence of elemental interaction establishes the dependent origination framework, demonstrating how Buddhist cosmology integrates scientific observation with spiritual insight into the interdependent nature of all phenomena.
[1083-1093] Structural function describes the emergence of beings through the interaction of wind goddesses, water goddesses dancing, and powerful naga forces, culminating in the awakening of latent consciousness from formless potential through Padma's speech sound pervading all directions. This cosmogonic process demonstrates the gradual densification of awareness from subtle to coarse, maintaining the continuity between formless and formed existence while showing how consciousness projects external worlds through its own movement. The samadhi emanation body (ting nge 'dzin gyi sprul pa'i lus) emerges as neither existent nor non-existent, establishing the illusory nature of all manifestation. View register presents this as the gradual densification of awareness from subtle to coarse, maintaining the continuity between formless and formed existence while demonstrating how consciousness itself creates the worlds it inhabits through the power of habitual tendency and karmic momentum. Translation risks obscure the technical process of consciousness awakening (sad de) from the bbag la nyal (latency) state, potentially reducing it to mythological storytelling when it actually describes the mechanics of how pure awareness becomes entangled in its own display. Preservation requirements maintain the citation from Guhyagarbha Tantra that establishes the ultimate source of manifestation as the sugata essence (bde gshegs snying po), grounding this cosmology in the highest tantric authority and connecting it to the view of Dzogchen.
[1094-1100] Structural function establishes the samadhi emanation body (ting nge 'dzin gyi sprul pa'i lus) as neither existent nor non-existent, appearing only through the power of meditative concentration and the collective karma of beings ready to perceive it. These beings abide on the lotus-stacked sky (padma rnam par brtsegs pa'i nam mkha'), occupying the intermediate position between formless and formed realms where consciousness has not yet fully solidified into coarse embodiment. The fourfold negation (yod min med min gnyis min) points directly to the nature of appearance as beyond all conceptual categories, neither truly existing as independent entities nor completely non-existent as mere nothingness. View register presents this as the bridge between pure presence and apparent manifestation, demonstrating the illusory nature of all formed existence while acknowledging the undeniable fact of experience. Translation risks misrepresent the fourfold negation as philosophical abstraction rather than direct pointing to the nature of appearance as it actually is, beyond all conceptual fabrication. Preservation requirements note the beings' residence on the lotus-stacked sky establishes the intermediate position between formless and formed realms, a crucial transitional space in the cosmological hierarchy that reflects the subtle states of meditative experience.
[1101-1108] Structural function describes the golden vajra rising from the lower realms and the subsequent emanation of beings who see its beauty, establishing the Heroic Going Samadhi (dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin) as a distinct meditative state characterized by aesthetic appreciation and confidence. The progression from seeing the vajra to mind moving to beings arising establishes the mechanics of emanation and perception, demonstrating how the recognition of beauty triggers the creative process of manifestation. These beings represent a subtle refinement from the previous emanation body beings, having developed the capacity for appreciative perception that corresponds to increased meditative stability. View register presents this as the progressive refinement of recognition, where coarse perception gives way to subtler seeing, and the appreciation of beauty becomes a path to deeper realization rather than a distraction from it. Translation risks reduce the vajra to merely a mythological object rather than recognizing it as the symbol of indestructible awareness, the diamond-like nature of mind that cannot be destroyed by any external force or internal confusion. Preservation requirements note the specific sequence (seeing the vajra, mind moving, beings arising) establishes the mechanics of emanation and perception, providing insight into how consciousness continuously creates and inhabits worlds through the power of recognition and response.
[1109-1120] Structural function continues the cosmogonic narrative with the expansion of immeasurable beings from the perception-only state, establishing the consciousness base (rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye mched) as the interface between pure awareness and differentiated experience. The Jewel Casket Samadhi (rin po che za ma tog gi ting nge 'dzin) serves as the abode for these beings, providing a stable environment where consciousness can operate without yet fixating on coarse external objects. The distinction between ci yang med pa (nothing at all) and cung zad med pa (slightly nothing) establishes subtle gradations within the formless realm, demonstrating the precision of Buddhist phenomenological analysis. View register presents this as the play of awareness mistaking its own display for external objects, the fundamental error at the root of samsara that begins with the subtle grasping at perception itself as truly existing. Translation risks misrepresent ci yang med pa and cung zad med pa as nihilistic negations rather than technical terms for subtle gradations of formless existence that correspond to specific meditative attainments. Preservation requirements maintain the distinction between perception-only ('du shes tsam) and actual non-existence that establishes the Yogacara influence on this cosmology, demonstrating how Buddhist philosophy integrates multiple perspectives on the nature of consciousness and reality.
[1121-1133] Structural function establishes the connection between this common vehicle cosmological presentation and the Dzogchen view of spontaneous presence (lhun grub) and primordial purity (kadag). The beings in these realms are not truly newly born, as their fundamental nature as rigpa has never been separate from the expanse of reality (dbyings), even when obscured by co-emergent ignorance (lhan skyes ma rig pa). The four elements expressed through the term dbyings demonstrate how the ultimate ground manifests as the apparent world without ever departing from its own nature. The citations from Guhyagarbha Tantra and the Condensed Perfection of Wisdom establish the scriptural authority for this cosmological framework while pointing toward its ultimate resolution in the recognition of mind nature. View register presents this as the acknowledgment that even this elaborate cosmology remains within conventional truth, pointing toward the ultimate view of Dzogchen where all manifestation is the spontaneous play of awareness never departing from the ground of being. Translation risks obscure the citation from Guhyagarbha Tantra (e ma ho bde gshegs snying po las) that grounds this cosmology in tantric authority, potentially severing the connection between this descriptive cosmology and its ultimate purpose as a support for recognizing mind nature. Preservation requirements note the distinction between this common vehicle presentation and the Dzogchen view of spontaneous presence that transcends sequential causation, ensuring that readers understand both the conventional accuracy and ultimate emptiness of this cosmological description.
[1134-1148] Structural function details the descent of beings from higher samadhi states through the sound of interacting wheels, establishing the consciousness base of infinite space (rnam shes mtha' yas kyi skye mched) as the first of the four formless realms. The wheels touching and producing self-arising sound creates the acoustic trigger for consciousness differentiation, demonstrating how subtle sensory experience initiates the process of coarse manifestation. These beings, falling from the peaceful abiding of one-pointed concentration, expand into countless forms through consciousness alone, establishing the pattern of how awareness proliferates into multiplicity while remaining fundamentally undivided. View register presents this as the progressive coarsening of consciousness, where undifferentiated awareness begins to grasp at appearances as external, initiating the cascade of dualistic perception that characterizes samsaric existence. Translation risks misrepresent the technical term skye mched (sense-base) as merely realm or abode rather than recognizing it as the interface between consciousness and apparent objects where the fundamental split between subject and object occurs. Preservation requirements maintain the precise description of wheel sounds (phrad pa'i sgra rang byung) as the acoustic trigger for consciousness differentiation, demonstrating the sophisticated Buddhist understanding of how sensory experience catalyzes the emergence of conceptual mind.
[1149-1172] Structural function establishes the gradual diminution of lifespan, body size, and light clarity as beings descend to lower realms, correlating these qualities with the strength of samadhi and merit. The systematic correspondence between meditative stability and manifested qualities demonstrates the inverse relationship between conceptual grasping and manifest clarity—wherever mind becomes more fixated, appearance becomes more coarse and limited. The four formless realms—infinite space, infinite consciousness, nothingness, and peak of existence—with their specific lifespans ranging from 20,000 to 80,000 great eons, establish the complete map of subtle existence beyond coarse form. View register presents this as the inverse relationship between conceptual grasping and manifest clarity, demonstrating how distraction leads to densification while sustained attention creates spaciousness and longevity. Translation risks obscure the systematic correlation between meditative stability (ting nge 'dzin), merit strength (bsod nams kyi stobs), and manifested qualities, potentially reducing these relationships to poetic metaphor rather than precise phenomenological description. Preservation requirements note the four formless realms with their specific lifespans establish the complete map of subtle existence, providing essential reference points for understanding the full spectrum of possible experience from the most refined formless states to the coarsest material embodiments.
[1173-1198] Structural function addresses the apparent contradiction between formless realms and body appearance, resolving it through the understanding of samadhi light bodies that are not composed of flesh and blood but of the luminosity of concentrated mind. These beings, while appearing to have form from the perspective of lower realms, are actually consciousness-only abiding in the joy and pleasure of meditative absorption, demonstrating the continuity between formless consciousness and subtle form. The graduated hierarchy of form realm heavens—with body sizes ranging from 0.5 to 64 yojanas and lifespans from 1 to 64 intermediate kalpas—establishes precise quantitative distinctions between levels of meditative attainment. View register presents this as demonstrating the continuity between formless consciousness and subtle form, bridging the gap between pure awareness and manifestation while showing how the apparent contradiction dissolves upon deeper understanding. Translation risks misrepresent 'od gsal expanding as merely clear light rather than recognizing it as the transitional state between formless and formed existence where consciousness begins to show its own nature as appearance.
