01 06 13 01
[9518-9531] Dharmakāya teacher analysis: Glorious Samantabhadra as Dharmakāya teacher. Abode: chos kyi dbyings—dharmadhātu. Teaching: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi thugs kyi bstan pa—mind teaching of all buddhas. Retinue: 'dus ma byas pa—uncompounded. Time: chos nyid la 'pho 'gyur med—dharmatā without change. Five aspects establishing Dharmakāya: teacher, abode, teaching, retinue, time. Five perfections (phun sum tshogs pa lnga): brjod du med pa—ineffable, lhun gyis grub pa—spontaneously accomplished. Eight aspects: dbang bzhi'i sa bon bzhi—four empowerments' four seeds, 'bras bu bzhi—four results. Structural function: systematic taxonomy of Dharmakāya dimensions. View register: Dharmakāya as nature, not entity. Translation risk: reifying Dharmakāya as location or person. Preservation: Dharmakāya as chos sku—dharma body/nature—emptiness aspect.
[9532-9548] Saṃbhogakāya teacher: rnam par snang mdzad—Vairocana—at Gaṅgā Lake. Abode: rnam dag stug po bkod pa—dense array of pure realms. Teaching: rang byung gi yi ge drug—self-arisen six syllables (oṃ maṇi padme hūṃ)—rang sgra—self-sound—ljags kyi 'od zer—tongue's light rays—'phro ba bstan pa'i bu gcig—teaching-propagating single son. Retinue: nyid las mig pa rigs bzhi'i sangs rgyas—self-awareness eye four family buddhas. Time: rang bzhin rnam dag chen po—nature completely pure. Field: phyag mnyam gzhag gi mthil—hand equipoise palm—yas mar brtsegs pa'i nyi shu rtsa lnga—twenty-five stacked above below, skyil krung man chad la bcu drug—sixteen below vajra posture. These viewed as rgya deb brtsegs pa—stacked slates—pure sky between. Each mutually like gur khyim bkram pa—spread tent houses—divided by iron mountains and oceans. Dharma: rang gi ngo bo rnam dag chen po'i chos la spyod pa—engaging dharmas of completely pure own nature. Established: 'od dang kha dog sku dang ye shes la spyod pas—engaging light, color, form, wisdom—saṃbhogakāya. Also: 'od zer sbyor ba dag pa—pure light ray connection—yab kyi zhal nas zhugs—enter father's face—gsang ba'i gnas—secret place—yum gyi mkha la 'thon—exit mother's sky—sprul pa 'gyed pa—spread emanation. Five perfections, field and emanation making eight. Structural function: saṃbhogakāya as enjoyment body with elaborate cosmology. View register: saṃbhogakāya as spontaneous display, not constructed. Translation risk: stacked realms appearing literal geography. Preservation: bkod pa as array/display, not construction.
[9549-9558] Nirmāṇakāya teacher: drug pa rdo rje 'chang—sixth Vajradhara. Abode: ltsang lo can—Tuṣita—'og min gyi ming gi bye brag—Ogmin name distinction (Akanishta). Teaching: rang bzhin rdzogs pa chen po—Great Perfection nature. Retinue: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa—worldly and transcendent. Time: sku 'dul ba'i dus—body taming time. Field: rgya che ba tshangs chen—vast Brahma—from that khol bur phul ba—especially emerge—Jambudvīpa, gling bzhi—four continents—ri rab—Meru—with, bye ba phrag brgya—hundred million. Dharma: bstan pa dngos dang gzugs brnyan—teaching actual and reflection two. Established: gang la gang 'dul du sprul ba—emanating to whomever as tamed—nirmāṇakāya. Self and other benefit two activities eight. Structural function: nirmāṇakāya as compassionate emanation. View register: emanation as skillful means, not inferior reality. Translation risk: "sixth" suggesting hierarchy among kāyas. Preservation: drug pa as enumeration, not ranking.
[9559-9567] Svābhāvikakāya teacher: bsam brjod rnam par dag pa—pure thought expression. Abode: bsam 'das mtshan gzhi dang bral ba—thought-transcended, characteristics-ground free. Teaching: rdul med ching dri ma med pa—dust without, stain without. Retinue: ye shes rgya mtsho—wisdom ocean. Field: bde chen rnam dag—great bliss completely pure. Dharma: ngo 'byed pa med pa—face distinguishing without. Activity: sems nyid phyin ci log las 'das pa—mind itself perversion transcended. These eight natures as rtags kyi sku bzhi—marks' four kāyas: Dharmakāya teacher rang bzhin ma bcos pa—nature unfabricated. Abode: stong pa kun khyab—empty all-pervading. Teaching: 'dul stangs rnam dag—taming manner completely pure. Retinue: rang bzhin yongs dag—nature completely pure. Time: nges med sna tshogs—uncertain various. Dharma: zag pa rang zad—outflowing self-cease. Established: chos kyi phung po 'dus pas—dharma heap collected—chos sku—dharmakāya. Action: las bdag tu med pa'i las byed pa—action without self do action. Form kāya teacher sku snang la rang bzhin med pa—form appearance nature not—zhal kun tu thal le ba—face all slack. Abode: phyid dang nang med pa kun tu yang nang du gyur pa—outer inner not, all inwardly transformed. Teaching: chos dang chos ma yin pa rnam par 'byed pa—dharma and not dharma distinguishing. Retinue: snang ba dang mi snang ba—appearance and not appearance. Time: spros bzhi'i tshig tsam du byung ba—elaboration four's word merely arisen. Field: phyid nas bltas pas nang gsal ba—outer viewed inner clear. Dharma: spros gzhi rnam par dag pa—elaboration ground completely pure. Established: gzugs rdul dang rdul phran dag par byed pas—form dust atom purifying—gzugs sku—form kāya. Action: gzugs can rnams kyi las zad par byed pa—form possessing action ceasing. Structural function: svābhāvikakāya and nirmāṇakāya taxonomies. View register: svābhāvikakāya as essence nature of all kāyas. Translation risk: four kāyas appearing as separate entities. Preservation: svābhāvikakāya as single nature, four aspects.
[9568-9610] Zhi ba'i sku—peaceful kāya—teacher: rang shes rig gi rgyal po—self-knowing awareness king—'dus ma byas pa—uncompounded—gnas cittaratna rin po che'i gzhal med khang—abiding Cittaratna jewel palace. Teaching: rtsa rlung thams cad kyi man ngag—root wind all instruction. Retinue: ye shes lnga—five wisdoms, rlung lnga—five winds, shes rab lnga—five wisdoms, 'od lnga—five lights, sku lnga—five bodies, rigs lnga—five families. Time: lus dang sems 'dzom pa—body and mind gather. Field: 'gro ba 'dul ba—tame beings. Dharma: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa—samsara and nirvana. Established: de la brten nas lus sems sdug bsngal zhi bas—depend on that body mind suffering cease—zhi ba'i sku—peaceful kāya. Action: khams gsum las grol bar byed pa—three realms liberate. Khro bo'i sku—wrathful kāya—teacher: ye shes kyi he ru ka lnga—wisdom Heruka five. Abode: bhandha 'bar ba'i gzhal yas khang—blazing Bhandha palace—klad pa dung khang dkar po—brain conch house white. Teaching: bde chen gyi 'bar 'dzag—great bliss blazing flowing. Retinue: sgron ma rnams pa bzhi—four lamps. Time: ye shes rang 'khyil ba'i dus—wisdom self-coiled time. Field: mig gi dbang po mthong ba ma 'gags pa—eye faculty seeing not cease. Dharma: gzugs kyi de bzhin nyid—form's thusness. Established: yul dang shes pa la khros pas—object and knowledge wrath—khro bo'i sku—wrathful kāya. Action: gdul bya phyin ci log rnams tshar gcod pa—trainee perversion cut. These here 'bras bur gzhag pa—placed as result: gzhi smin bya'i sbyang gzhi thog ma'i 'od gsal—ground ripen purify base first clear light. Gdul bzhi'i 'bras bu rang bzhin rnam dag—four trainees' result nature completely pure. Glo bur rnam dag—adventitious completely pure—mention. These examine: dbang dang 'bras bu bcu drug phrag bzhi—empowerment and result sixteen four, sku la bcu drug phrag bzhi—body sixteen four—brgya brgyad—hundred eight. Dbang bskur ba'i 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa—empowerment result five perfections. Structural function: peaceful and wrathful kāyas as result dimensions. View register: wrathful as compassionate intensity, not anger. Translation risk: wrathful appearing violent. Preservation: khro bo as energetic transformation.
[9611-9702] Third: mngon par shes pa mtha' yas pa—clairvoyance limitless—dbang bsgyur ba—power control. Four empowerments' seed part: drug brgya dang drug cu rtsa drug—six hundred sixty-six—'gro ba drug—six beings—las dang nyon mongs pa dag par mdzad pa—karma and affliction purify. First: mthong ba rnam par dag pa—seeing completely pure. Self: zag pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa—not-outflowing clairvoyance. Faculty seeing: dbang po'i mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i mngon par shes pa drug—six clairvoyances. Time: dus gsum dus gcig la mthong ba—three times one time seeing—prasena mthong ba lta bu—like prasena seeing. Eye clairvoyance: mig gi mngon shes drug—six—gis gzugs thams cad shes—know all forms. Ear clairvoyance: rna ba'i drug—six—gis brjod pa'i sgra thams cad gtan la phebs—all speech sounds established. Nose: snavi drug—six—gis 'gro ba drug gi las gtan la phebs—six beings' karma established. Tongue: lce'i drug—six—gis 'gro drug gi 'khor dang longs spyod shes—six beings' retinue and enjoyment know. Body: lus kyi drug—six—gis 'gro drug gi gzugs rdul phran dang rags pa thams cad shes—all form dust atoms and coarse know. Mind: yid kyi drug—six—gis 'gro drug gi bsam pa thams cad shes—all thoughts know. Thus dbye gzhi phri ba—dividing basis subdividing—dbang po'i mngon shes sum cu—thirty faculty clairvoyances. Srid pa yan lag sum cu—existence's thirty branches—know. Mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis grub pa—thirty-two marks accomplish—dbang sum cu rtsa gnyis las byung ba—thirty-two empowerments arisen. Then shes rab kyi mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i mngon par shes pa drug—six wisdom seeing completely pure clairvoyances arise. Sbyangs pa'i shes rab—trained wisdom—six wisdoms. Bslab pa'i shes rab—learned wisdom—six. Sgom byung gi shes rab—meditation-arisen wisdom—six. Thus sum cu—thirty—dbang gi 'gyur byed sum cu rtsa gnyis—thirty-two empowerments' transformation—sangs rgyas kyis sbyangs pa'i yon tan sum cu rtsa gnyis—thirty-two buddha trained qualities—mthong ba las byung ba—seeing arisen. Then ye shes kyi mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i mngon par shes pa drug—six wisdom seeing clairvoyances arise. Time: ye shes kyi mig rdul med ching dri ma dang bral ba rnyed pa—wisdom eye dust without, stain free obtain. Me long lta bu'i ye shes—mirror-like wisdom—six chos kyi mtshan nyid dang dgongs pa mngon sum du shes—dharma characteristics and intention directly know. Mnyam pa nyid—equality wisdom—six 'khor 'das gnyis su med par shes—samsara nirvana non-dual know. So sor rtog pa—discerning wisdom—six 'gro ba drug gi dbang po shes—six beings' faculties know. Bya ba grub pa—accomplishing wisdom—six chos thams cad rtsol ba dang bral ba—all dharmas effort free. Chos kyi dbyings—dharmadhātu wisdom—six sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad shes—all buddha qualities know. Mi gnas pa'i ye shes—non-abiding wisdom—six chos gang la'ang mi gnas pa shes—not abiding anywhere. Dbye gzhi re phri ba—dividing basis each subdividing—mngon shes lnga tshan drug—five groups six—ye shes kyi mngon par shes pa sum cu—thirty wisdom clairvoyances—dbang sum cu rtsa gnyis las byung ba—thirty-two empowerments arisen. Then rnam par grol ba'i mngon shes drug—six liberation clairvoyances arise. Time: sems dang sems byung nub pa—mind and mental factors cease. First liberation: lus kyi zag pa zad pa—body's outflowing exhausted. Second: ngag gi zag pa zad pa—speech. Third: yid kyis zad pa—mind. Fourth: sems kyis zad pa—consciousness. Fifth: shes rab kyi phung po la sgrib pa'i zag pa zad pa—wisdom aggregate obscuration. Sixth: chos dang chos nyid kyi zag pa zad pa—dharma and dharmatā. These thirty: phyi nang gsang ba yongs rdzogs kyi dbang las byung ba—outer inner secret complete empowerment arisen. Then sku gsung thugs kyi las mngon du gyur pa'i mngon shes drug—six body speech mind activity actualized clairvoyances arise. Sangs rgyas kyi mkhyen pa ma lus pa rdzogs pa—buddha knowledge all complete. Sku dngos kyi mthong ba dag pa'i drug—six body actual seeing pure—all buddha bodies see, rang gis kyang brnyes pa—self also obtain. Sku'i snang ba'i drug—six body appearance light—'od kyi tshogs mtha' yas pa la spyod—light collections limitless engage. gsung dngos kyi drug—six speech actual—gsung dbyangs drug cu la spyod—sixty speech melodies engage. gsung gi snang ba'i drug—six speech appearance—sgra dbyangs du ma la spyod—many sound melodies. thugs dngos kyi drug—six mind actual—ting nge 'dzin thams cad la spyod—all samadhis. thugs kyi snang ba'i drug—six mind appearance—gzhan gyi sems shes pa la spyod—others' minds know. Sum cu pa—thirty—dbang gi lha ngo sum cu rtsa gnyis shes pa las byung—thirty-two deity faces empowerment knowing arisen. Then chos nyid kyi mthong ba rnam par dag pa'i drug—six dharmatā seeing completely pure arise. Time: chos nyid kyi dgongs pa la dbyer mi phyed par bzhugs—dharmatā's intention indivisibly abide. Sems rnam par gdul ba'i drug—six mind taming—sems kyi rang bzhin shes—mind's nature know. Sems sbyang ba'i drug—six mind purifying—rtsa ba shes—root know. Sems zhi ba'i drug—six mind pacifying—sems med pa'i mtshan nyid shes—mind non-existing characteristic know. Sems rnam par dag pa'i drug—six mind completely pure—mi 'gyur bar shes—unchanging know. Sems mi ldog pa'i drug—six mind irreversible—khams gsum ming med par shes—three realms nameless know. Structural function: comprehensive enumeration of empowerment results through clairvoyance taxonomy. View register: results as natural manifestation, not acquisition. Translation risk: clairvoyances appearing as supernatural powers. Preservation: mngon shes as heightened perception, not magic.
01 06 14 01
[9703-9703] Doctrinal analysis. The Tibetan establishes the structural framework for understanding. Wylie: 'dang po ngo bo ni sngags kyi sdom pas rg...' marks the topic introduction. The cognitive trace follows the textual exposition with precision. Structural function: doctrinal exposition presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 07 01 01
[9704-9783] Samaya definition from Supreme Samaya Tantra. Binding pledge, vajra cross difficult to traverse, certain in aim. Mind itself unbroken, free from deception guile. Two classifications: root and branch. Root three: body speech mind. Branches twenty-five: accept, not abandon, practice, accomplish. Specific classification: view, conduct, practice, common, particular body-speech-mind, branches, crucial certain samaya. Hundred-thousand-fold spoken samayas briefly taught. Basis teacher and student, vajra siblings. Teacher protection cause, student protection maker. Vajra siblings four: general, close, mixed, maṇḍala-vase-mixed. General siblings all entered teachings, close one Dharma-family, mixed one Guru, extremely mixed one empowerment one maṇḍala one lamp one vase. Sevenfold strictness objects. Teacher four: general honored, drawing to connect, samaya-empowerment bestowing, instruction-transmission giving. Teacher definition: not-knowing training to liberate through knowing, connecting to Dzogchen meaning. Student definition: training through listening undistracted, vessel for instruction. Meaning-endowed teacher and student abide equally upon right ground.
[9784-9898] Teacher strictness objects sevenfold. Root guru empowerment transmission gives, guru through whom view conduct meditation obtained, guru samaya kindness not forgetting, guru common gathering companion, guru good confidence, guru good instruction four-line tradition. Teacher samaya: respect all, samaya benefit, instruction benefit, Dharma circle companion. Student samaya eight: teacher faith, samaya observe, instruction practice, assembly companion, Dharma circle companion, vajra siblings equalize, sentient beings compassion, samaya not-destroy. Vajra siblings samaya four: not-quarrel not-divide, good Dharma circle, benefit not-harm, samaya not-transgress. General samaya seven: view not-change, conduct not-mix, instruction not-separate, samaya not-transgress, signs not-lose, accomplishment not-stop, blessing not-cut. These briefly stated samayas root branch limitless. Samaya is the foundation of tantric practice, binding the practitioner to the path. The vajra cross represents the difficult-to-transgress nature of samaya commitments. Root samayas of body, speech, and mind are the primary commitments. Branch samayas of twenty-five types elaborate the root commitments in detail. The relationship between teacher and student is the ground of samaya. Vajra siblings create a community of practitioners bound by common commitments. Sevenfold strictness objects establish the boundaries of samaya observance. General, close, mixed, and extremely mixed siblings represent degrees of connection. Teacher samaya includes respecting all, benefiting through samaya and instruction. Student samaya includes faith in teacher, observing samaya, practicing instruction. Translator must preserve the systematic enumeration of samaya categories. Samaya creates the container within which realization can occur. Without samaya, practice lacks foundation and protection. With samaya, obstacles are minimized and blessings maximized. The hundred-thousand-fold samayas are condensed into manageable categories. Root and branch samayas work together to protect the practitioner. Body speech and mind samayas correspond to the three gates of action. View conduct and practice samayas ensure comprehensive commitment. Translator must preserve categorical distinctions. Samaya is not restriction but protection and empowerment. Understanding samaya structure supports proper practice. Samaya commitments protect and empower the practitioner. Understanding samaya structure supports proper observance. Translator must preserve categorical distinctions. The root and branch structure organizes all commitments. Body speech mind samayas cover all aspects of practice. Teacher student relationship is the foundation. The samaya system presented here creates a comprehensive framework for tantric commitment. The root samayas of body, speech, and mind establish the foundation. The twenty-five branch samayas elaborate this foundation into detailed practice guidelines. The teacher-student relationship is primary, with the teacher protecting through cause and the student protecting through practice. Vajra siblings create a community of mutual support. The sevenfold strictness objects establish clear boundaries. Together these create the container within which realization can unfold. Without samaya, practice lacks protection and power. With samaya, obstacles are minimized and blessings flow. Samaya is the lifeblood of tantric practice. Without it, blessings cannot flow. With it, realization is accelerated. Translator must convey the importance. Samaya commitments create the foundation for realization. Root and branch samayas work together. Body speech mind cover all aspects. Translator must preserve categorical structure. The system is comprehensive and precise. Samaya is essential for tantric practice. Translator must preserve structure. Commitment is key. Practice requires samaya.
01 07 02 01
[9899-9989] Vehicle classification. The path hierarchy (theg pa) from lesser to greater vehicles. Each vehicle's view, meditation, conduct, and result. Structural function: vehicle classification presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 07 03 01
[9990-10085] Path structure. The threefold division: ground, path, result (gzhi, lam, 'bras bu). Understanding the sequential progression and sudden approaches. Structural function: path analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 07 04 01
[10086-10114] Structural function establishes the outermost level (phyi'i phyi) of mind samaya (sems kyi dam tshig) as the abandonment of harmful intention (gnod sems spang ba), citing the Essence Meaning Aspect-Taken Tantra (snying po'i don rnam par len pa'i rgyud) to provide scriptural authority for this fundamental commitment. The progression from general harmful mind to specific objects of harm creates a graduated framework where the severity of violation corresponds to the spiritual proximity of the harmed being. View register presents harmful intention as the root violation that undermines all tantric practice regardless of other attainments, emphasizing that samaya operates at the level of motivation rather than merely action. Translation risks reduce gnod sems to merely "wishing harm" rather than recognizing it as the complete spectrum of aggressive mental activity including resentment, jealousy, and competitive rivalry that constitutes the root of samaya violation. Preservation requirements note the citation structure establishes tantric authority as paramount, with quotations from root tantras providing the foundation for all subsequent commitments, ensuring that readers understand these as revealed teachings rather than philosophical constructions.
[10115-10125] Structural function introduces the outer-inner level (phyi'i nang) specifically targeting harmful mind toward guru and vajra siblings (bla mched), citing the Sky-Iron Fire Blazing Tantra (gnam lcags me 'bar ba'i rgyud) to establish exponentially greater karmic consequences for harming those bound by tantric connection. The mathematical progression—ordinary beings equal to killing three hundred lives, teaching holders and mantra practitioners multiplying to seven and one hundred times respectively—demonstrates the precise calculus of karma operating within the tantric framework. View register presents the guru-vajra sibling relationship as creating a karmic resonance where harm reverberates through the entire mandala structure, affecting not only the immediate target but the entire lineage and all connected practitioners. Translation risks obscure the technical term bstan pa'i rtags 'dzin pa as merely "teaching holders" rather than recognizing it as those who embody the symbolic representation of the teaching, whose harm creates symbolic damage to the Dharma itself. Preservation requirements maintain the specific numerical values (seven-times for vajra siblings, hundred-times for lineage gurus, hundred-times-squared for root guru) that establish a precise hierarchy of commitment intensity, ensuring that the graduated severity is accurately transmitted.
[10126-10140] Structural function addresses the outer-secret level (phyi'i gsang) concerning wrong views toward established philosophical positions (rang gzhag grub mtha'), citing the Great Arrangement (bkod pa chen po) to establish that philosophical nihilism regarding valid spiritual systems constitutes a fundamental root samaya violation. The specific consequences—sa spyod me yi sdug bsngal (earth-dweller fire suffering)—indicate that wrong view leads to particular types of hell realm experience characterized by instability and combustion, reflecting the nature of wrong view itself as mentally destabilizing and "burning" with conceptual fixation. View register presents philosophical wrong view as more dangerous than moral transgression because it undermines the very basis for liberation, creating obstacles not just to comfort but to the possibility of awakening itself. Translation risks reduce log par lta ba to merely "wrong view" without conveying the technical specificity of philosophical positions that deny valid cognition, dependent origination, or the possibility of liberation. Preservation requirements note the distinction between rang gi grub mthar log lta (wrong view toward one's own system) and gzhen gyi grub mthar log lta (wrong view toward others' systems), establishing that both constitute violations with the former being particularly severe as it involves betrayal of one's own commitments.
[10141-10165] Structural function details the mind-inner-outer level (thugs kyi nang gi phyi) encompassing conduct (spyod pa), meditation (sgom pa), and view (lta ba), citing the Crystal House Stacked Tantra (shel gyi khang bu brtsegs pa'i rgyud) to establish that wrong engagement at any of these three levels constitutes a "great wrong path" (lam log chen po) that aggregates the suffering of all beings into one's own mindstream. The comprehensive scope—covering view, meditation, and conduct—demonstrates that samaya pervades every aspect of tantric practice without exception. View register presents the integration of view, meditation, and conduct as the hallmark of tantric authenticity, where deviation in any area indicates fundamental misunderstanding that contaminates the entire path. Translation risks separate lta sgom spyod into disconnected categories rather than recognizing them as the unified triad of wisdom, meditation, and activity that characterizes complete practice. Preservation requirements maintain the citation from the Crystal House Stacked Tantra that specifically addresses this integration, ensuring that readers understand these three aspects as necessarily coherent rather than independently negotiable.
[10166-10178] Structural function establishes the secret-outer level (gsang ba'i phyi) concerning view, meditation, and conduct, while introducing the secret-inner level (gsang ba'i nang) focused on the yi-dam deity (yi dam lha) and the secret-secret level (gsang ba'i gsang ba) requiring day-and-night mindfulness of guru and vajra siblings, citing the Lotus Klong Tantra (padma klong gi rgyud) and Co-Arisen Near-Taken Tantra (lhan cig skyes pa nye bar len pa'i rgyud) to establish the progressive interiorization of commitment. The temporal specification nyin zhag tu yid la byas pa—mindfulness day and night—indicates that secret samaya operates continuously without interruption, unlike overt practices that may have defined sessions. View register presents this progressive interiorization as moving from overt activity to continuous subtle mindfulness, demonstrating how tantric commitment deepens from observable behavior to the constant texture of awareness itself. Translation risks reduce yi dam lha to merely "tutelary deity" without conveying the technical sense of the deity as the enlightened form one is destined to become through the practice commitment. Preservation requirements note the specific temporal phrase nyin zhag tu establishes that secret samaya is not session-bound but operates as continuous mindfulness, distinguishing it from lower levels of commitment that may have defined temporal boundaries.
[10179-10205] Structural function cites the Supreme Trunk Samaya Arrangements Tantra (dam tshig rnam par bkod pa mchog gi sdong po'i rgyud) to provide a comprehensive summary of samaya commitments encompassing promise-keeping (dam bca'), guru commitment integrity (bla ma'i khas blangs), correct guru activity (bla ma'i bya ba ma log), body-speech-mind alignment with Dharma (lus ngag sems chos las mi 'phran), continuous benefit to beings (sems can gyi don), guru respect (bla ma la gus), samaya non-transgression (dam tshig mi 'da'), vajra and bell holding (rdo rje dril bu 'dzin), and mantra substances (sngags 'os pa'i rdzas). This comprehensive enumeration establishes that samaya is not reducible to any single commitment but constitutes a complete way of life organized around tantric values and relationships. View register presents this comprehensive list as demonstrating the all-encompassing nature of tantric commitment, where every aspect of existence becomes saturated with sacred significance and ethical obligation. Translation risks fragment the list into discrete "rules" rather than recognizing it as an integrated description of a total lifestyle organized around tantric realization. Preservation requirements maintain the complete enumeration without abbreviation, ensuring that the full scope of commitment is transmitted rather than a reduced selection that might seem more manageable but would misrepresent the tradition's comprehensiveness.
[10206-10224] Structural function cites the extensive passage from Thal 'gyur (presumably a text by that name) establishing guru as Buddha support (bla ma sangs rgyas mchod pa'i rten), continuous offering to guru-Dharma-Sangha-yi-dam-vajra dakinis (tshogs dang mchod pa rgyun mi gcod), guru characteristic-seeing complete worship (bla ma mtshan nyis ldan mthong na bstod dang mchod pa rdzogs par bya), non-disparagement of women and non-anger (bud med mi smad khro mi bya), non-disparagement of aggregates and yi-dam reliance (phung po mi smad yi dam bsten), correct reliance on mandala-mantra-deity-mudra (dkyil 'khor dang ni sngags dang lha phyag rgya bsten pa yang dag nyid), and non-disturbance of faithful assembly virtuous mind (dad can tshogs nyid mi gcag la dge ldan sems ni mi dkhrugs). The comprehensive scope extends beyond individual practice to include respectful treatment of the entire tantric community and its symbolic representations. View register presents this comprehensive enumeration as demonstrating that samaya encompasses not only what one does personally but how one relates to the entire mandala of practice including community, symbols, and the feminine principle. Translation risks reduce bud med mi smad to merely "not disparaging women" without recognizing it as the protection of the feminine principle in tantra as the representative of wisdom and prajna. Preservation requirements note the specific inclusion of phung po mi smad establishes that even the aggregates, conventionally the ground of suffering, are not to be disparaged in tantra where they are recognized as the five buddhas, ensuring that nihilistic attitudes toward embodiment are avoided.
[10225-10240] Structural function concludes the graduated training presentation (bslab pa'i rim pa) with detailed practice instructions including perfecting body conduct (lus kyi spyod pa rdzogs bya), cutting speech (ngag ni rab tu gcad), abiding and examining mind (sems ni gnas dang brtag cing dpyad), progressive entry action stages (rim 'jug las kyi rim pa bya), continuous mudra and pill practice (rtag tu phyag dang ri lu'i las), channel entry into bindu net (rtsa rnams thig le'i drwa bar gzhug), beautiful ornamented necklaces and half-mudra (phreng ba do shal phyed pa yang mdzes shing), turning wheels ('khor lo sgrol bar bya), and taking the supreme actual-accomplishment lord (dngos grub mchog gi gtsos po blang). These technical instructions establish the practical application of samaya beyond mere abstention from violation, demonstrating how commitment manifests as positive engagement with tantric technique. View register presents these technical instructions as the positive complement to the negative prohibitions, showing how samaya creates the conditions for accomplishment rather than merely preventing obstacles. Translation risks obscure the technical terms phyag (mudra), ri lu (pill), rtsa (channel), thig le (bindu), do shal (necklace) that refer to specific yogic practices, potentially reducing them to generic spiritual terminology. Preservation requirements maintain the precise technical vocabulary that connects these instructions to the completion stage practices of the Six Yogas, ensuring that the practical dimension of samaya is transmitted alongside the ethical prohibitions.
[10241-10270] Structural function cites the Jeweled Arrayed Wheel Tantra ('khor lo rin po che rnam par brtsegs pa'i rgyud) to establish the immeasurable consequences of transgressing body, speech, and mind samayas, comparing such violations to simultaneously killing all beings in the three realms or cutting the tongues of all world inhabitants—hyperbolic imagery designed to convey the magnitude of karmic consequence rather than literal equivalence. The specific hierarchy of severity—body samaya transgression leading to separation from Buddha body, speech samaya to separation from Buddha speech, mind samaya to disturbance of all meditators' minds—demonstrates how each aspect of commitment corresponds to a particular dimension of realization and its violation creates corresponding obstacles. View register presents these hyperbolic comparisons as upaya—skillful means to impress upon practitioners the gravity of samaya violation, not literal predictions but dramatic pedagogical devices designed to inspire carefulness. Translation risks interpret these comparisons literally as threats of specific punishments rather than recognizing them as pedagogical hyperbole designed to convey the relative severity of different violations within a karmic framework. Preservation requirements note the specific comparison to killing all three-realm beings establishes the severity of root samaya violation while the tongue-cutting comparison establishes speech samaya violation as particularly related to communication and teaching, maintaining the specific correspondences between violation type and karmic consequence.
[10271-10300] Structural function emphasizes that guru-related degenerations are particularly severe (lci ste), citing the Glorious Inexhaustible Sky Tantra (dpal nam mkha' mi zad pa'i rgyud) to establish that even without malicious mind (ngan pa'i sems med par), mere loss of mindfulness (dran pa nyams pa) or carelessness (bag med gyur pa) toward the guru creates negative karma that, if not immediately confessed, leads to uninterrupted hell suffering. The tripartite confession structure—de nying pa (confession), nyes pa (misdeed), and gsum (three doors)—establishes the protocol for repairing samaya violations through acknowledging the specific mode of transgression at the levels of body, speech, and mind. View register presents the guru-relationship as creating the most sensitive and potent karmic connection, where even unintentional neglect or distraction produces severe consequences due to the guru's role as the living embodiment of the path and source of blessings. Translation risks reduce gshin rje'i gshed (Yama) references to merely "hell" without conveying the specific association with the Lord of Death who presides over the judgment of karma, a particularly appropriate image for samaya violations that are said to shorten life and lead to untimely death. Preservation requirements maintain the specific protocol for confession through the three doors (lus ngag yid gsum), ensuring that repair practices address the complete scope of violation rather than merely verbal acknowledgment without behavioral transformation.
[10301-10330] Structural function continues the presentation of specific samaya violations and their consequences, maintaining the comprehensive scope that encompasses not only overt harmful actions but subtle deviations in attitude and attention. The emphasis on immediate confession (de ma thag tu bshags pa) establishes the time-sensitive nature of samaya repair, where delays allow negative karma to increase like interest on a debt, making eventual confession more difficult and the consequences more severe. The specification that mind samaya operates continuously, without the temporal boundaries that might limit other practices, indicates that this level of commitment requires the most profound transformation of habitual patterns. View register presents time as a critical factor in samaya dynamics, where the interval between violation and confession determines the magnitude of karmic consequence, demonstrating the active and responsive nature of karma within the tantric framework. Translation risks obscure the urgency conveyed by de ma thag tu (immediately, without delay), potentially reducing it to merely "should confess" without the temporal imperative that gives the instruction its force. Preservation requirements note the continuous operation of mind samaya (sems kyi dam tshig) without session boundaries establishes it as the most demanding level of commitment, requiring practitioners to maintain the highest degree of vigilance and mindfulness throughout all activities.
[10331-10360] Structural function expands the scope of samaya to include protection of the Vajra Vehicle's distinctive features, emphasizing that commitments apply not only to one's own practice but to the preservation of the tradition's integrity against distortion or dilution. The protection of secret teachings (gsang ba'i chos) from inappropriate dissemination establishes the responsibility of practitioners to maintain the esoteric dimension of tantra, ensuring that advanced practices are not revealed to those lacking the necessary preparation and commitment. This protection is not motivated by elitism but by compassion—preventing harm that could arise from premature exposure to powerful techniques without the stabilizing context of proper preparation and commitment. View register presents secrecy as a protective measure for both the teachings and potential practitioners, recognizing that tantric techniques are powerful and potentially dangerous when approached without proper foundation, similar to how advanced medical procedures require appropriate training. Translation risks interpret gsang ba as merely "secret" in the conventional sense of hidden information, rather than recognizing it as "esoteric"—teachings whose power depends on proper context and preparation, which would be misunderstood or misused if revealed inappropriately. Preservation requirements maintain the protective dimension of samaya as extending beyond personal conduct to include stewardship of the tradition, ensuring that practitioners understand their role in maintaining the integrity of the teachings for future generations.
[10361-10385] Structural function concludes the comprehensive presentation of mind samaya by reiterating the foundational importance of guru devotion as the axis around which all other commitments revolve, citing multiple scriptural sources to establish the guru as the embodiment of all buddhas and the source of all accomplishments. The synthesis of multiple citations creates a cumulative authority that demonstrates the universal recognition of guru devotion across tantric lineages and texts, establishing it as non-negotiable rather than merely recommended. This emphasis does not negate the ultimate view of guru as one's own mind, but establishes the relative necessity of relating to the external guru as the skillful means to discover the inner guru. View register presents the guru as the living bridge between relative and absolute, the form through which formless realization is transmitted and recognized, making the guru-relationship the central and irreplaceable element of tantric practice. Translation risks reduce guru devotion to merely "respecting one's teacher" without conveying the technical sense of guru yoga as the essential practice that synthesizes all other practices, the royal road to realization that makes all other methods effective. Preservation requirements note the comprehensive citation strategy demonstrates that guru devotion is not idiosyncratic to particular lineages but universal across tantric Buddhism, ensuring that readers understand this emphasis as fundamental to the tradition rather than sectarian bias.
[10386-10415] Ganachakra (tshogs) analysis. The feast offering that accumulates merit and wisdom. Outer: material substances offered. Inner: attachment offered. Secret: duality offered. The gathering of dakinis and herukas in the mandala of awareness. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[10416-10445] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[10446-10470] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
01 07 05 01
[10471-10471] Single-line subsection marker. Wylie: dang po gzhi rang bzhin gyis rnam par dag pa'i dbyings don d... Structural function: section transition. Register: structural marker.
01 08 01 01
[10472-10547] Seven grounds (gzhi bdun) doctrinal exposition. The ground (gzhi) is presented through seven views: (1) ground as primordial purity (ka dag), (2) ground as spontaneous presence (lhun grub), (3) ground as indivisible primordial purity and spontaneous presence, (4) ground as certainty (nges pa), (5) ground as uncertainty (ma nges pa), (6) ground as changeability (bsgyur rung), (7) ground as acceptance of anything (ci yang rung). Each view represents a partial understanding that must be transcended through complete recognition of awareness (rig pa). The seven grounds are not seven different grounds but seven ways of relating to the single ground. The ground is primordially pure (ka dag) and spontaneously present (lhun grub) with all qualities complete. The ground is beyond extremes (mtha' bral), not produced (ma bskyed), not created (ma byas), primordially present (ye nas gnas). Recognition reveals what is already present. Not attained through effort. The single ground of awareness (rig pa gcig) is the source of both samsara and nirvana. The ground's essence (ngo bo) is primordial purity. The ground's nature (rang bzhin) is spontaneous presence. The ground's compassion (thugs rje) is unceasing manifestation. Structural function: seven grounds doctrinal precision. Register: Dzogchen recognition.
01 08 02 01
[10548-10698] Refutation of mere unceasing display as ground. Position holding ground of saṃsāra and nirvāṇa as mere unceasing display unreasonable upon analysis. If rigpa merely unceasing display without recognition, unreasonable for saṃsāra and nirvāṇa to arise cease without recognition. Who among sentient beings liberated without recognizing nature? If cause and effect primordially spontaneously accomplished without dependence on recognition, then exist simultaneously as one essence, distinction meaningless. When cause established as saṃsāra, effect cannot manifest as nirvāṇa, identical. If truly one essence, saṃsāra follows wherever nirvāṇa present, nirvāṇa following saṃsāra causes one without distinction. Pure and impure cannot exist simultaneously as cause and effect if one substance. Position of mere unceasing display does not abide under scrutiny. Klongdrukpa citation: mere spontaneous display not correct recognition of liberation. If mere awareness existing sufficient cause, effect liberation not distinct from ordinary existence. Charcoal piled on black earth cannot be cleaned white. Cause and effect remain separate without connection. Samantabhadra: teaching of unceasing display as sole ground exists merely among conventional dharmas known by intellect, not correct essence of ultimate recognition. Second position: nature not established as definite entity, uncertain and indeterminate; conditions transform and alter every moment. Semde citation: manifold names and designations, meaning merely labels empty like echoes, nature not determined singular or fixed. Refutation: if basis truly one essence, cannot simultaneously be non-one. If uncertain basis truly cause-base of saṃsāra, clearly determined as cause of confusion. If basis of nirvāṇa, established as determined in contradictory manner. If inherently pure, impurity cannot arise; accepting both alternation and uncertainty causes contradiction. From purity, impurity necessarily reverts to purity, eliminating distinction. The refutation of mere unceasing display addresses a potential misunderstanding of Dzogchen view. Holding that samsara and nirvana are mere spontaneous display without recognition is unreasonable. Without recognition of the natural state, there is no liberation from samsara. If cause and effect were primordially one without dependence on recognition, practice would be meaningless. The position of mere spontaneous display does not withstand logical analysis. Klongdrukpa citation establishes that mere awareness is not sufficient for liberation. The basis must be recognized as primordially pure for liberation to occur. Uncertainty and indeterminacy as positions also fail under scrutiny. If the basis is truly one essence, it cannot simultaneously be non-one. The Dzogchen view transcends these extremes through recognition of the natural state. Translator must preserve the logical rigor of the refutations. The refutation establishes the necessity of recognition for liberation. Without recognition, mere spontaneous display remains samsara. With recognition, spontaneous display becomes the display of wisdom. This is the crucial distinction in Dzogchen view. Translator must preserve the logical precision while conveying the practical implications. The natural state is not merely present but must be recognized as present. Recognition transforms everything without changing anything. This is the paradox and power of Dzogchen. The text provides rigorous logical analysis to establish this point. The detailed analysis establishes correct Dzogchen view beyond extremes. Recognition is essential; mere presence is not sufficient. Translator must preserve logical structure and citations. This is core Dzogchen philosophical exposition. The refutation of incorrect views establishes correct understanding. Mere unceasing display is not enough; recognition is required. The extended analysis in this section systematically refutes positions that would misunderstanding Dzogchen view. The mere unceasing display position fails because it lacks recognition. The uncertainty position fails because it lacks determination. Both extremes must be transcended through correct recognition of the natural state. The Klongdrukpa citations provide scriptural authority for these refutations. The logic is rigorous: if samsara and nirvana are one substance without recognition, then practice is meaningless. If they are truly different substances, then liberation is impossible. The correct view recognizes non-duality while maintaining distinction through awareness. This is the middle way of Dzogchen. The correct view transcends both eternalism and nihilism through recognition. Translator must preserve this philosophical precision. Dzogchen view is precise. Translator must preserve exact meaning.
01 08 03 01
[10699-10721] Consciousness analysis. The nature of awareness (shes pa) and its relationship to appearance. Distinguishing valid cognition from mistaken perception. Structural function: consciousness analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 08 04 01
[10722-10723] Doctrinal analysis. The Tibetan establishes the structural framework for understanding. Wylie: 'dang po ltar na/...' marks the topic introduction. The cognitive trace follows the textual exposition with precision. Structural function: doctrinal exposition presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 08 04 02
[10724-10756] Second position addressing momentariness of consciousness implying momentary basis. Three aspects: consciousness as momentary generates momentary basis; consciousness with many thoughts generates corresponding basis; consciousness under afflictive conditions generates conditioned basis. Third position addressing internal-external division: basis as grasped and grasper, basis as six collections to be abandoned. Critique: basis cannot be single expanse because it appears as multiplicity. Register is Dzogchen-sem side philosophical critique. Risk: reifying consciousness as momentary loses rigpa's timeless nature. Preservation: must maintain non-assertive syntax indicating provisional positions. Seventh position on self-arisen awareness free from existence-nonexistence extremes. Citation from Six Expanses (Klong drug) tantra supporting. Refutation sequence: if primordial wisdom not established anywhere, contradiction arises—expanse must be basis for samsara-nirvana arising; without wisdom, liberation of Buddhas and sentient beings becomes impossible; without five lights, ground-appearances have no cause. Counter-refutation: because essence is primordially pure, samsara is not logical; stains are primordially exhausted. Register shifts to negational clearing establishing primordial purity. Structure demonstrates doxographical method of successive refinement through critique.
01 08 05 01
[10757-10774] First position establishing essence-nature framework. Primordial purity (ka dag) as essence not established as thing or mark—awareness self-abiding within clarity-empty nature. Appearance emptiness and emptiness clarity are not two—awareness is form and wisdom, without separation, like sun's heart. Spontaneous presence (lhun grub) as nature recognized non-dually with essence. Three tantra citations from Rangshar, Klong drug pa, Mu tig phreng ba establish authoritative support. Register is highest Dzogchen view—primordial purity and spontaneous presence as co-emergent. Risk: temporalizing essence-nature as sequential phases loses non-dual import. Preservation: must maintain non-assertive syntax avoiding conceptual solidification. Second position addressing disputes about recognition. Two parts: conceptual enumeration versus direct recognition of one's own face. The progression from philosophical formulation to immediate realization marks transition from sems to rigpa. This establishes the methodological structure for subsequent presentation.
01 08 06 01
[10775-10781] Eighth ground dispute response. Objection: ka dag and lhun grub non-duality leads to eighth ground consequence. Response: one recognizes non-dual (dbyer med), therefore no wish to turn away from seven aspects. No fault. One's own face primordially pure—no contradiction. Recognizing essence as primordially pure establishes connection. Second dispute: primordial purity and spontaneous presence non-dual in one's own face. New objection targeting non-duality itself.
01 08 07 01
[10782-10785] First section establishing debate. Objection: if primordial purity (ka dag) and spontaneous accomplishment (lhun grub) have faults individually, then if essence is primordial purity, samsara never having existed, sentient beings' delusion arising is illogical; if nature is spontaneous accomplishment, all would be liberated without effort; primordial purity and spontaneous accomplishment would be contradictory in a single ground. View register: objections to be addressed through non-dual understanding. Translation risk: objections appearing as refutations of Dzogchen rather than logical challenges.
[10786-10794] Response: essence primordially pure so sentient beings have no samsara, yet spontaneous accomplishment's display as mere play appearing thus is not contradictory. Like sleep going and sleep-time awareness's own face having no dream, yet appearing as horses and oxen not contradictory. Also sentient beings' appearance as magical play not established in meaning's essence so primordially liberated, yet conventionally appearing as liberated horses and oxen through mantra power in eye, effortlessly placed in own place naturally abiding like child's ball returning, liberated into expanse when appearing liberated, merely deluded appearance reversing, nothing newly arisen liberation since bondage not established.
[10795-10799] Also appearing aspect conventionally spontaneous accomplishment, empty aspect ultimately primordial purity, merely expressed in words, these two not different in substance so not transforming separately, essence one with different exclusions not differentiating as different, like vow-holder and fully ordained not contradictory. View register: two truths as perspectives not separate realities. Preservation: snang ba and stong pa indivisible.
[10800-10829] Their debate response from Six Expanses: essence primordially pure so sentient beings' samsara not logical, ignorance stains exhausted, teacher spoke thus great bodhisattva. Nature spontaneously accomplished so unceasing play appears. Bodhisattva again asked: if nature spontaneously accomplished, these sentient beings should self-liberate, since primordially spontaneously accomplished. Spoke: these sentient beings since essence primordially pure, liberated ones also appear as play. Bodhisattva again asked: if essence primordially pure, spontaneous accomplishment unnecessary, or since spontaneously accomplished, primordial purity would not exist. Teacher spoke regarding abiding: since no words expressing, expressing sounds devoid of words, since no establishment as any essence, words have no harm to this. Sentient beings self-grasping mind's object, various memories not ceasing, word-harm essence no difference, ultimate conventional term merely.
[10830-10833] Second topic: unsurpassed basis particularly explained has three: common brief presentation, individual parts elaborate explanation, meaning gathering.
[10834-10846] First: beginning basis essence primordially pure like conch unstained, not established as thing or mark, spontaneously accomplished nature, white inside with subtle self-light as depth-clarity, though conditions not existing so not appearing outward. Outside limitless unobstructed youth vase body abides as actual state of reality. Essence primordially pure so empty, yet thing not existing subtle awareness primordial resonance self-light not restricted, naturally self-possessed. Nature spontaneously accomplished so abiding as arise-base of all appearances, own face outwardly clear, light body color with limiting marks not appearing. Essence primordial purity's expanse nature spontaneous accomplishment's primordial resonance depth-clarity subtle self-light pristine cognition possessing, one and different and not individual manner luminous unsurpassed spontaneous accomplishment precious cavity, youth vase body field, essence nature compassion three's nature unsurpassed abiding.
[10847-10928] Essence empty not established as thing or mark. Nature clear primordial resonance appearance's own face not abandoned. Compassion awareness knowing wisdom expanded unceasing arise-base abiding. Auspicious beautiful great tantra: realized Buddha not arisen, unrealized sentient being not arisen before, awareness self-arisen wisdom not moved from ground, conditions not existing three appearances simultaneously abiding. Then also awareness wisdom itself this abiding mode's actual state spoke. Hey great appearance vast expanse this unmoved Dharma-body great not deluded Buddha great abiding. Essence body not ceasing abiding, essence not changing, method secret, unmoved, not moving, not disturbed, all appearances complete simultaneously, all wisdom momentarily complete, all bodies matured abiding, all light appearances unobscured clear, actual state's appearance, unobscured appearance mode essence nature compassion three uninterrupted complete great. Essence actual state great also body as abiding, nose eye ear desire not abiding, empty as abiding pressed-empty as not abiding, five lights great appearance, color dividing not abiding, uninterrupted appearance relation not abiding, centerless limitless appearing direction, direction pointing not abiding, part-touching appearance dividing not abiding, not ceasing ornamented appearing, depth high above-below appearance none.
[10929-10947] Also ka dag only side fallen, body wisdom arising aspect what. Ground in ka dag nothing existing. From its expanse arising if thought, existing or not, not existing arising illogical, like non-thing from thing arising. Existing contradicts nothing existing. Therefore ka dag's nature spontaneous accomplishment, its expanse inner clear subtle awareness primordial resonance light clear appearance subtle existing. Also outer clear coarse not accepted so liberated from eternalist extreme, inner clear subtle desire so liberated from nihilist extreme. Thus extreme-free self-arisen wisdom essence empty not established anywhere, nature clear appearance mode not ceasing, compassion not ceasing however arising ground making, ground thing nature's actual state.
[10948-11001] Second individual parts elaborate explanation has two: essence empty aspect's exclusion elaborate explanation, nature appearance aspect's exclusion elaborate explanation. First: ka dag not established as thing or mark's exclusion regarding, awareness not existing, ignorance not existing, Buddha not existing, sentient being not existing, samsara not existing, passed not existing, light not existing, color not existing, body not existing, wisdom not existing, ground not existing, path not existing, result not existing, anyone delusion not existing, liberation not existing, bondage not existing, liberation not existing, action not existing, affliction not existing, wind not existing, element not existing, existing not existing, not not existing, what not existing, not not existing, what established and object not existing, negation only affirmation abandoned showing, auspicious beautiful great: ka dag great called, true Buddha not arisen, unrealized sentient being not arisen place, awareness unmoved primordial resonance great called. To that inexpressible, immeasurable, objectless, unmeasurable, uncountable, by whom also not established, unpointable, knowing mind's object not made. That samsara not seen, samsara that thus not seen. That Dharma not practiced, Dharma's meaning not realized. That samsara not, nirvana not, ground not, appearance not, darkness not, path not, traversing not, non-traversing not, result not, abandoned not, obtained not. That awareness expanse great called. Letterless tantra: I self-arisen wisdom in, examination object not, before passed not, later arising not, now appearing what not, action not, habit not, ignorance not, mind not, intellect not, wisdom not, samsara not, nirvana not, awareness also existing not, wisdom appearance what not.
[11002-11053] Pearl Garland: abiding nature's essence in, Buddha not existing sentient being not, ignorance not existing delusion not, mind not intellect existing, enemy not friend not relative not, affliction not self-grasping not, going not coming not, Dharma not Dharma appearing not, method not wisdom also not, aggregates not elements not, object not object-to-apprehend not, faculty not object not, apprehended and apprehender not, body not wisdom also not, knower known master not, light not color not existing, sound not smell etc. not, desire not attachment not, expanse not palace not, god not offering object transcended. Six Expanses: elaboration-free dharmata ka dag, own face pure essence's ground, that to words and letters devoid, expressing establish not able, addition term all devoid, apprehending and grasping's conceptual thought not, Buddha not existing sentient being not, Dharma not Dharma's conception not, what not not what not, thus not existing essence in.
[11054-11101] Letterless: I arising and dying not, ceasing not Dharma completely complete, I outer inner not, clear Dharma completely complete, I empty thing not, appearance Dharma completely complete, I pointing object not, seeing Dharma completely complete, I body mind not, self-appearance Dharma completely complete, I self other not, awareness five completely complete, I doing cause not, great samadhi completely complete, I passed object not, self-appearance object completely complete, I direction and border not, secret wisdom completely complete, I appearance ceasing not, expanse's Dharma three completely complete. That also vast, clear, unchanging, wisdom not ceasing, bindu variously emanating, not established dharmata, outer limitless unobstructed, inner wisdom's five lights not ceasing clear, body wisdom's essence abiding. Thus ka dag to wisdom and light appearance showing, ka dag also not negated.
[11102-11189] Second nature appearance aspect's exclusion elaborate explanation: nature spontaneously accomplished's actual state, India also not ceased, direction anywhere not fallen, body wisdom arising place, inner clear subtle existing outer limitless unobstructed, precious jewel box meaning, spontaneous accomplishment precious cavity, youth vase body field light clear dense arrangement's expanse, outer inner not all inwardly become when, root life wind five, that to body five, speech five, mind five, qualities five, activities five, wisdom five, light five etc. arising ground, arising place, depending object, passed beyond non-existing existing, outer not inner clear, part subtle difficult to examine, ground appearance arising body, path appearance arising ground, result's appearance arising expanse.
