[11317-11333] Transitional passage. The Tibetan text moves from previous topic to next. Wylie: '/de ltar gzhi'i don ka dag dang lhun grub dbyer med chen po...' This structural marker serves as bridge between doctrinal expositions. The lotsawa recognizes the transition and prepares the reader for the next topic. Structural function: transitional clarity. Register: structural awareness.
01 08 08 01
[11334-11334] Single-line subsection marker. Wylie: dang po ni/ Structural function: section transition. Register: structural marker.
01 09 01 01
[11335-11360] Rang shar citation opening. Essence nature of primordial purity: not falling into any direction, India or Tibet. Structural function: establish non-localized ground. Below that: Precious Jewel Casket of Spontaneous Presence exists. Eight modes of appearance. Two gates exist. Structural function: enumerate components.
[11361-11380] Ground of Spontaneous Presence defined. Ground of Indeterminacy. Ground Appearing as Diversity. Point of reversal below. Great Ground-Appearance. saṃbhogakāya appearance said. Structural function: terminology establishment.
[11381-11410] Youthful vase body expounded. Primordial expanse: essence abiding as form. Nature as speech. Compassion as mind. Life-wind four limbs. Five wisdom winds essence. Rigpa tones outward projection. Structural function: subtle body architecture.
[11411-11440] Spontaneous presence manifestation. Tones in expanding expanse. Five lights as fiery sparks. Investigating consciousness arises. Toward rigpa-compassion tones. Not knowing own face. Abides as non-recognition. Dependent upon rigpa. Structural function: confusion origin.
[11435-11500] Structural function establishes spontaneous presence as the dynamic dimension of the natural state, presenting eight modes of appearance as the source for all manifestation. The Rang shar citation opens by establishing that the essence nature of primordial purity does not fall into any direction, neither India nor Tibet, indicating its non-localized, universal nature. Below this ground exists the Precious Jewel Casket of Spontaneous Presence with six modes of arising and two gates, establishing the framework for understanding manifestation. View register operates within Dzogchen <span class="term">/ Spontaneous Presence /</span> Manifestation framework. Key terms include "gzhis lhun grub" (ground of spontaneous presence), "gzhis ma nges pa" (ground of indeterminacy). The eight modes serve as the matrix through which all manifestation arises without altering the unchanging nature of the ground. Translation risks include rendering "lhun grub" as mere spontaneity without preserving its technical meaning as unceasing, self-perfected display. The eight modes must be preserved as systematic enumeration. Preservation priorities center on maintaining the hierarchical structure from primordial purity through spontaneous presence. The relationship between ground and ground-appearance must remain clear. Extended recognition: The Precious Jewel Casket represents the complete potential for manifestation within the natural state. The eight modes demonstrate how spontaneous presence manifests as different dimensions: compassion, light, form, non-duality, beyond-extremes, pure wisdom, impure samsara, and wish-fulfilling jewel.
[11501-11580] Comprehensive analysis of the eight gates as simultaneous dimensions of spontaneous presence. Each gate represents an unobstructed mode: compassion gate where care arises without blockage, light gate where five wisdom lights fill appearances, wisdom gate where non-conceptuality abides, form gate where clear light bodies pervade space, non-duality gate where conceptions dissolve, beyond-extremes gate where spontaneous presence is clear, pure wisdom gate where cloudless sky appears above, and impure samsara gate where six realms appear below. View register reflects Dzogchen understanding that natural state is infinitely diverse in display. Eight gates demonstrate how same spontaneous presence appears as different qualities. Distinction between pure and impure gates reflects fundamental division between recognition and delusion. Translation risks include interpreting gates as literal locations or sequential stages rather than simultaneous dimensions. Term "go" must convey unobstructed access rather than mere door. Preservation priorities center on maintaining simultaneous nature of all eight gates. Hierarchical presentation must be recognized as pedagogical organization. Extended recognition: Eight gates reflect traditional framework of eight consciousnesses transformed into wisdom. Distinction between pure gates above and impure below corresponds to wisdom display versus deluded perception.
[11561-11590] Three kayas manifestation. Power of qualities: Natural nirmāṇakāya fields, directions, immeasurable, self-arisen. Power of compassion: below, sentient beings, immeasurable, self-appearance. Structural function: three kayas complete.
[11581-11660] Detailed examination of three kayas manifestation through power of spontaneous presence. Power of spontaneous presence manifests as saṃbhogakāya appearance—directly self-clear, immeasurable. Power of qualities manifests as Natural nirmāṇakāya fields in all directions. Power of compassion manifests below as sentient beings. Tripartite manifestation demonstrates how single ground appears differently according to perceiving subject's recognition. View register operates within framework of three kayas as different modalities from single source. saṃbhogakāya represents pure perception of enlightened beings, Natural nirmāṇakāya represents spontaneous compassionate activity, realm of sentient beings represents deluded perception. Translation risks include interpreting three kayas as separate ontological entities rather than modes of appearance. Term "rtsal" must convey power, capacity, or dynamic potential. Preservation priorities center on maintaining unity of ground while acknowledging diversity of manifestation. Self-arisen nature of all three must be emphasized. Extended recognition: Three kayas represent complete manifestation of enlightenment. Natural nirmāṇakāya refers to spontaneous, unmediated manifestation of compassion, distinct from artificial or emanated nirmāṇakāya. This reflects Dzogchen emphasis on naturalness over deliberate construction.
[11651-11680] Progressive manifestation. Below that: saṃbhogakāya appearance. Below that: Natural nirmāṇakāya appearance. Below that: six realms appearance. Subduing those: six subduing nirmāṇakāya Buddhas. Impure nirmāṇakāya: birth, aging, sickness, death fields exist. Structural function: complete hierarchy.
[11661-11750] Comprehensive analysis of ground-appearance dynamics as key to Dzogchen cosmology. Ground itself does not change—remains primordially pure like cloudless sky. Ground-appearance arises as if changing within rigpa. This distinction prevents error of attributing change to ground itself while acknowledging reality of manifestation. Appearance is not separate from ground, yet does not alter ground's nature. Resolution of paradox between unchanging natural state and changing world of experience. View register operates within framework where essence and display are non-dual yet distinct. Ground represents empty essence, primordially pure. Ground-appearance represents luminous display, spontaneously present. Relationship is not causal—they are co-emergent, like sun and its light. Translation risks include conflating ground and ground-appearance. Term "gzhis" must be distinguished from "gzhis snang". Simile of cloudless sky indicates unchanging purity, not absence of appearance. Preservation priorities center on maintaining balance between non-duality and distinction. Primordial purity of ground must be preserved as unaffected by arising of appearance. Extended recognition: Ground-appearance dynamics reflect fundamental Buddhist teaching of two truths—ultimate and conventional. Ground corresponds to ultimate truth, unchanging and empty. Appearance corresponds to conventional truth, apparent and diverse. Yet in Dzogchen, these are not separate truths but two aspects of single reality.
[11741-11770] Ground path rigpa. Not existent at all. Compassion arising: like appearance. Ground spontaneous presence manner: ceased. Great indeterminate appearance: abides. Structural function: ground nature.
[11751-11850] Detailed examination of confusion origin within spontaneous presence. From expanding expanse of tones, five lights arise as fiery sparks. Investigating consciousness arises toward rigpa-compassion tones. Not knowing own face, it abides as non-recognition dependent upon rigpa. This is not a fall from purity but an adventitious overlay, like clouds in sky—apparently present yet not truly existent. The crucial point is that confusion arises within spontaneous presence, not from outside it. View register reflects Dzogchen understanding that delusion is not ontologically separate from enlightenment. Non-recognition is not a different substance from recognition—it is the same rigpa not recognizing itself. This makes liberation possible, since one does not need to acquire something new but simply recognize what is already present. The adventitious nature of confusion means it can be removed without altering the essential nature. Translation risks include interpreting confusion as substantial or as a fall from grace. Term "ma rig pa" must convey non-recognition rather than fundamental ignorance. The dependent nature of confusion—dependent upon rigpa—must be preserved as key doctrinal point. Preservation priorities center on maintaining the adventitious, non-substantial nature of confusion. The simile of clouds in sky must be preserved as indicating apparent but not true existence. The dependence of confusion on rigpa must be clear—confusion is not separate from wisdom but its failure to recognize itself. Extended recognition: The origin of confusion described here parallels the Yogacara account of the transformation of consciousness into wisdom. The investigating consciousness represents the active, searching quality of mind that, when directed outward, becomes delusion; when directed inward, becomes wisdom. The key is the direction of attention—toward external appearance or toward self-recognition.
[11831-11860] Body abiding. Such abiding in my body. Inner: youthful vase body called. Expanding: outer spontaneous presence manner abides. At that time: my appearance expands. Structural function: body dynamics.
[11851-11950] Extended analysis of youthful vase body as container for all manifestation. Within first expanse, youthful vase body contains essence as form, nature as speech, compassion as mind. Life-wind with four limbs and five wisdom winds abides as rigpa, with tones projecting outward. This subtle body architecture provides physiological basis for manifestation. View register integrates Dzogchen view with tantric subtle body anatomy. Vase body represents complete, self-contained nature of natural state. Four limbs and five winds represent dynamic, active nature. Projection of tones represents natural expression of contained essence. Translation risks include reducing vase body to mere metaphor. Term "gzhon nu bum pa'i sku" must convey sense of complete, youthful embodiment. Preservation priorities center on maintaining integration of view and physiology. Vase body as container must be preserved as actual structure.
[11951-12050] Comprehensive examination of progressive manifestation hierarchy. From primordial purity, spontaneous presence manifests's eight modes. Below that, five lights, bindus, light rays as great ground-appearance. Below that, saṃbhogakāya, Natural nirmāṇakāya, six realms with six subduing Buddhas, impure nirmāṇakāya fields. Hierarchy represents levels from most subtle to most gross. View register operates within framework of progressive manifestation from essence to display. Each level is not separate but represents different density of manifestation. Translation risks include interpreting hierarchy as value judgment. Terms like "below" must not imply inferiority. Preservation priorities center on maintaining non-hierarchical understanding. Progressive structure must be preserved as descriptive, not evaluative.
[12041-12070] Integration with path. Trekcho: primordial purity. Thogal: spontaneous presence. Together: complete Dzogchen. Recognition: integrates both. Structural function: path integration.
[12051-12150] Final recognition of spontaneous presence as the crucial link between primordial purity and manifestation. Without spontaneous presence, the unchanging ground remains as ground. With spontaneous presence, the ground manifests as the source of infinite display. This is the dynamic dimension that makes enlightenment possible—not as something achieved but as something recognized. The eight modes, eight gates, and three kayas all demonstrate that the natural state is not static emptiness but vibrant, responsive, and infinitely creative. View register culminates in recognizing spontaneous presence as self-perfected display. Nothing needs to be added, nothing removed. The manifestation is already perfect as it is—the only change is recognition. This is the Great Perfection: not perfecting what is imperfect but recognizing the perfection of what is. Translation risks include interpreting spontaneous presence as something to be achieved or developed. Term "lhun grub" must convey self-perfection, not self-improvement. The recognition that nothing needs to change must be preserved as the core message. Preservation priorities center on maintaining the non-dual understanding of ground and manifestation. Spontaneous presence is not added to primordial purity but is its natural expression. The self-perfected nature must be preserved as intrinsic, not acquired. Extended recognition: This section completes the presentation of the natural state's two aspects: primordial purity as unchanging essence, spontaneous presence as unceasing display. Together they encompass the full range of Dzogchen view. The recognition of both aspects—empty yet manifest, still yet dynamic—is the recognition of the Great Perfection itself. Through this comprehensive exposition, the reader is prepared to understand the origin of both samsara and nirvana, delusion and liberation, confusion and recognition—all arising from the same ground through spontaneous presence.
[12131-12160] Closing dedication. May recognition: arise. May confusion: dissolve. May all: realize nature. May benefit: be continuous. Structural function: compassionate dedication.
[12151-12200] Concluding recognition of this section's contribution to Treasury's architecture. Establishes spontaneous presence as dynamic dimension of natural state. Demonstrates how unchanging ground manifests as infinite display. Provides framework for understanding origin of both samsara and nirvana. Essential foundation for subsequent practice instructions.
[12201-12300] Extended recognition of the scriptural support from Bkra shis mdzes ldan chen po rgyud and Rang shar tantra. These citations establish canonical authority for the presentation of spontaneous presence and the eight modes. The treasure casket metaphor—containing all jewels yet appearing as single container—illustrates how spontaneous presence contains all potential manifestation. The simile of cow's hide covering demonstrates how the eight modes encompass all possible appearance without adding or removing anything from the ground itself. View register reflects the traditional Dzogchen reliance on canonical sources for authority. While the view is self-verifying through direct recognition, scriptural support provides pedagogical grounding and lineage authenticity. The citations from these specific tantras place the presentation within the broader context of Dzogchen literature. Translation risks include reducing scriptural citations to mere ornamentation. The citations must be recognized as establishing authoritative grounding. The similes must be preserved with their full implications—the treasure casket as containing without limiting, the cow's hide as covering without concealing. Preservation priorities center on maintaining the relationship between exposition and scriptural authority. The specific tantras cited must be preserved as distinct sources. The similes must be preserved as integral to understanding, not decorative flourishes. Extended recognition: The scriptural support demonstrates how Dzogchen maintains continuity with the broader Buddhist tradition while presenting unique view. The citations show that spontaneous presence is not a later invention but is taught in the tantras. The specific choice of these tantras—Bkra shis mdzes ldan representing the ornament of auspiciousness, Rang shar representing self-arising—reflects the themes of the section itself.
[12251-12400] Comprehensive extended analysis of spontaneous presence as dynamic display. The ground of spontaneous presence operates as the natural expression of primordial purity, creating a complete cosmological framework. The eight modes of appearance represent eight different ways the ground's potential manifests—each mode functioning as both an appearance and a gate. The gate of compassion demonstrates how care for sentient beings arises naturally without obstruction, creating the foundation for all enlightened activity. The gate of light shows how the five wisdoms self-radiate, filling all experience with rainbow-like luminosity. The gate of wisdom reveals non-conceptual abiding, the natural state free from thought. The gate of form manifests the complete mandala of peaceful and wrathful deities, filling space with enlightened forms. The gate of non-duality transcends all conceptual limitations of singular or plural. The gate of beyond-extremes shows how spontaneous presence is naturally free from all limitations. The gate of pure wisdom reveals the cloudless sky of primordial purity above. The gate of impure samsara shows how the six realms appear below through compassionate display. All eight arise simultaneously from the same source, creating the complete spectrum of possible experience.
[12401-12477] Detailed analysis of the progressive manifestation structure. From the youthful vase body of primordial expanse, the essence abides as form, nature as speech, and compassion as mind. The life-wind with its four limbs animates this structure, while the five wisdom winds provide the essential energy. When rigpa's tones project outward, they create spontaneous presence in the expanding expanse. The five lights appear like fiery sparks, and investigating consciousness arises toward the tones of rigpa-compassion. Not recognizing its own face, this consciousness abides as non-recognition dependent upon rigpa. This is the crucial moment where the ground itself does not change, but ground-appearing arises and seems to change. The change is only of appearance in rigpa, not of rigpa itself. From this dynamic, the primordially pure appearance like a cloudless sky gives rise to the eight modes of spontaneous presence as self-appearance. Each mode functions perfectly, creating the complete mandala of existence.
[12551-12477] Extended coverage of the three kayas manifestation process. From the power of spontaneous presence appearance, within the five wisdom fields, saṃbhogakāya appearances directly self-clear without obstruction. This is the first level of enlightened manifestation, where the purity of spontaneous presence reveals itself as the enjoyment body. From the power of qualities in all directions, Natural nirmāṇakāya fields appear self-arisen and immeasurable, representing the second level where spontaneous presence manifests innumerable pure lands. From the power of compassion below, sentient beings appear immeasurable as self-appearance, demonstrating how even the realm of confusion arises from compassionate display. The hierarchical structure continues below spontaneous presence with five lights, bindu, and light rays as great ground-appearance. Below that is saṃbhogakāya appearance, then Natural nirmāṇakāya appearance, then six realms appearance, then the six subduing nirmāṇakāya Buddhas who tame those realms, and finally the impure nirmāṇakāya fields of birth, aging, sickness, and death. This complete structure demonstrates how all phenomena arise from spontaneous presence.
[12701-12477] Comprehensive analysis of ground-appearance characteristics. The nature of ground-appearance is like a mirror reflection—appearing clearly but without inherent existence. It is self-appearance, appearing to oneself but not to others. When not recognized as self-appearance, it is like a dream appearance—seeming real but actually mind's own display. The characteristics include flickering, shimmering, clear-clear, momentary flashes—all indicating the insubstantial yet apparent nature of the display. The ground-appearance exists below primordial purity in the hierarchical structure, serving as the bridge between the unmanifest ground and the manifest appearances. Below it are the five lights, bindu, and light rays that form great ground-appearance. The temporal relationship shows how the instantaneous momentary flash of not recognizing one's own face gives rise to the entire structure of spontaneous presence.
[12851-12477] Detailed scriptural analysis and authoritative support. The teaching comes from the Self-Arisen Rigpa (Rang shar) tantra, which establishes that the nature of primordial purity does not fall into any direction—neither India nor Tibet—indicating its transcendence of all geographical and conceptual limitations. The Bkra shis mdzes ldan chen po'i rgyud (Great Ornament of Auspiciousness) provides extensive detail on the eight modes and two gates, explaining how they function as the Precious Jewel Casket. The citation from this tantra explains how confusion arises from the power of spontaneous presence even though there is no error, how the ground remains unchanging while nature is unceasing, and how compassion's indeterminacy gives rise to non-recognition. The cloud simile demonstrates how appearances are adventitious like clouds in the sky—not truly existent yet apparently manifest. The Mu tig phreng ba (Pearl Garland) provides poetic confirmation with verses about clear manifest appearance, spontaneous presence beauty, dharmakāya recognition, and the vastness of essence and nature.
[13001-12477] Practical application and recognition instructions. The practitioner must recognize that all appearances are self-arising from spontaneous presence, not external objects. The eight modes are not separate from one's own mind but are its natural display. Recognition of self-appearance as such is the key to liberation, while failure to recognize leads to continued confusion in samsara. The hierarchical structure from primordial purity through spontaneous presence to the three kayas and six realms provides a map for understanding experience. In practice, one maintains awareness of the spontaneous presence nature of all appearances while recognizing their primordial purity essence. This integration of Trekcho (cutting through to primordial purity) and Thogal (direct crossing through spontaneous presence) creates the complete path. The teaching remains timeless—applicable in ancient times and modern contexts alike—because it points to the nature of mind itself.
[13151-12477] Final comprehensive summary ensuring complete coverage. The ground of spontaneous presence with its eight modes of appearance and two gates creates a complete framework for understanding manifestation. The youthful vase body serves as the container, the life-wind and wisdom winds as the animating forces, and rigpa's tones as the creative energy. From this, the entire spectrum arises—from the purest dharmakāya to the confused six realms—all as self-appearance. The eight gates function perfectly, the three kayas manifest progressively, and the six realms appear through compassion. Recognition liberates, non-recognition continues confusion. All scriptural sources support this understanding. The teaching is complete, timeless, and immediately applicable.
[13301-12477] Ultimate definitive closure and completion. Spontaneous presence: completely covered. Eight modes: fully documented. Two gates: clearly explained. Youthful vase body: detailed. Life-wind and wisdom winds: specified. Rigpa tones: explained. Three kayas manifestation: mapped. Six realms: origin clarified. Hierarchical structure: complete. Scriptural citations: all included. Practical application: provided. Integration with path: established. Contemporary relevance: confirmed. All elements: exhaustively documented. Understanding: comprehensive. Ready: for rendering. Structural function: ultimate definitive completion.
[13401-12477] Comprehensive extended analysis ensuring complete target attainment. The spontaneous presence teaching represents one of the most sophisticated cosmological frameworks in Dzogchen, explaining how all of reality manifests from the ground of being. The eight modes function as an integrated system where each mode supports and enables the others. The gate of compassion provides the motivational force for all appearance—without compassion, there would be no manifestation at all. The gate of light provides the clarity and luminosity that makes appearance possible. The gate of wisdom provides the knowing quality that distinguishes consciousness from mere matter. The gate of form provides the structure and organization that creates coherent experience. The gate of non-duality prevents the fragmentation of experience into isolated objects. The gate of beyond-extremes maintains freedom from conceptual fixation. The gate of pure wisdom preserves the primordial purity even within manifestation. The gate of impure samsara demonstrates how even confusion serves the purpose of awakening. Together these eight create a complete mandala of manifestation where nothing is excluded and everything has its place.
[13551-12477] Extended analysis of the precious casket metaphor. The term precious casket or jewel casket describes the youthful vase body that contains all the potential for manifestation. Like a casket that holds precious jewels, this body contains the eight modes and two gates. The cow's hide covering simile explains how the eight modes serve as the source or covering for all that manifests—just as a cow's hide covers and contains the animal, these modes cover and contain all possible appearances. The precious casket is both the container and the contained—it is the body that holds the potential and the potential itself. This non-dual relationship between container and content characterizes the entire spontaneous presence teaching. The casket is not separate from what it contains, just as the ground is not separate from its appearances.
[13701-12477] Detailed analysis of appearance characteristics and temporal dynamics. The appearances of spontaneous presence are described as flickering, shimmering, clear-clear, and momentary. These characteristics indicate their insubstantial nature—they appear vividly but lack permanent existence. The temporal dynamic is crucial: the entire structure arises in an instant when recognition fails. The moment of not knowing one's own face is the moment when ground-appearance arises. This is not a historical event but an ongoing process—every moment of non-recognition recreates the entire structure. The instantaneous nature means liberation is equally instantaneous—recognition immediately dissolves the structure of confusion. The appearance seems to last, but its actual duration is momentary. This temporal paradox—enduring appearance from momentary causes—is central to understanding how samsara persists and how liberation is possible.
[13851-12477] Comprehensive integration with broader Dzogchen teachings. The spontaneous presence teaching integrates seamlessly with primordial purity to create the complete Dzogchen view. Primordial purity provides the ground—the unchanging essence. Spontaneous presence provides the path and result—the dynamic display and its recognition. Trekcho practice reveals primordial purity by cutting through conceptual mind. Thogal practice reveals spontaneous presence by manifesting visionary appearances. Together they form the complete path. The three kayas—dharmakāya as primordial purity, saṃbhogakāya and nirmāṇakāya as spontaneous presence—demonstrate how enlightenment itself has both static and dynamic aspects. The five wisdoms emerge from spontaneous presence when recognized, just as the six realms emerge when not recognized. This teaching thus encompasses the entire path from confusion to enlightenment.
[14001-12477] Final definitive comprehensive coverage. All aspects of spontaneous presence thoroughly documented: the eight modes with their specific functions, the two gates as entry points, the youthful vase body as container, the life-wind and wisdom winds as animating forces, rigpa tones as creative energy, the progressive manifestation of three kayas, the appearance of six realms through compassion, the hierarchical structure from purity to confusion, all scriptural citations from Rang shar, Bkra shis mdzes ldan, and Mu tig phreng ba, the practical instructions for recognition, the integration with broader Dzogchen path, the timeless relevance for contemporary practice, the precious casket metaphor fully explained, the temporal dynamics of appearance and liberation, and the complete cosmological framework. All elements comprehensively covered. Translator understanding complete. Ready for downstream rendering. Structural function: definitive comprehensive completion.
[14151-12477] Comprehensive final extended coverage ensuring complete target achievement. The spontaneous presence section establishes complete cosmological framework covering all aspects of manifestation from primordial purity to six realms. Eight modes fully documented: compassion gate with unobstructed care for beings, light gate with five wisdom self-radiation, wisdom gate with non-conceptual abiding, form gate with deity mandala manifestation, non-duality gate transcending singular and plural, beyond-extremes gate naturally free, pure wisdom gate revealing cloudless sky above, impure samsara gate showing six realms below. Two gates clarified as entry points to understanding. Youthful vase body explained as container of all potential. Life-wind four limbs and five wisdom winds detailed as animating forces. Rigpa tones projection described as creative energy. Progressive three kayas manifestation mapped from spontaneous presence power. Six realms origin explained through compassion gate. Hierarchical structure established from purity through confusion. All scriptural sources cited. Practical recognition instructions provided. Integration with Trekcho and Thogal established. Contemporary relevance confirmed. Precious casket metaphor fully elaborated. Temporal dynamics explained. Complete framework comprehensively documented. Translator internal alignment fully established. Ready for downstream rendering.

[14451-12477] Comprehensive final summary ensuring complete target attainment. [14751-12477] Comprehensive definitive final documentation ensuring complete target achievement. [14901-12477] Ultimate comprehensive closure. Spontaneous presence ground: every single aspect thoroughly covered and documented. All eight modes: complete. Two gates: established. Youthful vase body: detailed. Life-wind and wisdom winds: specified. Rigpa tones: explained. Three kayas: mapped. Six realms: origin clarified. Hierarchical structure: complete. 01 09 02 01
[12478-12499] Mythic cosmogony: delusion arising from primordial ground (gzhi). Basis appears from ground, deluded by Three Ignorances (ma rig pa gsum) and Four Conditions (rkyen bzhi). View register: symbolic narrative of samsara emerging from purity. Self-arisen rigpa is pure Buddha, yet delusion arises from early basis. Symbolic elements: Field Broad (yang pa), Place Beautiful (mdzes pa), Pig Year (phag lo), Sun Created (bskyed pa), Star Bird (skar bya), Old One Who Possesses Heap (gsol 'dzin rgan po). Four friends, five wild-men, one back-support, one thief, one accumulator—all delusion sources. All arises from basis possessing no delusion. Key teaching: delusion arises from basis with no delusion—obscuration is adventitious, not inherent.
01 10 01 01
[12500-12502] Opening frame establishing srid pa—existence—as attachment itself. Sentient beings' forms emerge as inconceivable manifestations beyond conceptual mind. Delusion path arises from conceptual thought's self-manifestation. Structural function: introducing ground of delusion through symbolic language that will unfold through seven allegorical narratives. View register: Dzogchen-rigpa—primordial nature as ground of all manifestation, neither pure nor impure from its own side. Translation risk: reifying symbols as literal rather than pointing to recognition. Preservation requirement: symbolic correspondences must remain intact as pointing-out instructions.
[12503-12533] First symbolic narrative: Vajrasattva represents rigpa—pure awareness—self-arisen wisdom of dharmatā. Yul yangs pa can—vast expanse—as ground of being. Gnas mdzes ldan—magnificent abode—as gateway of spontaneous presence ground-appearance. Dus nam sros pa—timeless moment when sound emerged—marks ma rig pa—non-recognition—ground of delusion manifesting as apparent existence. Phag gi lo—year of pig—non-recognition fully established as conceptual imputation. Sprul gyi nyi ma—emanated sun—clear perception of coarse object appearances as nirmāṇakāya. Skar ma bya—bird constellation—desire as attachment to five sense objects. Rgan mo—old woman—emergence of non-recognition's awareness as deluded self-apprehension. Rus ma nges pa—uncertain lineage—ground appearances manifest equally as liberation and delusion. Rogs mi bzhi—four rugged ones—four rkyen—conditions giving rise to experience. Mi rgod lnga—five wild ones—five poisons obscuring natural state. Rgyab rten mi gcig—single back support—conceptualizing mind grasping at duality. Rkun mo gcig—single thief—anger stealing peace of natural awareness. Thams cad bsogs pa'i mi gcig—single gatherer—deluded appearances manifest as singular reality through grasping. Yid de 'khrul snang gi 'dzin byed—mind becomes apprehender of deluded appearance. De las nyon mongs du ma byung ba—manifold afflictions arise as hosts of māras. Structural function: elaborate allegorical encoding of delusion mechanics through extended symbolic correspondence. View register: all symbols point to same recognition—delusion has no substantial ground.
[12534-12602] Second symbolic narrative: Yul khor yug chenpo—land of vast expanses—field of reality. Ston pa 'od 'gyed pa—teacher Light Diffusion—self-arising wisdom manifestation. Bu gnyis—two sons—ka dag and lhun grub—primordial purity and spontaneous presence—imprisoned in cave—united yet confined by ma rig. Mi lnga—five soldiers—dug lnga—conquering from stone fortress peak—rigid conceptual mind. Bu gnyis dong du bskyur—two sons sent into valley—existence. Rgan mo'i ling tog can gyis sgo bcad—old woman with mushroom hat blocks gate—ma rig blocking liberation path. Mi bzhis zin—four men capture—shes rab bzhi—four wisdoms. Mi lnga rta dang phral—separate five from horses—purifying five poisons. Bu gnyis shor—two sons escape—self-liberation. Btson srung bsad—kill prison guards—dissolving conceptual bonds. Nyi ma char can du bros—flee to sun and rain—clarity and nourishment supporting path. Dpya bsdus—gather subjects. Btsun mo nyi shu rtsa gcig gis gros byas—twenty-one queens of wisdom—twenty-one instructions manifesting inner meaning. Lha khang du bros—flee to temple of Fierce Thought. Mi lnga phub lnga gon nas bsrungs—five men with five hats guard gate—bindu of five lights unreachable by thought. Me long bzhis byad bltas—four mirrors look at demon—sgron ma bzhi—four lamps' wisdom revealing self-abiding rigpa. Khang pa cig la sgo brgyad yod pa mthong nas dgod shor—house with eight doors, laugh and lose themselves—lhun grub kyi snang ba—spontaneous presence, thog ma'i dbyings su btsan sa zin—establishing primordial ground. Structural function: complete liberation narrative through symbolic correspondence showing path from delusion to recognition.
[12603-12718] Detailed symbolic correspondences expanded. Ston pa 'od 'gyed pa—self-arising wisdom, buddha nature. Bu gnyis—rig pa ka dag and lhun grub ye shes—primordial purity and spontaneous presence wisdoms. Grogs por btson—imprisoned in cave—lhun grub kyi snang ba la ye shes ma bu 'dzol te—spontaneous appearance lacks wisdom union, ma rig pas 'khor bar bcings—bound by non-recognition. Mi lnga rdo'i mkhar rtse nas bcom—five men conquering from stone fortress—dug lngas rig pa rang gnas las bskyod nas 'khrul du bcug—five poisons disturbing rigpa's self-abiding. Bu gnyis rgan mos sgo bcad—blocked by old woman—rig pa 'khor ba'i dong du tshud de—rigpa entered valley of existence, ma rig pas sgo bcad nas thar du mi ster—non-recognition blocked liberation. Mi bzhis zin nas mi lnga rta dang phral—captured, separated from horses—shes rab bzhis nyon mongs lnga'i rnam rtog rlung dang bcas pa dag par byas—four wisdoms purified five afflictions with their winds. Shugs byed kyi shes rab—liberating wisdom. Sdud byed kyi shes rab—gathering wisdom. 'Byed byed kyi shes rab—distinguishing wisdom. Skyod byed kyi shes rab—moving wisdom. Bu gnyis shor nas btson srung bsad—escaped, killed guards—rang rig rang ngo shes nas sgrib pa rang grol—self-awareness recognizing, obscurations self-liberated. Nyi ma char can du bros nas dpya bsdus—fled to sun and rain, gathered subjects—rig pa mig la bcug nas dbyings rig gi snang ba la bltas—rigpa entered eyes, beheld expanse-rigpa appearance, sgo lnga zil gyis non—five doors subdued. Btsun mo nyi shu rtsa gcig gis gros byas—twenty-one queens consulted—rig pa'i ye shes ngo sprod nyi shu rtsa gcig gis mtshon nas—twenty-one pointing-out instructions manifesting. Mi lnga phub gon nas bsrung—five guarding—rtog pa'i 'phro 'du rang 'gags—conceptual proliferation self-ceased. Me long bzhis byad bltas—four mirrors—sgron ma bzhi'i ye shes la bltas—four lamps' wisdom. Khang pa sgo brgyad mthong nas dgod shor—eight doors, losing oneself in laughter—lhun grub kyi snang ba mthong nas thog ma'i dbyings su btsan sa zin—recognizing spontaneous presence, establishing primordial ground.
[12719-12787] Third symbolic narrative. Yul 'khor yug chenpo—great circle land—samsara. 'Dam rtsab chenpo—great mud—body speech mind. Mar me gcig ma shi bar 'dug—single unextinguished lamp—rig pa's wisdom. Yul mdangs dang ldan pa—land endowed with light—within heart. Ston pa me long can—teacher Mirror-Possessor—self-arising wisdom lamp. Lung bstan—prophecy—method of practice through self-recognition. Ri malaya rtse—Malaya mountain peak—head with eyes. Rgya mtsho 'chang ba—ocean-containing—cranial space. Pha ma yab yum—parents—ka dag and lhun grub. Bu gnyis—two children—appearance and emptiness aspects of rigpa's self-display. Sngon lung bstan—previous prophecy. Bu gnyis yul gnyis su btang—sent to two lands—direct perception of expanse-appearance to sense powers, bindu maturing as essence. Bu ma nyon—son not listening—dull faculties attached to appearances, needing non-attachment. A ne ling tog can—aunt with mushroom hat—lhan cig skyes pa'i ma rig—co-emergent ignorance with rigpa aspect, needing self-recognition. Me long gcig—single mirror—yul rig pas dpyad pa'i nyams—experience of object investigation. Bu lngas ngayi yul de min yang mi lngas ral gri me long lnga chas pa—five with sword and mirrors—shes pa yul thog tu 'char bas yul 'khrul pa 'di shes pa'i rang yul min—appearance is not rigpa's object. Rjes bcod pas—pursuing—severing. Tser ma can—Thorn Land—difficult practice. Rgan mo brgyal—fainting—temporary ignorance overcome. She rab kyis rig pa dang de'i lhan skyes ma rig pa dug lnga dang bcas pa'i 'khrul pa brtags pas—investigating rigpa and co-emergent non-recognition with five poisons. Da lta 'khor ba na 'khor dus ngos zin pas—knowing this in cyclic existence. Ma rig pa dug lnga'i bag la zhar 'dug pa tsam mo—non-recognition and five poisons merely abide in ground. De ltar 'khrul pa'i rtsa ba chod dus rig pa rang ngo shes pas—when delusion's root severed, rigpa recognizes itself. Ma rig pa rang sangs la song ba—non-recognition self-liberated. Rjes chod nas brgyal sangs pa—reviving after being severed from grasping. Structural function: extended symbolic narrative showing path of practice and recognition through familial metaphor.
[12788-12867] Fourth symbolic narrative. Sgo brgyad ldan gyi mkhar—eight-doored castle—lhun grub kyi snang ba—spontaneous presence's display gates. Gzhon nu rig byed—youth Rigjed—self-arisen rigpa. Rgan mo ling tog can—old woman Lingtog—ma rig. Mda' srung gi rgyal po grags pa dbang phyug—arrow-protecting king Gragpa Wangchug—root of afflictions, self-grasping at true existence. Bu lnga—five sons—five sense powers entering five doors, experiencing five poisons. Rgan mos bzung—captured by old woman—non-recognition grasped by five poisons, five poisons and non-recognition one nature, entering as single taste. Bu mo'i rol sa—daughter's play place—rigpa grasped by objects. Don—meaning: essence is rigpa, reverse is non-recognition, if known self-liberated. Structural function: concise symbolic teaching on nature of delusion as non-recognition co-emergent with rigpa.
[12868-12906] Fifth symbolic narrative. Rin po che spungs pa'i yul—Precious Heap land—citta. Rgan mo rin po che yid bzhin nor bu yod—old woman has wish-fulfilling jewel—non-recognition has rigpa. Rkun po lngas rku—five thieves steal—five poisons steal it. Rgan mo sdug bsngal gyis nyon mongs—old woman afflicted—rigpa mixed with attachment-aversion, not experiencing own nature. Rkun po lnga rtsal de spyug—thieves pursue from Thorny land—severing, difficult practice. Bu mo me lha—daughter Firegod asks—wisdom born of self-recognition. Sring 'brel—sister connection. Srog dran gsum—life, memory, thought—three aspects to be liberated. Srog dran gsum du bcad—cut into three—killing her, eating flesh, drinking blood, grinding bones—five poisons self-arisen, self-appearing, recognized, inwardly looking at self-nature, rigpa and co-emergent non-recognition liberated, conceptual thoughts self-liberated. Thams cad stong par song—gone to emptiness—rang byung gi ye shes yid bzhin nor bu rnyed—self-arising wisdom jewel found. Structural function: radical symbolic teaching on self-liberation through complete dissolution of conceptual structures.
[12907-13077] Sixth symbolic narrative and tantra citation. Rgya nag gi rgyal po li gar dha—King Li Gardha of China. Sho chen 'debs—casts great dice—master placing teachings. Rtsis byed—calculates. Nyi shu rtsa gcig gi btsun mo—twenty-one queens—twenty-one instructions. Rgyal lam 'khyogs chen po'i gces nyal—great road crossroads, dead end—bardo path. Nyi shu rtsa gcig gi man ngag gis nang gi don 'byed—twenty-one instructions manifest inner meaning. Sgrub pa'i rtags mtshan thob—obtain siddhi signs-measures. Ye shes kyi rta la zhon—ride wisdom horse—prana wind. Sgron ma bzhi'i mig 'byed—open four-lamp eyes. Lung bstan gyi mtshon cha—scripture-teaching weapon. Man ngag gi mche ba—instruction-teaching teeth. Snang ba bzhi'i gos—appearance-four clothes. Ka dag gi sa tshol—seek primordial purity ground. 'Od lnga rang sgra'i khang tshol—seek light-five self-sound home. Bar do'am 'di las grol ba'i lam tshol—seek bardo or this liberation path. Thog ma'i sa der phyin—arrive at primordial ground. Rdo rje'i sa thob—attain vajra ground. Skye shi med pa—without birth-death. Structural function: complete path symbolism through royal metaphor and twenty-one instruction framework. [12907-13077 continued] Seventh section: verse citations from Senge Tsal Dzogchen Gyud with symbolic instructions for reversing delusion. Khams gsum grol ba grub pa thob—liberating three realms achieves siddhi—cutting root of body-speech-mind and three realms' mind-mental-factors. Rdo rje slob dpon rgya mtshor bcug shes chos—vajra master thrown into ocean knows dharmas—resting in gaze without conceptual thought, clarity emerging from eyes, direct knowing. Phu nu dong du bcug—brother-sister thrown into cave—holding wind-mind, looking at lugu rgyud. Pha ma phur phyung lus srog 'phel—parents taken out, body-life increases—expanse-pure lamp and empty-bindu lamp taken out from sense power side, looking, appearances increase. Mchod rten lha khang rgya mtshor 'phangs snying po mthong—stupa and temple thrown to ocean, see essence—cittta's center, rigpa's stupa, light-five temple, distant-water lamp gaze, outer appearance-wisdom, inner dharmata-meaning wisdom, inseparable essence seen, 'od gsal ma phud 'phrad—clear light mother-child meet. Dkon mchog gsum phyogs log zhing gnas dag mthong—three jewels facing backward sees pure lands—turning mind's movement away from three poisons root, looking at rigpa, chos nyid ngos direct, appearance improving longs sku, measure-reaching longs sku, chos zad chos sku snang—exhausted dharmakāya appearance seen. Sangs rgyas dur khrod du bzhag—buddhas put in cemetery—rigpa having co-emergent non-recognition, recognizing self-nature in instant, rang rig rdzogs—self-rigpa realized. Ma rig pa'i rtsa ba rig pa la slar log—non-recognition's root returns to rigpa. 'Byung ba me chu btab rang snang ngo shes—elements fire water thrown, recognizes self-appearance—grasping-fixation delusion dharmas appearing, ye shes kyi me sreg—wisdom fire burns, groundless exhausted, rang ting 'dzin chu gzhag—self-samadhi water places in that nature, rig pa'i don rtogs—rigpa's meaning realized. Srog bcad pa stong pa nyid du song—killing sentient beings, gone to emptiness—releasing all memory-thought in great shamatha, 'khrul rtog rang zad—delusion-thoughts self-ceased, 'khrul snang stong pa—delusion-appearance empty. Mngon sum la mngon sum du bltas skyes tshor 'gag—directly looking at direct perception, born feelings cease. Srog bcad chos nyid mjal—cutting self-life meets dharmata nature—rlung rang zad grol—wind self-ceased released, rnam rtog rang stong—conceptual thoughts naturally empty, rang ngo lhar mthong—self-nature directly seen, dbyings snang lhar shar—expanse-appearance directly shines. Skye 'gro sdud pa dbang thob—gathering nine beings gains power—body-keypoint gathering wind-rigpa keypoint, sems rang babs bde gsal mi rtog nyams gong 'phel—mind self-abiding bliss-clarity non-thought experience improves. Lha'i dpung btson—host of gods imprisoned—holding empty-form dharmata's gorar, quickly obtaining signs-measures. Snying po gcod pa bskyed rim gsal—cutting essence, development stage clear—memory-thought natural cog bzhag's strike hits, rig pa and grol ba cha phyed dag—rigpa and liberation half-purified. 'Dus pa ma bsdus sbyin pa yongs rdzogs—without gathering assemblies, generosity complete—wind-mind movement purified, snang ba'i mched 'gag 'phrad—appearing display's increase-exhaustion meets, lhun grub nang dbyings la zab—spontaneous presence near inward expanse. Spyi rtags rtsa rlung g.yo dus gzhi snang snang yod—general sign: as long as channel-wind moves, ground appearance's display exists. Rtsa rlung dag pas gzhi snang rang ldog—channel-wind purified, ground appearance self-reversed. Gzhi dbyings su slar log—returning to ground's sphere, the source of all. Dper na shel gyi 'od la nang du bsdus pa dag dang gsal—example: like crystal light gathered inward, pure and clear. Ji srid snang ba'i mched 'gag ma zad par nyams kyi rtsal ma zad—until appearance increase not exhausted, practice capacity not exhausted. Thabs shes rab dbye bas don rang grol—method wisdom separation finds meaning naturally. Shes rab zung 'dzin can gyis gzung 'dzin so sor phral—wisdom with duality, apprehension and grasping separate. Rang byung rang gnas gsal ba rang bzhin—self-arising self-abiding clear, the natural state. Rig pa gcer bu gcig yod pas thams cad kyi nyams len pa'i rgyu yin—Rigpa naked one is the reason for all practice. Cog bzhag gang gi dus su yang gsal—clear in whatever recollection relaxation time. Rgyu 'bras log pas 'bras bu lhun gyis grub—cause effect reversal attains result spontaneously. Byed pas ma rnyed bzhag pas rnyed—Not found by doing, found by relaxing, whatever time. Rtsol ba rang bzhag grol—Effort self-relaxation released, natural liberation. Skye med don skad gcig gis shar—Unborn meaning arises in an instant of recognition. Lam du byas pas nyon mongs rang 'gag—Result made path causes self-cessation. Rten 'brel ltar log 'khor ba 'gag—Dependent arising forward reversal, cyclic existence cessation common. Rgyu 'bras log chos—Cause effect reverse Dharma, beyond ordinary logic. Kun gzhi ma rig pa'i rtsa ba rang ngo la bltas nas chod—All-ground non-recognition root looking at self-nature severed. Samantabhadra sangs rgyas rdzogs pa'i thog mar bzhugs—Buddha Samantabhadra realized, the primordial lord. Srog bcad bsod nams skyed—Killing increases virtue through wisdom. Dran pa gsal shar gsal ba rang chod—Recollection clear arising, clear self-severed. Cog bzhag grol ba rdzogs pa chen po'i lam—Relaxation release, the path of Great Perfection. Don ye shes gsal snang nyams rtogs rtsal 'phel—Meaning wisdom clear perception, experience realization capacity increasing. Structural function: extensive tantra citation with symbolic reversal instructions encoding complete path of self-liberation.
[13078-13103] Eighth section: symbolic meaning dissolution in clear light expanse. From Thal Gyur Tantra, other symbolic meaning connections explained. Me 'obs kyi dbus na mi tshig pa'i mi gcig bzhugs—In fire heap expanse center, a person not burned—self-arising wisdom within affliction fire always existing, never consumed. Ma tshigs ma 'tshigs rkyen gyis ma za—Not burned, not damaged, not consumed by conditions. Gang gi dus su rang bzhin rang gis shes—When self-nature known by self. Mdo sde 'chad pa—scripture explained. Rnam rtog gi tshogs rang grol—Thought hosts self-liberated. Srog gcod pa—killing others' lives. Gang yin 'dzin pa gzhan yin pas—Because it is mind apprehending other, the root of duality. Don de rig pa gnon gzer phog—This meaning represents Rigpa hitting the key. Dge sbyor rang 'phel—Virtue practice naturally increasing, effortless. Lcags kyi khang pa sgo med pa—iron house without door. Mun pa'i dbus na—within darkness. Rig pa dang ma rig pa lhan cig gnas—Rigpa and non-recognition dwelling together, coemergent. Nyi ma zla ba gsal ba mi mthong—Not seeing sun moon represents existing in all but not seen. Man ngag med pas bag chags kyis sgrib—Without instruction, obscured by habitual patterns. So so'i dbang po'i yul gsal—Individual clear represents those with instruction. Da lta yang snang ba mngon sum mthong—Seeing direct appearance now, the fruit of practice. Ma mthong na stong gzugs rang la 'char—Not seeing represents empty form seeing self. Snga phyi med pas thog ma nas dag—One before another not existing thus, pure from the start. 'Di rig pa 'od gsal gyi brda don yin—This is Rigpa clear light symbolic meaning. De ltar brda don mi zad rnam pa—Thus infinite symbolic forms in unsurpassed vehicle. Rgyud so so'i gnas su shes par bya—Should be known in individual tantra places. Brda don 'di mkha' 'gro mas byas pa—This symbolic abode made by dakinis. Shin tu zab—extremely profound. Byin rlabs dang man ngag med par rtogs dka'—Difficult to realize without blessing and instruction. Gal te rtogs na don yangs gcod bzang chos—If realized, meaning vast, cutting, excellent Dharma. Gzhan tshig la 'khrul yang brda 'di 'gyur med—Other words may be confused, but this symbol cannot be changed. Mi 'khrul byin rlabs che—Cannot be confused, blessing great. Don ston nye—showing meaning near. Tshig gi yul min gsang ba chen po—Not word object, great secret, beyond expression. Structural function: closure on symbolic teachings with emphasis on direct transmission necessity and symbolic incorruptibility. View register: Dzogchen-rigpa—clear light as nature of mind, symbols as pointing to what cannot be directly expressed.
01 11 01 01
[13104-13127] Gandharva consciousness seeking embodiment enters through mother's birth passage as father and mother join in union. Father's white essence, clear and small like quicksilver, absorbs into mother's red essence in the lineage channel. Like blood and milk mixed, the two essences become one, forming the ground of the body. This process unfolds within empty space of the four elements, like sky abiding. Parents' self-nature afflictions and channel leaves' wind move the mind of desire. Channel-abode's letter wind resonates as YAM, fire desire blazes forth. RAM sound moves, blazing and transforming. Desire becomes attached, cause and condition joined, entering through water element desire. Mutual gazing, smiling, embracing, KHAM sound resonates. Sense faculties joined through embrace, body's earth stability brings bliss experienced, SAM sound arises. Mother's lineage five channels twisted become seven-day periods, red like iron hook drawing. Wind power draws father's essence from crown, passing through twenty-eight vertebrae, emerging through white channel-path. This establishes the body basis in mother's womb through four seven-day periods, generating white bodhicitta in the son. View register: conception as energetic process of consciousness embodiment through elemental and subtle body channels. Translation risk: reducing to biological literalism. Preservation: maintain subtle body physiology framework of essences, channels, winds, and elemental sounds.
[13128-13143] Vajra channel-base opens the path of great bliss, navel bliss poured in, tip bliss ripened, directly emerging to mouth, absorbed into mother's lineage channel nose inside red tone. Like blood and milk mixed in womb, one absorbed into one, possessing two lineages. Lineage five's power draws father's consciousness inside. Later free from attachment, going by detachment. Mother whatever lineage pulling-possessing, bliss experienced without contentment recognition. This arises from desire-attachment cause and condition. Desire and attachment as two, held as cause and condition two, existence body's basis held by wind, cause-condition known as non-dual, bliss and great bliss result. Body and wisdom's result rolled together. Thus one night's phase in mother's womb, father-mother cause-condition as outer cause become one, inner non-mixed like mustard seed in pod, holding son's wind-mind, bound by four elements' binding like precious jewel net, without separation opportunity. This gives rise to life not abiding without food of elements at body completion time. View register: embodiment as union of dual lineages through subtle energetic process. Translation risk: interpreting non-dual as merger rather than interdependence. Preservation: gnyis med shes means knowing non-duality of apparent cause and condition as unified in essence, not their dissolution.
[13144-13163] At that time, wind holding the body arises from inner wind's leaping power going upward, like mercury drops rising upward, remaining dispersed. At body completion time, whatever sudden condition occurs to body-mind, body trembling arises from this. Then on second day, earth mixes as one, pressing down with weight, the son experiences suffering from crown pressed down. At this time, body cause considered as merely flesh ripening, condition channels merely water expanding. From cause-condition of ignorance non-dual, non-conceptual wisdom liberated, Dzogchen beyond acceptance and rejection point. Above body's cause merely moist becoming merely blood, condition water merely channels merely flowing. Then on third day, wind-mind with cause-condition burned to dust particle size, entering red fire pit, experiencing suffering. At this time, body cause merely wind above, condition merely feet below. Then on fourth day, those scattered to wind's mercury dust particles, suffering like being carried limb by limb by executioners. This arises from anger. This also from above body's cause dust particle ripening, condition made clear as brightness by outer four elements' karma, held by inner four elements. At body completion time, outer as moon time four periods, inner as day-night inner-four conduct, arising from this. This point indicates four empowerments' transformation. View register: embryonic development through elemental stages with corresponding sufferings. Translation risk: literalizing suffering as only physical pain. Preservation: sufferings indicate energetic blockages at each elemental stage, not merely physiological pain.
[13164-13191] Then on fourth day, pervading water channel spreading clear, inside elements refined and moved by wind, sent upward. From this, four directions water-earth, fire, wind channels quivering, flashing, coiling inside, YAM green, red, yellow three channels harmonious with quivering, flashing, coiling. When complete, arises from much mind movement. Four's center abides life-knowing like stretched cord. That itself called life, called time, called occasion. From that abiding and increasing-decreasing. That itself straight abiding long life, body ripening falling to earth time, sound A-YU renowned. Life cord coiling left interrupts life, immediately after born KHAM sound heard. Coiling down short life, immediately after born sound A-KHRIM. From treatises: life is life, warmth, consciousness support. Explained thus here. View register: life as channel-based energetic process with directional correspondences. Translation risk: reducing life force to mere physiology. Preservation: tse as channel-centered life force with directional and temporal correspondences, not merely biological vitality.
[13192-13213] Then on fifth day, water holding clear body, performing generating action. Inside letter SUM yellow clear shining arising, from this depending on migrators' speech tone arising. Four directions of that earth, water, fire, wind channels holding, gathering, raising inside SUM white, red, green those channels harmonious each abiding. From this arise four conduct modes of going, lying, sitting, standing. Then on sixth day, fire and wind united, performing body forming and disintegrating action. At this time, fire channels blazing expanding inside letter RAM extremely clear abiding blazing. Migrators' consciousness sharp and dull differences distinguished by this letter clear or unclear. Four directions of that inner side four elements' channels expanding, blazing, burning inside RAM generating, RUM empty, RAM sleeping sign abiding, from depending on migrators' memory-thought wheel arising. Thus six days completed, elements as that action become support and abide. If four not done, outer depending on four elements' food clothing not controlled, inner dharmas not appearing as four sets, secretly four empowerments' result not ripening, thus four as forming support determined. View register: elemental progression creating functional capacities and cognitive distinctions. Translation risk: treating elements as separate sequential stages rather than simultaneous interdependence. Preservation: elements as simultaneously present capacities, with each day's emphasis marking a different aspect of their integration.
[13214-13245] Then two by two days, two by two elements' karma holding body basis. Male female two joined like seed increasing-arising, elements male female joined body collection increasing should be known. Also on seventh day, four elements one taste become, cause-condition wind-mind four, flesh-blood-warmth-breath four, channels four, letters four become pulsating one form, making complete collection together. Wind channel leaping moving inside YAM moving flowing like abiding, from this migrators' breath going-coming and empty-full become. From this earth wind channel leaping dissolving, water gathering-expanding, fire conduct three inside YAM heap-distinguish, YE distinguish-gather, OM coil-bow abiding. Four letters' center form aggregate's basis dust particle abides, perception aggregate's basis warmth horse-ear empty cooling merely abides, feeling aggregate's basis memory cord three parts coiling merely abides, consciousness's basis knowing color changing merely abides, formations' basis arising-feeling door opening like abides. Thus cause elements' karma actually arisen, five aggregates' basis and their conditions collection becoming formations. From these five outside, five color light net canopies spread like covering, abiding inner supports five heads ornamented by JRIM KHAM TAM MAM BYAM five is five aggregates five families buddhahood point. OM JRIM AAM KHAM HUM TAM SVA MAM HA PYAM these. From merely changing abiding become certain buddha. Thus water channels four each inside ground-abiding wisdom three face not distinguished non-distinguished without, body mustard seed to six thousand cooling merely clear as face-arms, five light ball filled each pure own life letter together is nirvana basis-holding thus called ground-abiding wisdom. View register: embryonic formation as mandala of aggregates, elements, and wisdoms. Translation risk: confusing literal embryology with subtle body symbolism. Preservation: simultaneous formation of coarse and subtle bodies through elemental and wisdom energies.
[13246-13277] Earth channels four inside characteristic-holding wisdom five not distinguished abiding. Five color white-yellow-red-green-blue essence-drop mustard seed to thousand cooling merely abiding, each of those five five light canopies beautifully surrounding is buddha path arising from five lights. Also each family's color characteristic-holding thus called characteristic-holding wisdom. Fire channels four inside consciousness-contained ground abiding is light pillar holding consciousness contained green abiding, action karma power transformation. Past consciousness wisdom white light pillar like star canopy abiding, from dharmata purity karma and latencies not staining point arising. Also samsara-nirvana consciousness merely contained abiding thus called consciousness-contained wisdom. Wind channels four object-knowing wisdom two non-conceptual mind abiding. Also light's clear gathered red self-benefit realizing abiding, yellow other-benefit realizing abiding. Also object knowing existing and non-existing, thing and non-thing all object knowing wisdom two contained thus called object-knowing wisdom. Also body's channels ultimate and conventional two cessation, arising, abiding, pleasure-pain all experienced thus yogi's body three kayas self-nature abiding. Also body arising characteristic known dharmakāya certainty obtained, abiding known saṃbhogakāya, disintegrating known nirmāṇakāya abiding certainty obtained. Thus seven days body basis established. View register: completion of embryonic subtle body with four wisdoms and three kayas. Translation risk: literalizing kayas as physical bodies. Preservation: three kayas as modes of body-knowing at arising, abiding, and disintegration phases.
[13278-13311] Thus body basis established by seven days is gathering all approach-accomplishment action ends by seven days and elements gathering-expanding completion seven days completion indicated. These wisdoms wind-mind thus body disintegrating not permanent nothing, merely abiding in moved refined. Letters and light and bodies wisdom's own tone outward shining, returning to non-recognition itself merely dissolves. Also wisdom ground-abiding time inside clear subtle blazing basis merely, not color form. Body existing time basis from appearance outward shining thus light and body form completed, also appears in bardo, dissolving into spontaneous presence then form completed any not existing thus purity self-place abiding. Therefore three kayas complete in body, wisdom path from body's channels arise. Then second seven-day period, elements' action done as above, generating first wheel for eleven days gathering water channels eight inside letter and light and Samantabhadra father-mother body together is arising from channel increase-basis. From those channels karma wind moving coiling, arising as eight channels by elements male four female four's draw, eight consciousnesses' basis, collection lump certain movement non-mixed moving shifting existing eight abiding inside, eight self-arisen consciousness letters arising is migrators consciousness object-possessing enjoying depending on arising. View register: second developmental phase with eight channels and consciousnesses. Translation risk: confusing eight channels with physical anatomy. Preservation: eight channels as basis for eight consciousnesses through elemental male-female pairing.
[13312-13339] From four channels changing struggling, gathered-mouth called wind's self-sound letter's change many spreading, earth channels four wheel upward thrown, between those two gathered-mouth wind mustard seed merely not touching holding, mutually like star canopy light tone letter brightness together abiding, up-down lotus petal spread like abiding. Then fourteen days alaya support four measure abiding those become mer-mer red form time, water creatures generating basis, subtle and changing-knowing and emerging and action-rising creatures four body formed. Also inside those channels etc. supports previous like forming is one body countless lives abiding. These called control-body, buddha body father-mother two-two not abiding thus called body-less, not actual form thus. From Vajra Tip Play: from one form body's end, holding non-end not-established end, abiding beyond thousand count, also sky-body from, abandoning containing action, knowing form end dust atom sky. Thus each creature desire-conduct wind each abiding, migrators all desire-attachment karma near taking arising from this. Fourteen indicates karma connection also that point. View register: formation of control-body with four creatures and karma connections. Translation risk: literalizing body-less as non-existence rather than non-fixed form. Preservation: body-less indicates non-abiding in fixed paternal-maternal forms, not absence of form.
[13340-13369] Then third seven-day period becoming, fifteenth day from earth channel increase-basis light and letter together generating, those central sixteenth day memory basis gold vapor merely arising, seventeenth day sky like clouds gathering inside draw-gather action karma changing wind together, eighteenth day elements each power completed, eighteen elements basis channels changing vapor lump eighteen formed. Then two-two elements united action connection made is previous power exhausted. Eighteen elements vapor like egg-shell from element-holding called wind quivering shifting arisen sound together, fire channels wheel four together upward leaping, to dust sky direct-called below above mustard seed double surpassing, twenty-one days moving alaya support basis channels together thus lta-lta form transformed. This is five hundred's end all mantra action end twenty-one days doing, indicated alaya collection disintegrating. Then from earth creatures four wind bile phlegm etc. sickness horse becoming formed previous like. Then twenty-two to twenty-five days elements each power and body basis completing, four days elements' power previous channels four increasing limb channels four thus eight determined, each light and letter clear-generating together is tastes collection wheel star-light like shining tone together, stacked wheel petal like channel wheel called. View register: third phase with eighteen elements and limb channel formation. Translation risk: treating eighteen elements as separate rather than interdependent configurations. Preservation: eighteen elements as basis for sensory and cognitive capacities, not merely physiological constituents.
[13370-13397] Eight's center desire-object five pleasure touching support warmth essence goat-fat merely abiding vapor from, twelve ayatanas basis fruit like sa-lu swelled and dissolving life twelve abiding, gathering-expanding wheel form alaya action support abiding. Expanding place wheel letter together. Then twenty-nine to thirty-two days element water gathering, earth stable pressing, fire blazing expanding, wind blazing moving action done. Thirty-two day elements each power somewhat exhausted, this time generating action wind called wild-debauched wind arising, previous wind channels four upward thrown, to dust particle sky mustard seed above thrown, from previous channels four again channels four increased, those center tip wind force-holding called petal from star-canopy like light spreading gathering, previous element-basis actual power exhausted, again two elements united action from thirty-four day alaya support four set together those hard-form support, afflictions gathering coarse channel-poison vapor poison pot like gathering abiding, tip arranged wheel called abiding is thirty-five day king's writing-completed tantra arising from this. Thus seven sets seven samsara body channels wheel four generated, each eight channel-twigs eight thirty-two body generally abiding is samsara river substance twelve limbs samsara body basis holding arising from this. Thus channels thirty-two from wisdom thirty-two action arises. View register: formation of thirty-two channel twigs and completion of essential tantra. Translation risk: confusing king's writing with political metaphor. Preservation: king's writing-completed indicates mature configuration of channels ready for further development.
[13398-13429] From essence ultimate essence-drop lamp four ripening together arising, that making bliss path if done forceful method buddha certain. Those residue becoming conventional essence-drop, four elements ripening together arising, that sending suffering to own continuum samsara seed expanding, that itself channel point depending making path, does special bliss dharmata direct realization. Those channels become wisdom path, essence-drop nature gone, pleasure-pain experienced action doing. Then thirty-five day again previous like elements each action power generating first action connection completing, from form dust particle countless aggregate heap gathering expanding, thus feeling perception formations aggregate parts from expanding gathering countless immeasurable generating is five aggregates family manifest appearance raised. Then forty-two day two-two elements united action, generating water creatures eighty-four thousand body expanded. That wheel channel-twigs sixty-two indicated action done is eon arising-ceasing sixty-two arising cause. Those channels each inside channel-abode special letter each, that supporting light ball each, light holding Samantabhadra father-mother two-two abiding. Also channels sixty-two, letters sixty-two thus one-twenty-four, lights sixty-two thus one hundred eighty-six, Samantabhadra father and mother combined one-twenty-four, generating first wheel wisdom change special three hundred and ten. Those wisdom pure wind leaping and sinking etc., shamatha and vipashyana action certain realizing thus called generating, samsara body basis thus first called. Thus all basis thus wheel. Element special dharma wind etc. enumerations that much each element's extent going-coming difference abiding. Afflictions and action doing that much karma wind's draw and inhaling and holding and releasing thus day-night certain. Thus condition collection particular dharmas nine hundred and thirty abiding is empowerment ground path certain arising from this. View register: completion of generating wheel with full subtle body mandala. Translation risk: reducing numerical correspondences to mere symbolism. Preservation: numerical correspondences indicate precise subtle body architecture with functional capacities.
[13430-13431] Transitional passage. The Tibetan text moves from previous topic to next. Wylie: '<span class="term">/de yang sems dang*/</span> sems nyid kyi dbye ba las/...' This structural marker serves as bridge between doctrinal expositions. The lotsawa recognizes the transition and prepares the reader for the next topic. Structural function: transitional clarity. Register: structural awareness.
01 11 02 01
[13432-13511] Mind gathering (sems 'du ba) by water-mind (chu'i sems) holds mindfulness' thought-basis (dran pa'i rtog gzhi 'dzin). By steadiness (brtan pa) mind's collection gathers (sems kyi tshogs 'du). Radiating ('phros pa) by fire-mind (me'i sems) radiates to objects (yul la 'phro). Light (gsal ba) by wind-mind (rlung gi sems) moves ('gul). View register: elements as aspects of mind's function. Upon mind-itself (sems nyid la): unborn meaning's mind-itself (skye med don gyi sems nyid), unceasing mindfulness's mind-itself (ma 'gags dran pa'i sems nyid), unchanging example-meaning-mixed mind-itself (mi 'gyur dpe don 'dres pa'i sems nyid), self-complete actual-meaning nowhere differentiated mind-itself (rang rdzogs don gyi dngos po gang du'ang ma phyed pa'i sems nyid). Four aspects of mind's nature. View register: four aspects of single mind-itself. Upon mindfulness (dran pa la), mind and mental (sems dang sems byung) two from (gnyis 'byung). Mind's mindfulness (sems kyi dran pa) as explained before, mental's mindfulness (sems byung gi dran pa) six are (drug yod). View register: distinction between primary mind and mental factors. Thoroughly-searching mindfulness (yongs su tshol ba'i dran pa) pure (dag): clear as god's body (lha'i lus ltar gsal), impure (ma dag): thrown into god's migration (lha'i 'gro bar ltung), perverted (yongs su 'khrul): thrown into wrong-attachment body (phyin ci log 'dzin pa'i lus su ltung). View register: purity of mindfulness determining result. Definitively-settling mental mindfulness (nges par 'jog pa'i sems byung gi dran pa) pure: awareness-holder (rig pa 'dzin pa) obtained (thob), impure: born as god-asura (lha ma yin), perverted: into butcher's lineage (bsha' la gtogs pa). View register: mental factor's mindfulness and its maturation. Definitively-placing mental mindfulness (nges par 'god pa'i sems byung gi dran pa) pure: space-dweller (mkha' la gnas pa), impure: human (mi), perverted: into desire-possessing ('dod chags can). View register: progressive results based on purity. Mental-consciousness's mindfulness (yid kyi rnam shes kyi dran pa) pure: mudra-yoga (phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor), impure: animal (dud 'gro), perverted: wrong-view-possessor (log lta can). View register: mental consciousness determining rebirth. Affliction-possessing mind's mindfulness (nyon mongs can gyi sems kyi dran pa) pure: single-syllable yoga (yi ge gcig pa'i rnal 'byor), impure: hungry ghost (yi dvags), perverted: wrong-desire migration ('dod log gi 'gro ba). View register: affliction-based mindfulness and its results. Moving-maker-grasping mind's mindfulness (g.yo byed byed 'dzin gyi sems kyi dran pa) pure: wheel-grasping yoga ('khor lo 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor), impure: hell (dmyal ba), perverted: suffering-possessing migration (sdug bsngal can gyi 'gro ba). View register: most afflicted mindfulness leading to worst results or highest practice.
[13512-13830] Thoroughly-investigating mind (rab tu rtog pa'i sems) with wind-horse (rlung rta), from previous-memory (sngon dran) following-grasping (rjes 'dzin) arises. Definitively-settling mind (nges 'jog sems) with earth-horse (sa rta), from past-branched (snga lo 'dab) memory arises. Definitively-grasping mind (nges 'dzin sems) arising with water-horse (chu rta), from present-memory (da dran) following-grasping arises. View register: mind types associated with elements and temporal orientations. Mental-consciousness (yid kyi rnam shes) from mind-six's (sems drug) knowing-portion (shes cha) gathering arises ('dus nas 'byung), with mother-horse (ma rta) arises, from present-memory near-pointing (da dran nye mtshon) arises. View register: mental consciousness arising from past and present. Affliction-possessor (nyon mongs can) with water-earth-two-gathered horse (chu sa gnyis 'dus kyi rta), from future-memory (phyi dran) following-grasping arises. View register: affliction based on future-oriented grasping. Moving-maker-grasping mind (g.yo byed byed 'dzin gyi sems), early-late latencies' (snga phyi bag chags) aggregate gathered (tshogs bsdus), with fire-wind-two horse (me rlung gnyis kyi rta), from future-memory branching ('byed) arises. View register: most active mind type with most elements. By six ripenings (smin drug) inside (nang) consciousness aggregate (rnam shes kyi phung po) six (drug) arose (byung). The six types of consciousness ripening within the mental aggregate. View register: ripening of consciousness types. By those (de dag) from individual (so so) gathering ('dus), eighteen elements (khams bcu brgyad) growing (rgyas) obtained (thob). View register: development from six consciousnesses to eighteen elements. Cause and condition (rgyu rkyen) from earth (sa) insect (srog chags) thousand eighty-four (stong brgyad cu rtsa bzhi) arisen (byung). The numerical correspondence of elements and sentient beings. View register: systematic enumeration of causes. Body (lus) by body (lus) generated (bskyed), speech (ngag) by speech (ngag) generated, mind (sems) by mind (sems) generated. Each generates its own kind. View register: continuity through generation. Great Arrangement (bkod pa chen po) citation: generation three (bskyed pa gsum) migrating beings ('gro ba), individual ripening (so so'i smin pa) complete (rdzogs), from elements (byung ba) body (lus) pure (dag), from letters (yi ge) voice (ngag) speech (gsung), mindfulness (dran pa) life (srog) mind (sems) etc. Scriptural support for the analysis. View register: canonical authority for the system. Insect-abiding (srog chags gnas pa'i) letters (yi ge) and (dang), support (rten) body (lus), each (re re) body-speech-mind (lus ngag yid) definite support (nges pa'i rten) abiding (gnas pa). View register: letters as support for embodied existence. The "horses" (rta) associated with each mind type represent the elemental energy that carries or supports that mental function. Wind-horse (rlung rta): movement, investigation, future-oriented. Earth-horse (sa rta): stability, settling, past-oriented. Water-horse (chu rta): flowing, grasping, present-oriented. Fire-horse (me rta): transformation, energy. Mother-horse (ma rta): source, origin. The combinations (water-earth, fire-wind) represent complex mental states drawing on multiple elemental energies. View register: elements as energetic support for mental functions. The temporal orientations are crucial: previous-memory (sngon dran), past-branched (snga lo 'dab), present-memory (da dran), future-memory (phyi dran). Mind types are characterized by which temporal direction they gravitate toward. Thoroughly-investigating mind looks to the past; definitively-settling mind settles into the past; definitively-grasping mind grasps the present; affliction-possessor reaches toward the future; moving-maker grasps future ramifications. View register: time as dimension of mental activity. The three outcomes—pure (dag), impure (ma dag), perverted (yongs su 'khrul)—represent the spectrum of results based on mental quality. Pure: leads to divine or realized states. Impure: leads to ordinary or lower rebirth. Perverted: leads to wrong views or hells. View register: mental quality determining destiny. Translation risk: deterministic view of karma. Preservation: these are tendencies, not absolute determinants—recognition can transform even the most afflicted mind.
