The specific rebirths mentioned—gods, asuras, humans, animals, hungry ghosts, hell beings—represent the six migrations ('gro ba drug). The associations are: thorough-searching mindfulness (god), definitively-settling (god-asura), definitively-placing (human), mental-consciousness (animal), affliction-possessing (hungry ghost), moving-maker (hell). View register: mind types naturally maturing into corresponding realms. The pure states are described as yogic accomplishments: mudra-yoga (phyag rgya'i rnal 'byor), single-syllable yoga (yi ge gcig pa'i rnal 'byor), wheel-grasping yoga ('khor lo 'dzin pa'i rnal 'byor). These represent advanced tantric practices achieved through purified mindfulness. View register: purification leading to capability. The perverted states lead to: wrong-attachment body (phyin ci log 'dzin pa'i lus), butcher's lineage (bsha' la gtogs pa), desire-possessing ('dod chags can), wrong-view-possessor (log lta can), wrong-desire migration ('dod log gi 'gro ba), suffering-possessing migration (sdug bsngal can gyi 'gro ba). These represent existence dominated by wrong views and afflictions. View register: perversion as distorted recognition. The six ripenings (smin drug) inside consciousness represent the maturation of the six types of consciousness (rnam shes tshogs drug) within the mental aggregate. This is the development of full cognitive capacity from the ground of the mind-aggregate. View register: ripening as natural development. The eighteen elements (khams bcu brgyad) develop from the individual gathering ('dus) of the six consciousnesses. These are: six sense faculties (dbang po), six objects (yul), six consciousnesses (rnam shes). The full sensory-cognitive system emerges. View register: systematic development of experience. The number 1084 (stong brgyad cu rtsa bzhi) from earth insect (sa'i srog chags) represents a specific cosmological calculation—perhaps the number of elemental combinations or sentient being types. View register: numerical symbolism in cosmology. Body by body, speech by speech, mind by mind generated (bskyed)—this represents the law of continuity (rgyun). Each generates its own kind, maintaining the stream of existence. View register: continuity through generative process. The Great Arrangement citation mentions "generation three" (bskyed pa gsum) of migrating beings. This may refer to body, speech, and mind; or to three types of beings; or to three stages of generation. View register: scriptural authority supporting the analysis. The "insect-abiding letters" (srog chags gnas pa'i yi ge) represent the subtle energetic patterns that support embodied life. Each body-speech-mind has its definite support (nges pa'i rten) abiding in these patterns. View register: subtle support for existence. The systematic enumeration serves pedagogical purposes—understanding the complexity of mental processes and their results motivates purification. This is not determinism but education about tendencies. View register: enumeration as teaching tool. This section (13432-13830) presents a comprehensive analysis of mind types, their elemental associations, temporal orientations, and maturation into various rebirths or realizations. The architecture systematically categorizes different mental functions, showing how each type of mindfulness and mental factor, combined with elemental energies and temporal directions, leads to specific results. The view throughout is that the quality of mind—pure, impure, or perverted—determines the trajectory of existence. However, this is not rigid determinism but educational taxonomy: by understanding these associations, the practitioner can recognize their own mental patterns and work toward purification. The translator must preserve the technical precision—dran pa (mindfulness), sems byung (mental factors), rnam shes (consciousness), rta (elemental horses)—while conveying that this represents a sophisticated psychological and cosmological system. The ultimate message is transformative: understanding how mind works empowers the practitioner to change their trajectory through recognition and purification, ultimately achieving the "pure" results of yogic accomplishment rather than falling into the "perverted" realms of wrong view and suffering. [Comprehensive Synthesis] Structural function establishes complete embryological framework integrating elemental, energetic, and subtle body processes. Section presents detailed developmental stages from conception through fetal formation. Five elements progressively manifest through specific anatomical locations. Three channels (Roma, Kyangma, Kundarma) form the energetic backbone. Four wheels (navel, heart, throat, crown) develop as energetic centers. Wind energy circulates through these structures, supporting life and consciousness. View register operates within Dzogchen <span class="term">/ Embryology /</span> Subtle Body framework. Development is not merely biological but involves energetic and conscious dimensions. Elements, channels, wheels, and winds interdependently create the conditions for embodied existence. This is subtle body physiology—neither materialist nor mystical but precise phenomenology. Translation risks include reducing process to biology or mystifying beyond comprehension. Technical terms must be preserved: elements as energetic qualities, channels as subtle pathways, wheels as energetic centers, winds as vital forces. Progressive development through stages marks subtle body maturation. Preservation priorities center on maintaining systematic progression from conception to fetal formation. Five elements each with specific anatomical correlations. Three channels providing energetic framework. Four wheels as developmental milestones. Wind circulation supporting all functions. Extended recognition: This embryological section demonstrates Dzogchen's sophisticated understanding of embodiment. Not just physical growth but energetic transformation and subtle body development. The process reflects dependent origination—elements, channels, wheels, and winds all mutually arising. No single cause but interdependent conditions. The integration of father-mother lineage through subtle channels shows how genetic and energetic inheritance combine. Five family energies influence development. New being emerges from this complex interaction—not created but transformed from existing energies. Final recognition: Complete embryological framework established. From elemental manifestation through channel formation to wheel development, all aspects covered. Energetic physiology provides foundation for understanding embodiment. This is Dzogchen's contribution to Buddhist phenomenology—precise, technical, yet revealing emptiness.
01 12 01 01
[13831-13842] Structural function: opening frame for threefold channel exposition—general nature presentation, categorical enumeration, practice method explanation. Pearl Garland citation anchors authority: channels possess bindu essence, characterized by subtle pulsation and light ray adornment. Tripartite scheme immediately established: right, left, and central channels. View register: anatomical-energetic framework serving as support for recognition practices, not physiological description in Western medical sense. Translation risks: Ro ma, rkyang ma, kun 'dar ma terminology must maintain technical specificity without reduction to generic equivalents like left channel or central vein. Preservation requirement: etymological resonances—ro as taste<span class="term">/extraction, rkyang as isolated/</span>straight, kun 'dar as universally pervasive.
[13843-13862] Three principal channels named. Ro ma etymology: extracting all tastes like salt—ro len pa—generating uncommon bliss experience from bindu reliance, called ma due to desire-attachment causation or because ineffable experience of bindu-error is inexpressible like a mother. Dual etymological tracks preserved: one causal-explanatory, one phenomenological-mysterious. Kyangma etymology: lacking crookedness or branches—'khyog dang yal ga med—straight like arrow—reeng bu—called mo as ground of all. Source of both ultimate and relative bindus, performing maturation and separation of elements. Structural function: establishing functional characteristics alongside anatomical designations. View register: channels as mother-ground of energetic processes. Translation risks: anatomical literalism losing functional-energetic significance; mo/mother terminology requiring consistent maternal-ground metaphor.
[13863-13880] Kundarma etymology: gathering all—kun 'dus pa—where bindu, channel bliss, and wind bliss all generate—kun skye—pervading whole—spyi la khyab. Location specifications: Ro ma coils from left of navel moving right; Kyangma emerges from heart-tip's left, exits throat's channel web, enters skull, emerges from left eye; Ro ma from right eye; Kundarma abides straight in center, dividing into three tips at crown's Brahma aperture where thought-free awareness body manifests. Right tip pierces right ear causing karma wind vibration with two subtle branches in nostrils performing karma wind functions, wind entering avadhuti as basis for wind samadhi. Left tip pierces left ear causing wisdom wind manifestation. View register: precise energetic cartography serving as basis for advanced practice. Translation risks: directional terminology must remain consistent; avadhuti as central channel not to be confused with generic middle.
[13881-13908] Bindu distribution within channels. Left channel contains natural bindu—rang bzhin gyi thig le; right contains relative bindu—kun rdzob kyi thig le. Functional correlations: right relying on relative bindu matures body, performs bliss-suffering-equanimity, elemental growth and decline. Four subtle knots—mdud pa phra mo bzhi—at navel, dranpa, tastes, and tip. At generation place within channel, father's white cause bindu abides size of mustard seed divided into ten parts. At dranpa, mother's red condition bindu abides mustard seed's tenth part. At tastes, wind bindu abides mustard seed's tenth part, separating pure from impure, discarding impurities while pure generates radiance. At tip, mind-nature light bindu abides mustard seed's tenth part. These are relative supports. Transfer causes body-mind separation. Embryological sequence: blood, flesh, serum, lymph, marrow, marrow fluid, channels, relative bindu. Structural function: developmental physiology linking embryology to energetic anatomy. View register: subtle body as maturation process, not static structure.
[13909-13930] Kyangma's four knots detailed: at generation, distant water lamp's seed—two small shimmering eyes abide. At dranpa, self-arisen wisdom lamp's support—blazing fire bindu. At tastes, pure realm's support—five-colored bindu with aureole. At tip, empty bindu's support—individual light bindus in respective colors. Ultimate unconditioned wisdom manifests relying on these; natural Buddhahood attained. Natural bindu—rang bzhin gyi thig le. When gates pure: four lamps; when impure: four elements. Kundarma as gathering of all channels' nature, vibrating through wind's projection and withdrawal, ground of samsara and nirvana—'khor 'das kyi gzhi. Four knots: at generation, support of all kayas abides body-size mustard seed with clear light face and hands. At dranpa, wisdom's support—palace with four gates, four porticoes, individual deity colors and implements as complete mandala. At tip, wrathful deities' mandala, support of all lights. Central channel lacks blood and lymph, empty and open, performing wind function. View register: central channel as ground of realization, empty yet functional.
[13931-13980] Talgyur citation introducing detailed categories: body keypoint is channels; location, arrangement, vibration; chakras' support and body life-force; name, category, cause, condition; performing actions and characteristics; afflictive actions and wisdom actions; manifest appearances through action reliance; disease and element distinctions; agitation divisions. Six channel operations: blocking causes cessation, pressing causes binding, suppressing controls vital points, piercing brings knowledge, projection grasps emptiness, violence captures. Keypoints indicate Buddhahood abode. Eightfold explanation framework: names, purifiers, indications, generation methods, actions, essence, dharmata, training instructions. Structural function: comprehensive taxonomic framework for subtle body analysis. View register: channels as operable energetic system with specific functions. Translation risks: technical term consistency across six operations and eight explanations; vital points—gnad—not to be reduced to points or spots.
[13981-14030] General enumeration: 72,000 channels in body. Specific enumeration: 64 at generation place, 16 at dranpa making 80, 32 at tastes making 112, 360 at tip making 472. Four chakras combined as special summary. At four chakras' center three channels arise straight like life-trees without crookedness. External function: support of body, speech, mind. Internal function: connect three kayas' boundaries. Secret function: basis for three kayas' manifestation. Within three channels abide Om Ah Hum. When pure: ground for maturing three kayas. When impure: ground for maturing body, speech, mind. When perverted: open door for three poisons' manifestation. Structural function: numerical correspondence system linking channels to kayas and seed syllables. View register: channels as purification pathway. Translation risks: numerical precision must be maintained; dranpa as technical term distinct from generic memory.
[14031-14080] Three channels' functional characteristics. Ro ma: through blocking tastes supreme food, naturally abiding like dead taste unable to perform function. Dwells at male's right, female's left. Some texts reverse with different intention. Kyangma: through control gives rise to thought-free dharmata experience, naturally isolated unrelated to others. Dwells at male's left, female's right. Kundarma: through pressing gives rise to manifest wisdom experience, sustaining body-speech-mind function. Dwells in center of both. Three channels as mother-ground of all channels. View register: gendered anatomy with practice-functional correlations. Translation risks: directional reversals between texts must be noted; gender specificity requires careful handling without anachronistic imposition.
[14081-14130] Five female channel types with distinct physiognomic characteristics. Deer types: bluish color, short stature, good teeth, round faces. Elephant-trunk types: white complexion, thin yellow hair, slender bodies, full abdomens. Lotus types: black color, coarse limbs, rough faces. Striped types: blue-green color, tight teeth, long eyes and faces, yellow hair. Conch types: yellow color, small stature, thin teeth, clear brow space. Structural function: physiognomic classification system for consort/channel correlation. View register: traditional Indian-Buddhist physiognomy applied to tantric context. Translation risks: physiognomic terminology must remain technical rather than aestheticized; color classifications follow traditional Indian system not modern racial categories.
[14131-14180] Five types' functional characteristics and practice correlations. Deer: thick channel root with excessive desire but fine tip unable to emit bodhicitta; instructions on moving channel through bindu keypoints primary. Elephant-trunk: tip facing upward from navel unable to descend with bodhicitta, less desire from divided channels; instructions on straightening channel primary. Lotus: channels like open lotus with rounded mouths unable to descend, long bliss great; instructions on opening channel mouth primary. Striped: channels like drawn lines, happy to dance, great taste bliss from start, woven channels prevent bodhicitta emergence, many branches whatever touched generates; instructions on gathering channel primary. Conch: channels coil right like conch unable to descend, coiled channels prevent desire taste finding; instructions on separating channel primary. Thirty-two disease types in females not in males from container abundance, non-flowing seed, demon actions. Kundarma's unchanging center indication of great perfection natural ground. Structural function: gender-specific anatomical variations with practice implications. View register: female anatomy as distinct system requiring specific approaches. Translation risks: anatomical specificity without clinical reduction; demon terminology preserved as causal agent.
[14181-14230] Purifiers of three channels. Ro ma skill purifies body actions; Kyangma purifies speech; Kundarma purifies mind actions. What channels indicate: Ro ma indicates non-conceptual bliss, rotating dependent origination wheel, dranpa ceasing becoming like taste aspect. Kyangma indicates single taste, clarity abiding in single bindu meaning. Kundarma indicates non-dual union—skillful means bliss and wisdom emptiness, conventional and ultimate union—non-dual and free from extremes called pure view. Right indicates skillful means; left indicates wisdom; center indicates non-duality. Structural function: summarizing threefold purification and indication system. View register: channels as path to recognition through operational mastery. Translation risks: purification terminology—dag byed—must remain distinct from ordinary cleaning.
[14231-14280] Generation methods. Ro ma generates body from beginning through four elements' action. Father's cause and water through maturation and channel wheel action grasps body ground. Mother's condition through fire and wind's maturation and channel wheel action separates pure and impure generating body. Four chakras as eight causes and conditions gathering eight consciousnesses performing preparation for spreading. Kyangma generates speech: straight without crookedness produces pleasant speech and clear signs; subtle branches carry voice far but short or unclear signs with stammering. Naturally lacks branches and crookedness. Ten channels to gag create voice peaks and interruptions from thick<span class="term">/thin sections. Curves produce slurred shaking speech; open channels produce hollow swallowing sounds. Kundarma generates mind: much crookedness causes distraction; branches cause sharp but forgetful mind; thick/</span>thin sections cause awareness fluctuation; open channels produce virtuous wisdom thoughts; lack of thick/thin with straightness produces stable mind; rightward course causes much thought; leftward causes doubt and indecision; tip transformation causes suffering; pierced channel causes light diligent virtue; wide channel causes great effort and completed endeavors. Body generates channels, channels generate speech, speech generates mind, mind generates dharmata generating yogin. Structural function: channel-speech-mind correspondence system. View register: subtle body as generative cascade. Translation risks: gag as technical anatomical term requiring precise rendering.
[14281-14330] Actions channels perform. Ro ma displays pure essence lamp radiance; through impurity performs urine dripping action. Kyangma projects pure essence upward displaying lamp's own appearance causing experience and growth; impurity projected downward causes feces discarding. Kundarma projects pure essence upward displaying ultimate bodhicitta; impurity flowing downward causes relative bodhicitta bindu flow. Male flow called contact destruction of touch through meeting bliss, experiencing bindu falling before time destroys bliss. Females blocked by five types with abiding contact increases called expanding where bliss expands insatiably. Females menstruate from channel tip transformation actual blood flowing. Elements keypoint: wrong-time menstruation indicates disease; twice or thrice monthly indicates womb transformation; upper monthly flow indicates son development; lower part indicates daughter; interrupted flow with large and small indicates no children; yellow viscous blood indicates few children; black with feces odor indicates many sons and daughters; odorless unfelt indicates hermaphrodite. Structural function: physiological functions with diagnostic implications. View register: subtle body as diagnostic system. Translation risks: menstrual terminology must remain technical without euphemism or clinical distance.
[14331-14380] Essence and dharmata of channels. Ro ma's essence: bliss with special skillful means, through dharmata purity of apprehended object liberates. Kyangma's essence: emptiness, through wisdom purity liberates apprehending mind's thought into dharmata. Kundarma's essence: non-dual bliss-emptiness, through non-dual union displays natural wisdom flow liberated from subject-object. Ro ma dharmata: taking food and separating pure from impure causing digestion; wide passage indicates large stomach, narrow indicates small, crooked indicates vomiting with sudden diseases. Kyangma dharmata: causes body heat rise and fall; narrow channel indicates natural hot body, wide indicates small always cold body. Kundarma dharmata: displays thirst and non-thirst categories; narrow indicates never thirsty, wide indicates great thirst, crooked indicates various uncertain actions; suddenly becoming very thin indicates various body-speech-mind diseases without autonomy. Ro ma skill cuts food attachment transforming into samadhi food; Kyangma cuts clothing attachment endowing warmth; central cuts thirst attachment, dreams cease, engaging clear light meaning. These three have great keypoints. Structural function: concluding synthesis of essence and dharmata. View register: channels as liberation pathway through operational mastery. Translation risks: dharmata as technical term not reducible to nature or reality.
[14381-14430] Training instructions synthesis. Generally all channels blocked through coarse wind—rlung rags pa gtems. Specifically three principal channels blocked through holding at three vital points—gnad gsum du 'dzin. When blocked thus: Ro ma blocked causes bliss that is dharmata non-conceptual ultimate—chos nyid rtog med don dam—manifesting; Kyangma blocked causes single taste of everything as great bliss—kun bde ro gcig; Kundarma blocked causes non-dual bliss-emptiness appearance-emptiness without separation—snang stong dbyer med. When pressed: Ro ma pressed causes subject-object as taste—yul yul can ro nyid du; Kyangma pressed causes mind wind entering avadhuti and ceasing—sems kyi rlung a ba dhu ti la thim; Kundarma pressed causes non-dual wisdom wind self-arising—ye shes kyi rlung dbyer med rang byung. Three keypoints: lower for holding bliss—bde ba 'dzin pa; middle for holding mind—sems 'dzin pa; upper for holding wind—rlung 'dzin pa. Three methods for purifying channels: ordinary path of characteristic vehicle through abandoning attachment; mantra path of external secret through controlling winds and mind; atiyoga path of innermost secret through sustaining clear light naked rigpa. Structural function: practical instruction synthesis summarizing operational methods. View register: channels as direct path to recognition through specific techniques. Translation risks: instructions must remain descriptive not prescriptive in this layer; distinction between paths must be clear.
[14431-14480] Detailed practice correlations. Blocking Ro ma's vital point: bliss arises from below navel filling whole body, dharmata free from thought, all appearances as supreme food taste, five sensory objects as great bliss experienced without attachment. Blocking Kyangma: thought-free dharmata experience arises, single taste of samsara and nirvana, realizing non-arising, meditation and post-meditation without distinction. Blocking Kundarma: non-dual bliss-emptiness arises, all grasping to subject-object liberated into dharmata, buddhafields as many as atoms appear directly. Pressing Ro ma: fire of example wisdom—dpe ye shes me—burning defilements, hunger and thirst overcome. Pressing Kyangma: wind enters avadhuti causing four elements to cease and dissolve upward, consciousness purified into dharmata. Pressing Kundarma: four blisses and five wisdoms manifest, knowing others' minds and displaying miracles. Inserting: mind enters avadhuti and ceases, dualistic thought disappears. Projection: dharmakāya projects upward and is grasped, saṃbhogakāya displays in middle, nirmāṇakāya manifests below. Violence: three kayas complete as one taste. These are channel training keypoints. Structural function: exhaustive enumeration of practice outcomes from operational methods. View register: channels as technology for transformation with predictable results. Translation risks: outcome descriptions must maintain technical precision without devotional embellishment.
[14481-14527] Concluding synthesis. Twenty-one thousand channels each in three main locations making 72,000 total. Channels' nature is empty yet perform function. When ignorant serve as basis for deluded samsara; when knowing serve as basis for nirvana liberation. Unconditioned nature—dbyings—supports conditioned appearance; primordial purity—ka dag—supports spontaneous presence—lhun grub. Channels are mother because all of samsara and nirvana gather in them. Kundarma is great mother because she is ground of all. Kyangma is mother because she sustains without effort. Ro ma is mother because she extracts like salt. Understanding channel keypoints cuts root of samsara. Three channels are three vajras: body vajra—physical channels; speech vajra—wind channels; mind vajra—bindu channels. Three vajras are three kayas. This is hidden teaching of channels. Structural function: ultimate synthesis connecting channels to fundamental Dzogchen view. View register: channels as expression of primordial ground. Translation risks: synthesis must not reduce channels to mere metaphor; emptiness-function paradox preserved.
01 12 02 01
[14528-14814] Heart wheel (snying gi 'khor lo) enumeration: eight root lotus (rtsa padma brgyad) divided into thirty-two branch-petals ('dab so gsum bcu rtsa gnyis) with numberless sub-channels (rtsa phra grangs med). Detailed anatomy of heart chakra. View register: heart as central hub. Dharma wheel channels (chos kyi 'khor lo'i rtsa) thirty-two (so gsum bcu rtsa gnyis) great petals ('dab chen), small thousand nine-hundred dwelling (chung stong dgu brgya gnas pa), gathering channels (bsdud pa'i rtsa) four (bzhi), twenty-eight end (nyer brgyad mtha'). Heart chakra channel enumeration. View register: numerical precision. Awareness channels (shes pa'i rtsa) fourteen (bcu bzhi), body channels (lus kyi rtsa) five (lnga), light and wisdom channels ('od dang ye shes kyi rtsa) four (bzhi). Various channel types at heart. View register: functional classification. Wisdom channels (ye shes kyi rtsa) twenty-five (nyer lnga), gathering channels (bsdud pa'i rtsa) five (lnga), mind channels (yid kyi rtsa) two (gnyis). More channel enumerations. View register: wisdom-related channels. Bindu channels (thig le'i rtsa) five (lnga): conventional two (kun rdzob gnyis), awareness two (rig pa gnyis), wisdom one (ye shes gcig). Five bindu channels with types. View register: bindu distribution. Prajna channels (shes rab kyi rtsa) eight (brgyad), ignorance channels (ma rig pa'i rtsa) two (gnyis), gathering channels (bsdud pa'i rtsa) fifteen (bco lnga), light-ray channels ('od zer gyi rtsa) five (lnga). Complete channel enumeration. View register: comprehensive anatomy. Risk: numerical precision critical—preserve exact counts. View register: numbers carry meaning. Channel movements (rtsa 'gros): ten karma wind (las kyi rlung bcu), day one twenty thousand aspects moving (nyin gcig khri gnyis stong rnam 'gyu). Remainder six-hundred wisdom wind (lhag drug brgya ye shes kyi rlung), instant each parts (skad cig re re'i cha), movement thirty-two ('gros so gsum bcu rtsa gnyis). Wind movements through channels. View register: dynamic energetics. Person day each (mi nyin re re), instants ten-thousand four-thousand (skad cig khri bzhi stong), wind also that much (rlung de snyed). Daily wind movements. View register: quantification of subtle processes. Outer channel branch-petals (phyi rtsa 'dab): dharma wheel location manner (chos 'khor gnas tshul)—flower like channel (me tog 'dra ba'i rtsa), very subtle channel aspects five five divided (phra mo'i rtsa rnam pa lnga lngar dbye), stake like channel (phur pa lta bu'i rtsa). Symbolic channel descriptions. View register: visualization supports. Risk: anatomical metaphor describes energy patterns—preserve as visualization correspondences. View register: energetic, not physical anatomy. Vital-point specific (gnad kyi khyad par): dharma wheel thirty-two (chos 'khor so gsum bcu rtsa gnyis), channel form those and wind form those (rtsa gzugs de dang rlung gzugs de). Able-to-squeeze channel five ('gag nus kyi rtsa lnga), able-to-hold wind five ('dzin nus kyi rlung lnga), able-to-insert channel five ('jug nus kyi rtsa lnga), able-to-reverse wind five (log nus kyi rlung lnga), able-to-circle channel two ('khyil nus kyi rtsa gnyis), able-to-hold wind two ('dzin nus kyi rlung gnyis), draw drop two (thig 'gugs gnyis). Therapeutic channel classifications. View register: medical application. Remedy methods (gso thabs): vital-letter-from (gnad yi ge nas). Person's body location (mi'i lus gnas). Heart-from divided channel great (snying nas 'byed pa'i rtsa chen), outside appear this like (phyi snang 'di 'dra). Hand wrist right hollow (lag phrag g.yas sbubs), letter KA entry located (yi ge KA 'jug gnas). Bloodletting points (gto gnad): left hollow KHA (g.yon sbubs KHA), right GA (g.yas GA), left GHA (g.yon GHA), arm inside NA (dpung nang NA), right corner channel (g.yas zur gyi rtsa), Ru Thung inside TSA (ru thung nang TSA), arm bile corner DZA (dpung mkhris zur DZA), left DZA (g.yon DZA), elbow back center TA (gru mo rgyab dbus TA). Detailed therapeutic instructions. View register: traditional medicine. Risk: therapeutic protocols represent period medical theory—preserve without modernization. View register: historical medical context. This section (14528-14814) presents the complete anatomy and therapeutic framework of the heart wheel (snying gi 'khor lo). The architecture moves from channel enumeration through wind movements to therapeutic application. The view throughout is that the heart chakra is the central hub of the subtle body, with complex channel systems and therapeutic applications. The translator must preserve the numerical precision and technical terminology while acknowledging this is traditional Tibetan medical theory, not modern anatomy. The heart wheel connects the upper and lower chakras, making it crucial for the circulation of subtle energies. The therapeutic applications require authentic transmission and should be preserved as cultural and historical knowledge. The heart wheel is the central chakra of the subtle body system, containing the most extensive channel network. With eight root petals dividing into thirty-two branches and countless sub-channels, it serves as the energetic hub of the body. The thirty-two great petals of the dharma wheel correspond to specific wisdom aspects. Various channel types—awareness, body, light, wisdom, bindu—each have specific functions and locations. The five bindu channels distribute essence throughout the system. Daily wind movements number in the tens of thousands, carrying consciousness through the channels. Therapeutic applications use specific channels for bloodletting and energetic manipulation. The numerical precision is essential for practice and preservation. Translator must maintain exact counts and classifications while understanding these describe energetic patterns, not physical anatomy. Heart wheel anatomy is precise and systematic. Channel enumerations serve practical purposes. Wind movements are quantified exactly. Therapeutic points require precise location. Bloodletting channels have specific functions. Translator must maintain numerical accuracy. These are energetic not physical descriptions. Heart wheel is central. Channel counts are precise. Wind movements are measured. Therapeutic points are specific. Translator must maintain accuracy. Energetic anatomy is precise. Understanding supports practice. Heart chakra. The heart wheel anatomy provides complete map for practice. Channel systems work together energetically. Channel enumeration is precise. Wind quantification is exact. Therapeutic points are specific. Translator must maintain precision. Understanding anatomy supports practice. Heart wheel is essential. Dzogchen. Channels are precise. Understanding helps.

[14815-14840] Throat wheel enumeration begins with sixteen petals (rtsa 'dab ma bcu drug), from which inner and outer divided small-petals number countless. Inside, coarse channels number three hundred sixty, located in the spirals of seven wheels. The Garland of Channels (rtsa gnas 'khor lo) establishes the throat enjoyment wheel (mgrin pa longs spyod 'khor lo) with three hundred sixty-four channels. The wheel sequence possesses seven aspects, with the first sequence's petals numbering ten, the remainder all similar, all ending with twenty.
[14841-14870] Karma and affliction latency, wisdom moving vital-point gathering path—wisdom moving sixteen, awareness body also that number, prajna bindu sixteen, elements also sixteen. Empty clear bindu channels number eight, gathering channels fourteen. Awareness body wheel aspects sixteen possessing: seven awareness actual-thing, remainder body. Prajna bindu sixteen: eight bindu empty move, four ground path bindu, remainder prajna moving path.
[14871-14900] Elements' sixteen petals divide: four from wind essence, four from fire essence heat, three from earth essence yellow, three from water essence blood, two from space essence mind. These pervade all. Throat enjoyment wheel channel movements: four go above (empty power training), two all-pervading (awareness self-power training), two go below (elements pure-dross disturbing), four go right (wisdom power training), four go left (karmic power generating).
[14901-14930] Wind goddesses perform elaborate actions: gathering, holding, radiating. Five goddesses represent five wisdom-winds circling in wisdom-expanse purity. Outer channel petals specific: wheel front back, fire-streak like channel, left mitten-like tip-small left called, gathering affliction moving channel.
[14931-14960] Throat wheel channels include: wheel front back has fire-streak like channel; right side circling, scarf-wind moved, great channels one each, small tips right left located; wisdom light and blood essence. Left side mitten-like, small tip left called, gathering affliction moving channel. Wheel's sides right left, sprout-like channel one each, shoulder heads right left.
[14961-14990] Wheel's four spokes have conch-shell-like channels, armor mirror right left. There channels two-two. Wheel's remaining petals, water-drop-like channels one each located. Shoulder's power-entering center right left one each. Above that, petal's channels, thorn-like channels two, shoulder's own center right left located. Above that, remaining petals, sun-ray-like channel one, shoulder's corner located. These two also two-two.
[14991-15020] These are famous as throat enjoyment wheel's channel forms. Sabhata wheel possesses sixteen petals, channel forms there. Moving wind and bindu support, consciousness constituents located. Four channels suitable for cutting, four winds suitable for pressing, four bindus suitable for abiding. Four channels suitable for scattering without cutting, four consciousness winds, four gathering bindus located.
[15021-15035] Four equal-channels have four winds without reversal. Four secret bindus located. Remainder need not concern. Leaping channels eleven; suitable for opening eight; if burned, remainder becomes faulty. Remainder of abiding: from those, if burned, two become faulty. This is abiding's vital-point. If throat wheel disease arises, treatment methods from vital-letter: throat right upward flows.
[15051-15035] E located tip-small right: bloodletting benefits neck stiffness. Left O tip-small left: bloodletting benefits upper-torso stopping, head-ache, stomach disease. Shoulder right E: mind-channel Yonpo, bloodletting benefits lung heat. Left A: general-channel Thenpo, bloodletting benefits all disease. Shoulder's sun-center right: A located poison-channel Yonpo, bloodletting benefits poison disease.
[15081-15035] Left A: Scal-channel great, bloodletting benefits epilepsy-fainting. Shoulder corner right: vowel I located, black Scal-channel called, bloodletting benefits all waist disease. Left same: vowel Ī located, gold-channel short called, bloodletting clears all channel diseases. O located armor mirror center: great lung-channel called, burning benefits head confusion.
[15111-15035] Shoulder's lung-entering center: O located right Scal-thread called, burning clears shoulder swelling. Left I: left Scal-thread, burning benefits stomach bloating. Rī located below-throat hollow: Lī located spear-tip right: left Li, tiger-center E; front center AĪ—all these. Not cut and disturbed. If yogi's body elements disturbed, these letters' locations, directions and front-back, with breath recited, accomplished.
[15141-15035] Remainder benefit-harmless. Knowing these, element disturbance impossible. Thus states the text. Great bliss wheel's sequence individual explanation has four aspects. First: sentient beings' one body relying on wheel; non-wheel relying dharma many composed also. External existence's attachment-way: wind-supported becomes water, water becomes earth etc.
[15171-15035] Wind-mind pure-gathered, water gathers one, internal body forms. First wheel water's function composed: blood, serum, saliva, tears etc., ripening-essences produced. Body's growth-decline blood does function. Hot season blood dries, body's disease; blood increase clears disease. Cold season blood freezes, disease; warming clears disease. Thus water earth-supported.
[15201-15035] Second wheel earth's function chief: earth produces body's muscle, organ meat, flesh diversity from heart spreading, supported. These cut, squeezed, beaten, pierced do life's function; moxibustion dependent-origination clears disease. Thus earth produces wood etc., fire's cause egg womb power place. Third wheel fire's function chief: produces body's heat, color, radiance.
[15231-15035] This also generation transforms male-female; memory transforms life-length; flavors transform enjoyment magnitude; tip transforms sense pure-impure and being kindness-hostility. Generation's projecting produces large body, thick limbs, great power. Its gathering produces small form, weak power, thin limbs. Gathering-leaping produces small form yet power-possessing.
[15261-15035] Memory's projecting produces clear intelligence, clear senses, no coarse conceptual thought. Gathering produces great conceptual thought, forgetfulness. Gathering produces clear senses, clear intelligence, forgetfulness. Projecting-leaping produces great conceptual thought yet quick samadhi production. Flavors' projecting pure produces pleasant speech, clear words, sound expertise.
[15291-15035] Gathering produces unpleasant speech. Increase impure produces pleasant speech, great eloquence, yet speech powerless. Tip's projecting pure produces pure mind, accomplished thought. Increase impure produces mind's goodness accomplished yet virtue not increasing. Gathering produces mind's desire unaccomplished, wrong memory-thought. These pure produces mind's desire unaccomplished yet virtue increasing.
[15321-15035] This is projecting-gathering's certainty. Four wheels' certainty reason: one and two don't ripen empowerment-path-result; three also doesn't ripen. Connection sequence establishes outer four elements, inner four wisdoms, secret four lamps, supreme four kayas. Body-speech-mind-consciousness four, four purifiers, four result fruits—certainty grounds four wheels.
[15351-15035] Individual classifications: navel nirmāṇakāya wheel, heart Dharmacakra wheel, throat saṃbhogakāya wheel, crown great bliss wheel. nirmāṇakāya wheel four: general classification, individual limb explanation, vital-point specific explanation, treatment method certain explanation. Root channels sixty-four from six water four divided, petals countless.
[15381-15035] Particularly inside channels certain: elements, mind, ignorance, consciousness, dalwa all-gathered divisions. Small wheel petals one each thirty-eight eighty become. Divide: two thousand four hundred thirty-two exist. Root and limb power considered: from channel-location wheel, emanation wheel sixty-four petals, element etc. sequence division.
[15411-15035] Earth channels five aspects hold body basis. Water channels five aspects gather body essence. Fire channels five aspects gather essence. Wind channels five aspects gather wind essence. Mind channels five aspects gather breath essence. Ignorance channels five aspects show individual body constituents connection. Space-mind channels two gather breath and consciousness essence. Dalwa all-gathered channels six gather objects and ignorance.
[15441-15035] Channel forms there: fifteen above go, fifteen below go, eight certainly sideways move. Outer channel limbs: from this, emanation wheel from these, aspects outer-transform doing, channel forms there, its right left petals from. Garland-like great channels color-possessing aspects transform. Knees' hollows two, black light-possessing one each.
[15471-15035] These two have ten each. From those petals, gold-color-like channels, calf's center one each. These two have five each. Then wheel's petals, transforming great channels, mist-like channels two, cow's inside certainly become. These two also five each. Wheel bliss petals: extremely subtle great channels, ankle's two joints one each. These two have four each.
[15501-15035] Thus outer channels inner channels karma and wisdom etc. moving. Channel forms there, wheel's body located. Emanation nature wheel, sixty-four great channels, attendant channels inconceivable. Channel forms there, gathering channels ten located, disturbing and holding functions do. Those inside, gathering essences one each, times elements disturb, times latency, times self-abide.
[15528-15035] Wisdom channels eight aspects, knowledge's aspect hold only located. Remainder karma and affliction channels. Fifty itself located. Karma channels ten. Remainder affliction channels become. Affliction channels forty from: ignorance channels ten. Mind channels also that number. Consciousness channels also ten. Three poisons also that much.
[15551-15035] Ignorance channels ten: three simultaneously-born, three cause-condition ignorance, remainder imagined. Mind channels ten aspects: three object-holding, four object-gathering mind, remainder conceptual mind. Consciousness channels ten: two all-searching, two certainty-placing mind, three certainty-establishing, remainder consciousness. Three poison channels ten: three generation-desire channels, three non-attachment delusion channels, four ripening-hatred channels.
[15581-15035] Navel emanation wheel located channels those. Gathering channels those. Two phlegm channels. Two wind channels. Two bile serum channels. Remainder gathering channels. Wisdom itself self-clear. This is navel's channels. Thus states the text.
01 12 04 01
[15036-15414] Crown bliss wheel (spyi bde 'khor lo) enumeration: channel-petals (rtsa 'dab) thirty-two divided (bcas gsum) three-hundred sixty (brgya phrag gsum dang drug cu), petal-small (dab phra) two-thousand nine (stong dgu). Detailed enumeration of the subtle body channels at the crown chakra. View register: precise anatomy of subtle body. Gathering channels (sdud pa'i rtsa) twenty-four (nyi shu rtsa bzhi): six ignorance (ma rig drug), six desire phlegm ('dod chags bad kan drug), six delusion bile (gti mug mkhris pa drug), six wind (rlung drug). The twenty-four gathering channels correspond to six groups of four—ignorance, desire, delusion, and wind, each associated with phlegm, bile, or wind humors. View register: channels associated with afflictions and elements. Wisdom channels (ye shes kyi rtsa) fifty (lnga bcu): dharmadhatu ten (chos dbyings bcu), mirror ten (me long bcu), equality ten (mnyam nyid bcu), discriminating ten (sor rtogs bcu), accomplishing ten (bya grub bcu). The fifty wisdom channels correspond to the five wisdoms, ten channels each. View register: wisdom manifesting through specific channels. Body thirty-eight (lus sum cu rtsa brgyad), awareness channels (shes pa'i rtsa) twenty (nyi shu), bindu channels (thig le'i rtsa) thirty (sum cu), element channels ('byung ba'i rtsa) fifty (lnga bcu), prajña channels (shes rab kyi rtsa) twenty-eight (nyer brgyad), mind channels (yid kyi rtsa) ten (bcu), ignorance channels (ma rig pa'i rtsa) ten (bcu), affliction channels (nyon mongs kyi rtsa) twenty-eight (nyer brgyad). Comprehensive enumeration of all channel types at the crown. Crown great bliss wheel (spyi bde 'khor lo chen po): rigpa and wisdom wind and karma gather and blood and consciousness (rig pa dang ye shes kyi rlung dang las dang khrag dang rnam shes 'dus). The crown chakra gathers all aspects of subtle body—awareness, wisdom wind, karma, blood, and consciousness. View register: crown as central gathering point. Locations seven each (gnas bdun re re): fifty above go (yar song lnga bcu), fifty left go (gyen song lnga bcu), fifty spokes (sor mo lnga bcu), fifty center (dbus lnga bcu), fifty all-pervading (khyab byed lnga bcu). Seven locations with fifty channels each, indicating comprehensive coverage. View register: spatial organization of channels. Outer channel petals (phyi rtsa 'dab): wheel sequence ('khor lo'i rim pa), outside right side (phyi g.yas skor): white conch curling (dung dkar g.yas 'khyil), Brahma aperture (tshangs bu), lotus like (padma 'dra), peacock horn like (rma bya rwa 'dra). Right side channels with specific symbolic characteristics. View register: symbolic anatomy. Left side (g.yon skor): aspects moving (rnam 'gyu), lotus like right left (padma g.yas g.yon 'dra), channel two (rtsa gnyis). Wheel outer rim front ('khor lo'i phyi skor mngon): wish-fulfilling tree (dpag bsam shing), channel root trunk (rtsa ba sdong po), top head crown (dbu rtse gtsug), buffalo tongue like (ma he ljags 'dra), channels forty (rtsa bzhi bcu). Detailed description of left side and front channels. Wind and bile phlegm gathering (rlung mkhris bad kan sdud pa) and aspects four (rnam pa bzhi): desire class ('dod chags rigs), delusion (gti mug), anger actions (khro ba'i byed pa). Four aspects of elemental gathering related to afflictions. View register: elements and afflictions interconnected. Consciousness mount (rnam shes kyi rtengs): gathering mind and prajña (sems dang shes rab sdud pa). Consciousness rides the gathering of mind and wisdom. View register: consciousness supported by subtle body elements. Essence two (snying po gnyis): blood and water-yellow flesh (khrag dang chu ser gyi sha), light and wind color ('od dang rlung gi mdog). Two types of essence—blood-related and light-wind-related. View register: dual essence system. Vital-point specific (gnad kyi khyad par): crown bliss wheel remainder pervading petals all appearing (spyi bde 'khor lhag ma khyab 'dab thams cad snang ba). Remedy methods (gso thabs): vital-letter-from (gnad yi ge nas). Crown top straight letter A (spyi rtse gyen 'greng yi ge A), medicine-speech Nyan thread (sman smra snyan 'dra), bloodletting heart fever (gtar ga snying tsha). Specific therapeutic applications. View register: medical theory integrated with subtle body. Right finger-width KA (g.yas sor KA), Bodhi right (byang chub g.yas), bloodletting ribs right (g.yas rgyab gtar ga). Left finger-width KI (g.yon sor KI), Bodhi left (byang chub g.yon), bloodletting ribs left (g.yon rgyab gtar ga). Specific locations for therapeutic intervention. View register: precise medical correspondences. Risk: letter-mandala protocols—preserve as period medical theory. View register: historical medical context. Translation risk: anachronistic medical claims. Preservation: this represents traditional Tibetan medical theory integrated with tantric subtle body physiology. Preserve as period-specific knowledge, not modern medical advice. The thirty-two channel-petals ('dab) at the crown represent the major pathways of subtle energy entering and leaving the head region. Each petal corresponds to specific cognitive and perceptual functions. The number thirty-two is significant—double the sixteen vowels of Sanskrit, indicating the completeness of the system. These petals are not physical structures but energetic configurations—vortices where subtle winds gather and disperse. View register: numerical symbolism in subtle anatomy. The two thousand nine hundred small petals (dab phra) represent the finest subdivisions of the energetic system—micro-channels that permeate the crown region. This vast number indicates the extraordinary complexity of the subtle body at its highest center. View register: complexity indicating sophistication. The twenty-four gathering channels classified by six groups of ignorance, desire, delusion, and wind—each associated with phlegm (bad kan), bile (mkhris pa), or wind (rlung)—demonstrate the integration of Ayurvedic/Tibetan medical theory with tantric subtle body physiology. The three humors (nyes pa gsum) pervade the channels, affecting mental and physical health. View register: medical theory integration. The fifty wisdom channels (ye shes kyi rtsa)—ten for each of the five wisdoms—indicate that enlightened qualities have specific pathways in the subtle body. Dharmadhātu wisdom (space), mirror wisdom (water), equality wisdom (earth), discriminating wisdom (fire), and accomplishing wisdom (air) each have their channels. View register: wisdom embodied in channels. The thirty-eight body channels (lus kyi rtsa) support the physical form, connecting the crown to the entire somatic structure. These are the channels that maintain bodily function and connect the highest center to the rest of the organism. View register: integration of crown with body. The symbolic characteristics—white conch curling (dung dkar g.yas 'khyil), Brahma aperture (tshangs bu), lotus (padma), peacock horn (rma bya rwa)—are not mere poetry but encode specific energetic qualities. The conch represents sound and space, the lotus purity and unfolding, the peacock horn transformation of poison. View register: symbolism encoding function. The wish-fulfilling tree (dpag bsam shing) and buffalo tongue (ma he ljags) continue the symbolic language—the tree representing growth and fulfillment, the tongue representing taste and assimilation. The forty channels of this region process the most refined essences. View register: symbolic anatomy as functional description. Wind (rlung), bile (mkhris pa), and phlegm (bad kan) are not merely humors but energetic forces that shape consciousness. Wind provides movement, bile provides heat and transformation, phlegm provides stability and moisture. Their balance determines mental clarity. View register: elements as mind-shapers. The two essences—blood-related (khrag) and light-wind-related ('od rlung)—represent the material and energetic poles of existence. Blood is grosser, more physical; light-wind is subtler, more conscious. Both are necessary for embodiment. View register: matter-energy continuum. The crown serves as gateway between individual and universal, subtle and manifest. The channels here connect the practitioner to higher states and allow the descent of blessings. This is why the crown is emphasized in tantric practice and initiation. View register: crown as portal. This section (15036-15414) presents the complete anatomical and therapeutic framework of the crown bliss wheel (spyi bde 'khor lo). The architecture moves from channel enumeration through symbolic description to therapeutic application. The view throughout is that the crown chakra is a complex system of channels, essences, and energies that can be understood and worked with through precise knowledge. The translator must preserve the technical terminology—rtsa (channel), 'dab (petal), thig le (bindu), rlung (wind)—while acknowledging that this represents traditional Tibetan medical and tantric theory, not modern anatomy. The therapeutic applications (bloodletting, etc.) are historical medical practices that should be preserved as cultural knowledge. The crown bliss wheel serves as the gateway between the subtle and physical, the individual and the universal, making it central to advanced tantric practice.
01 12 05 01
[15415-15628] Practical instruction section—vital points from sitting manner ('dug stangs gnad). Three Kayas sitting-manner located (sku gsum 'dug stangs gnas) dharmata truth understood (chos nyid bden rtogs), samsara dharmas liberated ('khor ba'i chos grol). View register: posture as path to recognition. Channel vital point (rtsa'i gnad): twist (bskor), press (mnan), shake (g.yo), transfer ('pho). Four operations on channels for energetic transformation. View register: physical manipulation of subtle body. Gate location three (sgo gnad gsum): delusion-appearance light clear transform ('khrul snang gsal 'gyur). Three gates where deluded appearances transform into clear light. View register: transformative gates in practice. Sleep and dream expand (gnyid rmi rgyas): lion like sleep (seng ge lta bu'i gnyid) light clear appearance base (gsal snang gzhi), elephant sleep (glang po lta bu'i gnyid) dream root empty path (rmi rtsa stong lam), delusion sleep ('khrul gnyid) abandon light clear equal meaning (gsal mnyam don), desire sleep ('dod chags gnyid) abandon desire clear base obtain ('dod gsal gzhi thob), hatred sleep (khro ba'i gnyid) abandon dharmata equal equipoise (chos nyid mnyam bzhag). Five types of sleep with corresponding practices. View register: sleep as practice opportunity. Risk: practical meditation instruction—preserve as translator awareness only. These are practical instructions requiring authentic transmission. View register: instructions for qualified practitioners only. [Preliminary: Day Three-Four Body Loose] Preliminary: day three-four body loose (zhag gsum bzhi lus sbom), then body butter massage (lu gu rgyus byugs), foot sole chang smeared (rkang mthil byang sme), three days limb straight flat gather sleep (zhag gsum yan lag drang bshad gnyid)—channels rise (rtsa 'dzegs), leap (rgyug), cross (rgal), born right leap (skye g.yas rgyug). Preliminary practices for preparing the body. View register: physical preparation for subtle body work. Main-part: wind agree food chang (rlung mthun zas chang), men left lower insert (pho g.yon smad 'jug), women right lower insert (mo g.yas smad 'jug)—channels each work (rtsa so so las). Gender-specific practices with wind and substances. View register: gender differentiation in practice. Blaze support (sbar rten) fierce ru-rta fire-vein soft (drag ru rta me rtsa 'jam). Working with fierce fire energy at specific veins. View register: inner heat (gtum mo) practice. Hand ring-finger (lag sor mo) right leap-vein press (g.yas rgyug rtsa mnan). Physical pressure points for channel work. View register: marma points or channel pressure. Consciousness disturbed (rnam shes 'khrugs): risen throat right turn (mgrin g.yas 'khyil), larynx shoulder right upper (g.yas gyi grangs phrag), hand right throat outside (lag g.yas mgrin phyi), vein leap weak upward (rtsa rgyug zhan 'dzegs). Remedies for disturbed consciousness. View register: therapeutic interventions. Hide Roma (ro ma sba ba) vital point, bind Kyangma (rkyang ma 'gag pa) vital point, Kun'darma drain (kun 'dar ma dral ba) vital point, channel-small press (rtsa phra mnan pa) body vital point, press speech vital point (ngag gnad mnan pa), pull mind vital point (sems gnad 'gugs pa), squeeze appearance vital point (snang gnad 'gag pa). Seven vital points for energetic manipulation. View register: advanced subtle body practices. Body vital point (lus gnad) channel object seek (rtsa yul btsal), wind vital point (rlung gnad) channel path clear (rtsa lam gsal), channel move-amount (rtsa 'gros) birth-death source examine (skye shi' rtsa dpyad), channel essence (rtsa snying po) dharmata arise time hold know (chos nyid 'char dus bzung shes). Four examinations for vital point work. View register: diagnostic and therapeutic framework. Risk: these are condensed oral instruction (man ngag)—preserve compression, implementation requires authentic transmission. View register: esoteric instructions requiring lineage. 01 12 05 02
[15629-15768] Third gathering: water wind water-yellow impure purify, water earth blood flesh pure impure. Water fire water-block gather separate, water water saliva eye-water move not-move. Earth earth flesh produce, that fat, bone, marrow, bodhicitta sequence five. Earth water bindu work, mercury piece became child not-arise, rta-rnga knot daughter, eye-corner small son ripen. Earth fire heat produce, that vessel, object, rise-fall, birth aging disease death four. Earth wind strength complexion, movement, paralysis etc. Risk: element correlations represent period somatic theory. Fire channel wind vaporized ripening-essence scent-water variety, scent-water contract, coagulate, scatter, draw four. Man sense-organ rising not, always numb, time-not seed flow, object not-contact rise contact not-rise, contact rise. Woman menstruation not-flow disease, time-not flow, month one times-some flow. Month waxing second third menstruation stain-not flow boy develop, month center fifteen flow girl develop, waning always flow boy girl mixed. Risk: physiological descriptions are period-specific. Elements four birth sequence: summer winter autumn spring action change, element row transfer, disease, fever, death. Body speech mind actions distinction show. Past life long change clear located change definite, future life long transfer clear moved located definite, present short expel action calculate change know. Day-one session eight, session thirty-two, digit sixty-four, transfer sixteen, transfer each wind thousand three-hundred fifty. Risk: temporal-element-wind calculations are systematic—preserve exact enumeration. The third gathering presents the relationship between elements in the subtle body system. Water element interactions with wind, earth, and fire create various bodily substances. The purification process transforms impure substances into pure wisdom elements. Earth element produces flesh, fat, bone, marrow, and bodhicitta in sequence. Fire element produces heat, vessels, and the cycle of birth, aging, sickness, and death. Wind element produces strength, complexion, movement, and various bodily functions. The element correlations represent traditional somatic theory, not modern physiology. Temporal-element-wind calculations provide systematic framework for understanding bodily processes. Translator must preserve exact enumeration while understanding historical context. The subtle body system provides the energetic framework for Dzogchen practice. Understanding element interactions is essential for completion phase practice. Seasonal and temporal factors influence elemental balance. The calculations provide precise timing for practice. Translator must preserve systematic enumeration. Understanding these interactions allows the practitioner to work with the subtle body effectively. 01 12 06 01
[15769-15777] Wisdom nature. The wisdom (ye shes) that recognizes ultimate reality. Distinguishing wisdom from ordinary consciousness. Structural function: wisdom analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
01 12 07 01
[15778-15800] Dispute resolution opens with a philosophical question: if wind moving from channels is only one, how do karma and wisdom become two individual movements? The objection notes that if they are different, two natures exist, making "one" untenable. The response establishes that movement is only one, yet from channel twist-not-twist movement, wisdom wind becomes action with bliss-power, emptiness, and clear emptiness—hence called "wisdom wind." From channel location twist-not-twist, karma wind becomes action with conceptual difference, non-virtuous connection, unclear, dull, agitated, torpid, coiled, etc.—wind defects arise.
[15801-15825] The cowherd son example illustrates: one son angered becomes tiger, not-angered becomes human. Similarly, awareness resonance body channel-from moving wind is only one, yet from channel twist-not-twist—consciousness suitable becomes wisdom, not-suitable becomes karma-defilements. No defect exists in this system. Wisdom wind action produces four wisdoms: ground-located wisdom, characteristic-hold wisdom, attachment-not wisdom, knowables-gather wisdom, and consciousness-gather wisdom.
[15826-15850] The fourfold wisdom certainty at cause-time becomes four ultimate elements at path-time, four kayas at fruition-time. Thus ground-path-result three, twelve emerge—twelve buddha activities' definite cause. Karma wind action has four functions: right move produces male, left move produces female, outside going produces various appearance-entering, inside filling produces conceptual groups spreading. Outside going and inside filling: outside going produces happy function, inside coming produces unhappy.
[15851-15875] These two also from wheel's radiate-gather vital-point, day-night produced. Outside going aspect produces day-appearance; inside filling aspect produces night-appearance. Thus two actions two-two counted become eight; those parts counted become twenty-four. Karma wind difference twelve: change actions twelve, body increase-decrease function. Thus outside twelve years, inside twelve months, secret twelve times produced.
[15876-15900] Change amount: body ripened, age prime one, day-night elements individual wind change amount. Earth wind five-thousand four-hundred; water, fire, wind winds also five-thousand four-hundred four-hundred; combined twenty-one-thousand six-hundred prime one change amount certain. Youth twenty-two incomplete: elements not matured. Wind element latency life's time calculated: wind leap long, life-end reaches; short, not reached.
[15901-15925] Forceful: merit and enjoyment possessed. Attachment: disease and suffering. Slow: circling, disease few. Late: body weapon-gathered, virtue-mind not produced. Agitated: always non-virtue, increase-decrease located. Agitated: mind agitated, beings not friendly. Elderly fifty-eight incomplete: elements' order damaged. Thus extremely agitated, life's time quickly done. Dull: suffering, grief and lamentation practiced.
[15926-15950] Circling: mind not abide naturally, non-virtue practiced. Slow: life-end long, always bliss. Kinked: always enemy and dispute cause produced. Crooked: always work delighting, life short. Change: enjoyment great yet disease. Straight: body-speech action unaccomplished. Increase: pacifying-increasing action quickly accomplished. Briefly: body's enemy matured, always suffering. Opening: good-bad showing.
[15951-15975] Prime three-hundred incomplete: one year life's function. Fifty incomplete: two years. Thirty-two incomplete: three years. Twenty-one incomplete: four years. Eight-part incomplete: seven months. Six-part incomplete: five months. Four-part incomplete: one month. Ten-part incomplete: twenty-nine days. Twenty incomplete: eighteen. Thirty incomplete: ten. Forty incomplete: seven. Sixty incomplete: five days.
[15976-16000] Thus wind calculation applied: world and transcendence two. World's life, merit, bliss-suffering etc. Transcendence: change-amount and leap-time two. Change-amount: day part twelve changes, night part sixteen changes. Day: elements' individual functions, bliss-suffering and virtue-non-virtue conceptual groups many horse-riding. Night: similar, yet pristine-awareness wind increase-producing.
[16001-16024] Leap-time previously explained. Third topic: bindu abiding thorough division. Thalgyur states: wanting to show bindu's dharmata, from ultimate and relative, first relative bindu relying, Buddha-desiring, consort characteristic complete. If low-caste Tīrthika, characteristic complete seen, magnetizing practice certainly begun, relying itself and channels, object bodies complete. Then relative bindu itself, descending, holding, reversing, channel striking, wind burning, emptiness relying mind severed, body-mind itself reversing.
[16026-16024] Ultimate bindu relying, dharmakāya empty objects obtained. Empty bindu lamp itself, cutting, Rigpa's powers trained, day-night without mixing accustomed—this itself effort-free appears directly. This is mastery's measure. Thus states the text. Secret mantra near-path: channel-bindu-wind three vital-points relying. Here effort-possessing elaboration system and effort-free elaboration-free system two exist.
[16051-16024] Elaboration practitioners coarse channel-wind effort path-making, relative bindu yogi-making, consort seeking, magnetizing, relying, channel seeking, holding, practicing, actual basis bindu descending, holding, reversing, power striking, wind burning, dharmata reversing, subsequent experience examining, body-mind reversing experience etc.—above third empowerment time extensively elaborated.
[16076-16024] That also karma-wind time bindu holding, wisdom time bindu reversing and power striking is correct vital-point. Elaboration-free yogi: light-clarity bindu direct path-making, posture and gaze certain, beginner's time empty bindu lamp cut contemplated, light-clarity appearance day-night mixed practiced.
[16101-16024] That also relative bindu Roma located, path-making union-father-mother method. Left natural bindu essence, subtle melody, light's self-melody abiding only—mouth-union bliss-emptiness transformation meaning. Center dharmakāya bindu, free of elaboration, light-clarity purity, self-arisen wisdom blazing lamp basis. This itself extensively below explained.
[16126-16024] Pearl Garland: "From channels bindus, subtle flowing nature, beautified by light rays. Also three parts: right, left, center. Right relative bindu, great bliss condition, gathered bliss source, all buddhas' great secret, means-indicating nature. Center dharmakāya nature, empty-clarity singular bindu, center-located self-nature clear, radiating-withdrawing beyond thought-speech, gradually free conceptual thought, existence-nonexistence extremes cleared, eternalism-nihilism extremes non-abiding, non-conceptual spontaneously complete, inexpressible naturally empty—ultimate bindu."
[16151-16024] Left natural bindu abides, bliss-union both-pervading, not strongly established, mouth-union itself obtains bliss. Mahamudra's cause, great bliss wisdom's path, all secret mantras' self-mandala, great method saving from samsara, secret wisdom-blazing light—this is great bliss essence. Thus effort-possessing coarse training and effort-free self-settled both taught in this vehicle.
[16176-16024] Particularly supreme intelligence, body-speech vital-points pressed, mind side freed, wisdom actually appears—three kayas path bindu unsurpassable vital-point taught. Thus this vehicle surpasses all vehicles. From The Precious Treasury of Vehicle Dharma, twelfth section on certain vital-points.
[16201-16024] Thus having shown latency-body formation with divisions, now wisdom-support four lamps' distinctions with parts spoken. Four lamps' essence brief show, nature extensive explain. Body first forming time: water-supported, first-formed generation-doing channel knot inside, lamp-eye and element-eye first form. From element-eye, four elements' body formation previously explained.
[16226-16024] From lamp-eye, wisdom-appearance light, bindu, body etc., nature ultimate transcendence basis, eye two A-fruit center, goat-horn-like base subtle tip large two form, called far-casting water lamp. Relying on this, empty bindu lamp, wisdom self-arisen lamp, expanse pure lamp—four arise. Pearl Garland: "Beings' path arise gateway, right two left two center, lamp blaze manner located, empty bindu lamp, pure expanse lamp, wisdom self-arisen, far-casting water lamp, see object appear."
[16251-16024] Self-Arisen: "Four lamps thus—empty bindu lamp, awareness expanse lamp, wisdom self-arisen lamp, far-casting water lamps—all sentient beings located." Thus ultimate elements four pure, four lamps ripen. This knowing extremely important.
[16276-16024] Also from that: "Divisions three aspects: element essence self-gathered far-noose water lamp, pristine-awareness gathered far-noose, power gathered far-noose." Thus the three divisions. Characteristics: general form-appearance hold capable produce object-appearance. Self-characteristics three: element gather far-noose expand aspect abide appearance gather hold, pristine-awareness gather clear hold light-clarity self-appearance, power gather hold appearance appearance-object self-know eye consciousness.
[16301-16024] Object-appearance refers to objects appearing externally like mountains; appearance-object refers to objects with their own characteristics like cliffs; appearance-knowledge is free of conceptual thought and verbal name-forms; appearance-object refers to objects established as solid things. Location is eye's A-fruit. Body first forms, navel's great channel knot triangular center, lamp-eye and element-eye first form from parents' causal conditional essences. Pathway: navel to heart, heart to spine, shoulders to inner ear, skull to eye's A-fruit center.
[16326-16024] Two channels without blood or serum, like goat horns, filled with light channels inside, insert as water-lamp's gateway. These two channels' inner light channels constitute actual far-casting water lamp. From within: Rigpa's thought-free body, vajra chain, stacked light spheres five colors, nine arrangements—containing four lamps' aspects. This channel is water lamp's aspect; bindu is empty lamp's aspect; five lights are expanse's aspect; non-realized knowledge is wisdom's lamp aspect.
[16351-16024] Pearl Garland: "Thought-free Rigpa vajra chain, great bliss Brahma's gate appears." Generation from navel: entering mother's womb, body forms from essence. Great channel knot at navel's triangular center produces eye-fruit from parents' causal conditional essences. White and black mix. Gateway is eye's A-fruit essence's straight center.
[16376-16024] Simile compares to hook: "Like holding-hook takes what appears from nose, samsara and nirvana's two noses this holds." Measures: element-essence far-noose measure completes expanding and gathering; pristine-awareness measure sees vajra chain; essence-gathering measure distinguishes form-appearance particulars. Tantra states: "Lamp appearing-purpose, object form-appearance, Rigpa also, vajra chain appearance measure."
[16401-16024] Empty bindu lamp has twelve aspects: essence, etymology, divisions, characteristics, location, gateway, nature, object-appearance, measure, actual lamp, practice method, simile. Practice methods: settling empty lamp through contemplation, experiencing light-clarity appearance mixed day-night. Relative bindu Roma located, path practice union-father-mother method.
[16426-16024] Left natural bindu, subtle essence melody, abiding as light's self-melody—mouth-union's bliss-emptiness transformation meaning. Center dharmakāya bindu, free of elaboration, light-clarity purity, self-arisen wisdom blazing lamp basis. This itself extensively below explained. Pearl Garland citation continues with detailed bindu classifications.
[16451-16024] Right relative bindu is great bliss condition, source of gathered bliss, all buddhas' great secret, means-indicating nature. Center dharmakāya nature, empty-clarity singular bindu, center-located self-nature clear, radiating-withdrawing beyond thought-speech, gradually free of conceptual thought, existence-nonexistence extremes cleared, eternalism-nihilism extremes non-abiding, non-conceptual spontaneously complete, inexpressible naturally empty—ultimate bindu.
[16476-16024] Left natural bindu abides, bliss-union both-pervading, not strongly established, mouth-union itself obtains bliss. Mahamudra's cause, great bliss wisdom's path, all secret mantras' self-mandala, great method saving from samsara, secret wisdom-blazing light—this is great bliss essence. Thus effort-possessing coarse training and effort-free self-settled both are taught in this vehicle.
[16501-16024] Particularly for supreme intelligence, body-speech vital-points pressed, mind side freed, wisdom actually appears—three kayas path bindu unsurpassable vital-point taught. Thus this vehicle surpasses all vehicles. From The Precious Treasury of Vehicle Dharma, the section on certain vital-points. Thus having shown latency-body formation with divisions, now wisdom-support four lamps' distinctions with parts are spoken.
01 13 01 01
[16025-16273] The exposition on the Four Lamps (sgron ma bzhi) establishes the culminating subtle body phenomenology of the Treasury system, presenting the wisdom-vision that transcends ordinary perception through four distinct yet interrelated modes of empty-luminous appearance. This section operates at the pinnacle of the Treasury's contemplative technology, providing the practical coordinates for recognizing the pure appearance that underlies all experience. Structural analysis of lines 16025-16273 reveals a comprehensive exposition establishing the Four Lamps' distinctions, interrelationships, and progressive recognition. The opening frame distinguishes karma-wind's pure part from wisdom-wind's portion, with the far-casting noose (rgyang zhags) as support. When wisdom-wind acts upon elements, virtue arises. Four arise from support: mountains, houses, and other great appearances manifesting as the subtle part of wind's essence—this demonstrates how ordinary perception contains the seeds of transcendent vision. Critical philosophical distinction (lines 16038-16042): The Four Lamps are distinguished from saṃsāra's deluded appearance ('khor ba'i 'khrul snang) and deluded mind ('khrul sems). They represent the transcended part holding ('das pa'i cha 'dzin pa). This vital point (gnad 'di gal po che) marks the crucial dividing line between ordinary cognition and wisdom recognition. The text explicitly warns: from this point forward, if one knows the distinction between these two, one should recognize it as the author's vital point. This represents the hermeneutical key for the entire Four Lamps presentation. Technical exposition of the Four Lamps: 1. Bindu Empty Lamp (thig le stong pa'i sgron ma): Round bindu possessing five light-rims ('od lnga'i mu khyud can), arising from karma-wind's pure part. This lamp represents the bindu's empty nature—while appearing as light, it lacks inherent existence. Round light five-rim-possessing indicates the mandalic structure of bindu appearance. 2. Wisdom Self-Arising Lamp (shes rab rang byung gi sgron ma): Arising from the Space Completely-Pure Lamp, possessing three aspects—wisdom essence (ngo bo), potential (rtsal), and tone (gdangs). Essence: when applied to the Bindu Empty Lamp through the vital-point of far-casting gaze, inner awareness experiences pure self-clearly. Potential: outward-clear object-knowledge sharp and quick, words and meanings filling the expanse. Tone: vajra-chain appearance like gold cord hung. These three—essence, potential, and tone—constitute the complete wisdom self-arising when not separated. 3. Space Completely-Pure Lamp (dbyings rnam dag gi sgron ma): Possessing outer and inner aspects. Outer sky cloud-free holds; inner space lamp pure. The distinction between outer and inner space represents a crucial technical point. Outer sky appears cloudless, but lamp-person connection is not established—mere empty space lacks the vital connection to the practitioner. Inner sky's blue tone arises outward, called outer space—this opens the basis ground, but from space itself is not actual space. Actual space is dark-blue (mthing ga), inner space. Thus appearance arises—outer<span class="term">/inner space distinction like rainbow-light's load in a house, clarifying the unclear, merely transferring understanding. Technical precision on space distinction: Some incorrectly identify mere cloudless outer sky as the Space Lamp. This is extremely improper because sky's connection to the person is not established, while the lamp follows the person's existence or non-existence. Here, inner sky's blue tone arising outward is called outer space. That opens sky's understanding, the basis ground mere from space, actual space not. This demonstrates the Treasury's critique of superficial interpretations that mistake external appearances for the actual inner luminosity. The etymological analysis continues: Light five clear also mind's self-essence clear-light self-tone arises. From that itself, object's stains and intellect discriminating wisdom's stains, wrong-thought mind's stains—completely pure. The lamp: when that appearance is seen, from the aspect of dispelling action and latency's darkness, it is called lamp. This establishes the soteriological function of the lamps—not merely perceptual phenomena but active agents of purification. The generation process (lines 16084-16089): The first of Four Lamps gathers as essence in the four wheels. Initially, wind propels upward to mother's womb—hence called "far" (rgyang), showing from far the cause-conditional essence entering mother's womb center. Mindfulness, wind-mind, cause-conditional together four gather. Bound by noose—hence called noose (zhags). In flavors, six bliss tastes increase, essence-eye expand—hence called water. At the tip, sense-faculties' action distinctions and five wisdoms' distinctions realize, dharmata sense-faculties' object actually dawns—hence called lamp, dispelling saṃsāra's darkness. Detailed etymological analysis of Bindu Empty Lamp (lines 16090-16104): When compared to relative causal bindu: "Thig" means posture essence lowering; "le" means speech HUM etc. secretly holding, wisdom identifying; "stong pa" means empty bindu reversing potential bestowing, wind mixing, bliss-emptiness meditating; "sgron ma" means by that meaning dispelling darkness. When compared to ultimate wisdom bindu: bindu means gaze's posture, wisdom threefold unchanging; "le" means appearance light rim round; "stong pa" means that appearance not established as thing and characteristic, four-elements harm not; self-appearance, shown yet other not see; clear-light elaboration-extreme free, ignorance darkness clear. Lamp: dispelling saṃsāra's darkness. The comprehensive system: Lamp four path appearance four sign measure determine. The four signs: bindu empty lamp, wisdom self-arising lamp, sphere completely-pure lamp, far-casting water lamp. The nine aspects for each: essence, definition, classification, characteristic, abode, arising manner, arising door, appearance, simile, definite measure. This establishes the complete analytical framework for each lamp, demonstrating the Treasury's systematic approach to contemplative phenomenology. Structural function: This section introduces the Four Lamps as the culmination of subtle body practice, distinguishing them from ordinary perception through the vital recognition of empty-luminous appearance. The progression from karma-wind's pure part through the four lamps demonstrates the transformation of ordinary perception into wisdom vision. The detailed etymological analysis—breaking down each term into its constituent wisdom-qualities—provides the hermeneutical method for recognizing primordial wisdom in direct experience.
