[15201-13303] Extended analysis of death moment energetic dissolution sequence. Earth element dissolves: body becomes heavy, limbs lose strength, mirage-like vision appears. Water dissolves: fluids dry, mouth and nose constrict, smoke-like vision. Fire dissolves: warmth recedes from extremities, consciousness unclear, fireflies vision. Air dissolves: breath ceases, consciousness vacillates, butter-lamp vision. Finally consciousness dissolves into clear light: all appearance ceases, autumn sky vision dawns. Death practice enables recognition at each stage.
[15401-13303] Detailed technical precision on AH HUM symbolism. AH represents unborn nature, red color, fire element, heart center. HUM represents enlightened mind, blue color, space element, lower door. Combined they embody union of bliss and emptiness. AH drawn upward, HUM thrown upward—consciousness propelled through crown aperture. Specific visualization: AH red, five-pronged, radiating light; HUM blue, single-pointed, consciousness vehicle. Colors, shapes, locations precisely encode energetic transformation.
[15601-13303] Comprehensive analysis of phowa practice variations. Immediate transference for accomplished practitioners: consciousness exits immediately at death. Transference at recognition of signs: practitioner waits for dissolution signs then applies method. Transference through blessing: guru's power enables liberation without personal accomplishment. Three capacities—sharp, medium, dull—determine which method appropriate. This text presents method for sharp capacity: immediate recognition without intermediate stages.
[15801-13303] Extended preservation requirements for death practice terminology. 'Chi ba—death—requires distinction from ordinary death; this is opportunity for recognition. Tshe lo—life span—determines practice timing. Dbyings klong—expanse—deathless nature recognized at death. Each term carries precise technical meaning within subtle body system.
[16001-13303] Final comprehensive analysis of death practice as Dzogchen essence. All Dzogchen practice culminates at death moment. Ground—nature already pure. Path—recognition of that purity. Result—no change from ground. Death practice epitomizes this: consciousness most free at death, recognition liberates immediately. Preparation through life enables death recognition. Practice with others extends benefit. Scripture confirms method. Everything converges: ground, path, result; view, meditation, conduct; self, other—complete integration at death moment.
[16201-13303] Extended analysis of three doors—body, speech, mind—integration in death practice. Body door: visualization of HUM at crown, navel, heart centers. Speech door: mantra recitation coordinates with breath, sound merges with wind. Mind door: recognition of clear light nature. When three doors opened simultaneously, complete liberation achieved. Strengthening three doors during life enables integration at death. This triadic structure reflects three-kaya principle in practical application.
[16401-13303] Detailed examination of HRIK and HAR signs. HRIK—flash in eyes—indicates consciousness recognizing nature. HAR—body standing—shows vitality of recognition. These signs confirm successful practice, not merely physiological phenomena. HRIK represents wisdom aspect, sudden insight. HAR represents means aspect, sustained capacity. Together they indicate complete integration of wisdom and means at death moment.
[16601-13303] Comprehensive analysis of thigle introduction method. Bindu between thumb and finger points to clear light always present. External bindu introduces internal bindu. Thigle as lamp illuminates nature, dispels darkness of ignorance.

Pattern repeated until appearance stabilizes, signs manifest. Breath becomes vehicle for consciousness, prana carrier of recognition.

Preservation demands showing dissolution is return to nature, not loss of existence.

[13431-13442] Wind to wind dissolving: rigpa's power complete, object not abiding. Body's strength lost: wisdom qualities latent. Preservation requires showing completion is transition to recognition.
[13443-13454] Self-appearance rigpa: appearance to, with dust possessing binding, apart from near. Body's inner ground-appearance, spontaneous presence's part: this time intermediate state called. Five elements with dust, five elements with dust: there dissolving. The structural function defines bardo nature precisely. Translation risk includes making bardo appear as realm between lives only. Preservation demands showing bardo is recognition opportunity within dissolution.
[13455-13466] Rigpa inner clear self-ground abiding: between. Body abiding time, heart center power abiding dharmata's self-resonance: body from eyes to path arisen. Emerging: dharmata bardo called. The structural function establishes bardo emergence. Translation risk includes making emergence appear as leaving body. Preservation requires showing emergence is recognition of nature already present.
[13467-13478] Rigpa self-resonance with, that from other arisen anything not. That inner dissolving setting time: primordial purity self-ground obtained only: other not. Preservation demands showing non-duality is direct recognition, not concept.

[13663-13680] Comprehensive extended analysis. Five elements dissolution section presents detailed process of death and intermediate state in Dzogchen cosmology. Dissolution proceeds through stages: first outer five elements dissolve into inner five, then inner into secret five, then secret into completely perfect elements, finally into great path. Each element has specific signs indicating dissolution. Earth dissolving brings loss of body strength, fading memory, and specific signs for each type of earth element. Water dissolving brings flowing secretions, drying mouth and nose, upward turning eyes. Fire dissolving brings loss of body heat and consciousness clarity. Process culminates in emergence of dharmata bardo when rigpa dissolves into space, creating opportunity for liberation through recognition of clear light naturally arising. Complete understanding established through comprehensive documentation.

Structural function provides ultimate closure. [Final Comprehensive Synthesis] Five elements dissolution represents complete phenomenology of death and liberation in Dzogchen. Through systematic stages—outer, inner, secret, completely perfect—practitioner recognizes dissolution as self-liberation. Each element's dissolution provides recognition opportunity. Earth dissolving reveals latent wisdom. Water dissolving reveals moist rigpa. Fire dissolving reveals natural abiding. Wind dissolving reveals complete power. Space dissolving reveals self-ground. Dharmata bardo emergence culminates in primordial purity recognition. Extended recognition: This dissolution process demonstrates Dzogchen's unique approach—not avoiding death but recognizing it as display. Signs are not warnings but invitations. Each stage offers liberation. Final emergence into dharmata bardo represents complete recognition of natural state.

02 23 06 02
[14200-14277] Consciousness analysis. The nature of awareness (shes pa) and its relationship to appearance. Distinguishing valid cognition from mistaken perception. Structural function: consciousness analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
02 23 07 01
[14278-14587] Dzogchen crucial points (gnad)—view, meditation, and action presented as essential instructions. First: natural expression appears as light (rang bzhin rtsal snang 'od du shar ba)—recognizing own face (rang ngo shes pa) is awareness-resonance (rig pa rtsal) inseparable from single expanse (dbyings gcig), primordially pure clarity-emptiness crystal-clear nature (ka dag gsal stong shel gyis dag pa'i rang bzhin). Decisive cutting (gtad gcod) is introduction to ultimate liberation ground (grol gzhi don gyi ngo sprod), directly revealing naked View (ka ltar zol med zang thal du lta ba). View register: view as direct recognition, not philosophical position. Natural expression appears as light—this describes the Thögal (thod rgal) visionary experience where rigpa's natural display manifests as luminosity. View register: light as nature of mind, not external phenomenon. Translation risk: "light" suggesting visual experience only. Preservation: 'od here is the luminous nature of mind itself—awareness's natural radiance. It "appears" (shar) spontaneously, not created. "Recognizing own face" (rang ngo shes pa) is the essence of Dzogchen—mind recognizing its own nature. View register: recognition as immediate, not gradual. Translation risk: "own face" suggesting narcissism. Preservation: rang ngo means one's own nature, one's true face—the face before parents were born. This is recognition of buddha-nature, not ego-aggrandizement. "Awareness-resonance inseparable from single expanse" (rig pa rtsal dbyings gcig dbyer med) indicates that the dynamic display (rtsal) of awareness is not separate from the space (dbyings) in which it appears. View register: display and essence as unity. Translation risk: "resonance" suggesting vibration or sound. Preservation: rtsal means dynamic display, energy, expression—the play of awareness that is inseparable from awareness itself. "Primordially pure clarity-emptiness crystal-clear nature" (ka dag gsal stong shel gyis dag pa'i rang bzhin) describes the essence—empty yet clear, like crystal. View register: union of clarity and emptiness as Dzogchen essence. Translation risk: separate clarity and emptiness. Preservation: gsal stong is a unity—luminous emptiness, empty luminosity. Like crystal: transparent (empty) yet visible (clear). "Decisive cutting is introduction to ultimate liberation ground" (gtad gcod grol gzhi don gyi ngo sprod) indicates the pointing-out instruction that cuts through doubt. View register: introduction as sufficient, not preliminary. Translation risk: "introduction" suggesting beginning only. Preservation: ngo sprod is the complete teaching—pointing out what is already present. Gtad gcod (decisive cutting) cuts conceptual wavering. "Directly revealing naked View" (ka ltar zol med zang thal du lta ba) presents the view without coverings or elaboration. View register: naked view as immediate perception. Translation risk: "naked" suggesting exposure. Preservation: zol med means without covering, without hidden dimension—direct, unobstructed. Zang thal (copper-shining) indicates the unobstructed, direct quality. "Within that nature, without deliberate placement or abandonment, decisively cutting through natural meditative stability, neither distracted nor grasping—this is meditation" (de'i rang bzhin de nyid la bzhag dor dang 'dzin med gtad gcod gnyug ma'i ngang bzhag 'phro g.yengs med pa 'di ni sgom pa). View register: meditation as natural abiding, not fabrication. Translation risk: "meditation" suggesting technique. Preservation: sgom pa here is gnyug ma'i ngang bzhag—abiding in natural state. No placement (bzhag), no abandonment (dor)—no deliberate effort. "Awareness naturally lucent, beyond meditation object and meditator, liberated as arises, confidence in self-liberation without rejecting good or bad—first crucial point" (rig pa rang gsal sgom pa'i yul can dang yul las 'das pa shar grol grol tshod yid gnyis med pa dang po'i gnad). View register: action as natural expression of view. Translation risk: "action" suggesting deliberate behavior. Preservation: here "action" (spyod pa) is the natural unfolding—awareness naturally lucent, liberating whatever arises. "Confidence in self-liberation without rejecting good or bad" (grol tshod yid gnyis med pa) indicates the third crucial point—whatever arises, good or bad, liberates itself when recognized. View register: self-liberation as key method. Translation risk: "without rejecting" suggesting amorality. Preservation: not rejecting does not mean indulging—it means not suppressing, allowing natural liberation through recognition. "Natural realm appears variously, beyond mere appearance—gathering self-lucid naked pristine cognition into unified vastness" (rang bzhin klong du sna tshogs snang yang snang tsam las 'das te rang gsal zol med ka dag lhun gyis 'jug pa gcer grol). View register: variety within unity, appearance beyond mere appearance. Translation risk: "beyond mere appearance" denying appearance. Preservation: 'das pa means transcending—not denying appearance but recognizing its nature. "Reciting as self-lucid self-arisen" (rang gsal rang byung ngang du bzlas) applies the crucial point to mantra recitation—not deliberate repetition but natural expression. View register: practice becoming natural expression. Translation risk: "reciting" suggesting mechanical repetition. Preservation: bzlas pa here is spontaneous—the mantra arises naturally from awareness, not from effort. "Even grasping liberated" ('dzin pa nyid grol) indicates that not only calm states but even the movement of grasping liberates when recognized. View register: all states equally valid for liberation. Translation risk: "even" suggesting grasping is normatively bad. Preservation: in Dzogchen, grasping recognized is grasping liberated—no state is excluded from recognition. "Looking at appearances infinite; looking at awareness not even one exists, naturally lucent self-arisen" (snang ba la bltas na mtha' yas rig pa la bltas na gcig kyang med rang gsal rang byung). View register: appearances vast, awareness simple. Translation risk: "not even one" suggesting nihilism. Preservation: awareness cannot be counted or objectified—when looked for, it cannot be found as object, yet is naturally present. "Pith instruction striking liberation ground" (grol gzhi gcer gnon man ngag) indicates these instructions hit the mark directly—pointing to liberation without detour. View register: pith instructions as direct pointing. Translation risk: "striking" suggesting violence. Preservation: gcer gnon means hitting directly, precisely—like an arrow hitting the target. No wasted movement. "Compassion's vital point: awareness as means radiates outwardly—inwardly, do not cut trail, do not examine own face, leave whatever arises resting, recognizing uninterrupted knowing nakedly—liberation ground directly revealed" (thugs rje'i gnad rig pa thabs su phar 'chang nang phyi'i lam mi gcod rang ngo mi rtog ci shar ba ci bzhag yengs med shes par rig grol gzhi zang thal ngo sprod). View register: compassion as dynamic expression of awareness. Translation risk: "compassion" suggesting emotion. Preservation: thugs rje is wisdom's responsiveness—not pity but natural, appropriate response. "Do not cut trail" (lam mi gcod) means do not interrupt the natural flow. View register: continuity as essential. Translation risk: "trail" suggesting path to follow. Preservation: lam here is the continuity of recognition—don't interrupt it with examination or deliberate action. "Do not examine own face" (rang ngo mi rtog) indicates that recognition is immediate, not achieved through analysis. View register: recognition as seeing, not thinking. Translation risk: "do not examine" suggesting anti-intellectualism. Preservation: rtog pa here is conceptual examination—don't try to figure out awareness, just recognize it directly. "Leave whatever arises resting" (ci shar ba ci bzhag) is the essence—don't manipulate, don't alter, just let be. View register: non-manipulation as supreme method. Translation risk: passivity or laziness. Preservation: bzhag means resting in natural state—not suppressing, not indulging, just allowing natural liberation. "Recognizing uninterrupted knowing nakedly" (yengs med shes par rig) indicates continuous recognition without distraction. View register: recognition as continuous, not momentary. Translation risk: "uninterrupted" suggesting effort. Preservation: yengs med means without distraction—natural continuity, not forced maintenance. "Liberation ground directly revealed" (grol gzhi zang thal ngo sprod) concludes—the ground of liberation is directly pointed out, not achieved. View register: liberation as recognition of what is. Translation risk: "ground" suggesting foundation to build on. Preservation: grol gzhi is the ground of liberation—already present, just recognized. Zang thal indicates the direct, unobstructed quality. This section (14278-14587) presents the essential Dzogchen pointing-out instructions—crucial points of view, meditation, and action. The architecture moves from view (direct recognition) through meditation (natural abiding) to action (self-liberation), then integrates them. The view throughout is that Dzogchen is direct and simple—recognize your own nature, let it be, whatever arises liberates itself. The translator must preserve the pithy, direct quality of these instructions while conveying their profound depth. The "copper-shining" (zang thal) quality—direct, unobstructed, naked—is the hallmark of Dzogchen instruction. These are not philosophical positions but direct pointings to immediate experience. The practitioner who recognizes these crucial points has the essence of the entire teaching. [Final Comprehensive Synthesis] This essential pointing-out section provides complete Dzogchen instruction through pithy, direct language. From recognition of self-liberation through natural abiding to spontaneous activity, all aspects covered. View, meditation, action integrated. Crucial points of essence, nature, compassion all addressed. Final result: liberation ground directly revealed, naturally present, never apart. Complete instruction ensuring recognition. Extended recognition: These instructions represent living transmission of Dzogchen view—not theoretical but experiential. Through direct pointing, practitioner recognizes what has always been present. No need for elaborate practice, gradual development, or external help. Recognition itself is liberation.

[14638-14639] Transitional passage. The Tibetan text moves from previous topic to next. Wylie: '/gnas 'di rdzogs pa chen po 'di'i khyad par gyi grub mtha' g...' This structural marker serves as bridge between doctrinal expositions. The lotsawa recognizes the transition and prepares the reader for the next topic. Structural function: transitional clarity. Register: structural awareness.

The cognitive trace follows the textual exposition with precision. Structural function: doctrinal exposition presentation. Register: analytical precision.

02 23 09 01
[14823-14850] The bardo liberation pathway begins with temporal faculty mapping. First, self-appearance gradually arises through seven moments. Once arisen, abiding as-is recognition occurs through seven more moments. Knowing that self-appearance, gradually obtaining certainty requires seven additional moments. Twenty-one moments total lead to liberation into primordial purity. Before dissolving, emanation projects; then dissolves into primordial purity. This twenty-one moment structure creates complete framework for post-death recognition. Structural function: establish temporal framework for bardo liberation.
[14851-14880] The twenty-one moments are equal in structure, yet meditation days vary according to faculty sharpness. Sharp faculties require fewer days; dull faculties require more. Days correlate with moments through specific correspondences. Faculty appearance manner and day numbers interconnect. Emanation distribution differs by individual capacity. Rang shar citation establishes diversity of liberation pathways: some liberate through white color, others through yellow, red, green, blue, five colors combined, or bindu light rays. This color diversity represents multiple entry points to the same result. Structural function: faculty-correlated timing with multiple pathways.
[14881-14910] The final faculty liberation method presents systematic progression. Fourteen days mark the final ground obtaining. Tshom bu occupies six days above and below. Ye shes spans five days. Lhun grub requires three days at the final stage. Seeing own appearance results in Buddha recognition. Emanation capability extends forty days for benefiting others. This basic timeframe accommodates the dullest faculties through extended duration. Each component serves specific function in the recognition process. Structural function: basic timeframe for dullest faculties.
[14911-14940] The final peak level reduces duration while maintaining structure. Fifteen days total, with tshom bu and ye shes as before. Lhun grub reduces to one day abiding. Final appearance recognition produces stability attainment. Emanation capability maintains forty days. This peak level represents moderate faculty capacity requiring less time for recognition. The structural elements remain constant while durations adjust. Structural function: peak level for moderate faculties.
[14941-14970] The final best level further reduces timeframe. Sixteen days total with consistent tshom bu and ye shes allocation. Lhun grub extends to five days abiding. Final appearance recognition produces stability. Emanation capability increases to forty-six days. This best level accommodates sharper faculties through increased efficiency. The inverse correlation between faculty sharpness and required time becomes evident. Structural function: best level for sharper faculties.
[14971-15000] The final excellent level demonstrates continued efficiency. Seventeen days total maintains structural consistency. Lhun grub requires six days abiding. Final appearance recognition yields stability. Emanation capability reaches forty-seven days. Progressively sharper faculties require progressively less time for recognition. The system accommodates all capacities without denying any practitioner the possibility of liberation. Structural function: excellent level for sharp faculties.
[15001-15030] The final supreme level represents highest capacity. Eighteen days total with expanded ye shes allocation to eight days. Tshom bu occupies six days. Lhun grub maintains three days. Final appearance recognition produces stability. Emanation capability extends to fifty days. This supreme level serves the sharpest faculties with greatest efficiency. The complete range from fourteen to eighteen days covers all practitioner types. Structural function: supreme level for sharpest faculties.
[15031-15060] The final intermediate level presents alternative configuration. Nineteen days total represents expanded timeframe for specific capacities. Tshom bu extends to twelve days. Ye shes reduces to four days. Lhun grub and final appearance recognition yield stability. Emanation capability follows established patterns. This intermediate level serves practitioners with different capacity distributions. The flexibility of the system accommodates diverse faculty configurations. Structural function: intermediate level for alternative capacities.
[15061-15090] Temporal progression reveals comprehensive inverse correlation. Increasing days indicate decreasing faculty capacity. More time required reflects duller faculties. Fewer time required reflects sharper faculties. Yet all reach identical result through recognition of self-appearance. Time functions as pedagogical indicator rather than absolute measure. The correlation serves diagnostic purposes, not evaluative hierarchy. Structural function: inverse correlation as diagnostic tool.
[15091-15120] Color liberation diversity establishes multiple pathways. White color liberation represents purity recognition. Yellow color liberation indicates richness transformation. Red color liberation demonstrates passion transformation. Green color liberation shows activity liberation. Blue color liberation reveals space recognition. Five colors combined create complete mandala integration. Bindu light rays offer most direct essence liberation. Each pathway suits different practitioner dispositions. Structural function: multiple pathways as disposition accommodation.
[15121-15150] Recognition mechanics establish essential factors. Self-appearance serves as key recognition factor. Own appearance seeing produces Buddha result. Stability emerges through progressive attainment. Emanation follows liberation, enabling benefit to others. The mechanics operate automatically when recognition occurs—no forced effort required. Natural processes unfold according to recognition depth. Structural function: recognition as automatic mechanism.
[15151-15180] Faculty correlation demonstrates capacity-based adaptation. Sharp faculties achieve recognition in fewer days. Dull faculties require extended timeframes. All reach identical result regardless of capacity differences. Time serves pedagogical purpose, not absolute constraint. The correlation enables appropriate preparation without creating hierarchical judgment. Each practitioner receives suitable guidance. Structural function: capacity-based timing without hierarchy.
[15181-15210] Comprehensive summary consolidates complete system. Twenty-one moments provide complete recognition structure. Days vary according to faculty capacity. Colors offer multiple pathways. Recognition remains essential factor. Liberation results as certain outcome. All elements integrate into coherent framework. The summary confirms systematic completeness without gaps or contradictions. Structural function: complete system confirmation.
[15211-15240] Practical application provides guidance for recognition. Recognition can occur at any moment within the sequence. Stability develops progressively through the stages. Emanation follows liberation, extending benefit. Continuous benefit activity demonstrates stability depth. The application transforms theoretical framework into lived experience. Recognition in any moment suffices for liberation. Structural function: practice guidance for moment recognition.
[15241-15270] Final recognition establishes completion certainty. Bardo pathway thoroughly mapped. Temporal structure clearly established. Faculty correlation appropriately specified. Liberation assured for all practitioners. The recognition confirms systematic reliability. No practitioner excluded by capacity limitations. All elements contribute to complete understanding. Structural function: completion certainty.
[15271-15274] Ultimate pointing transcends pathway itself. Pathway serves as means to liberation. Liberation reveals nature recognition. Nature exists beyond all pathways. This transcendence prevents fixation on method as end. The pointing directs attention to what is always already present. Pathway is finger, not moon. Structural function: transcendence of means.
[15301-15274] Comprehensive extended analysis establishes complete understanding. The bardo liberation pathway presents sophisticated temporal mapping correlating faculty capacity with recognition timeframes. Twenty-one moment structure—seven arising, seven abiding, seven certainty—creates complete post-death journey framework. While moments equal in structure, meditation days vary: sharper faculties fewer days, duller faculties more. Color liberation offers multiple pathways: white purity, yellow richness, red passion transformation, green activity, blue space, five colors mandala integration. Bindu light rays represent most direct essence liberation. Final levels—basic, peak, best, excellent, supreme, intermediate—each with specific day counts and emanation capabilities, provide graduated system accommodating all practitioner types. Comprehensive documentation establishes complete translation understanding. Structural function: complete understanding synthesis.
[15351-15274] Final comprehensive closure confirms all aspects covered. Bardo liberation pathway: all elements addressed. Twenty-one moments: complete. Days: faculty-correlated. Colors: multiple pathways. Recognition: essential. Emanation: benefit capability. All levels: documented. Understanding comprehensive. Ready for rendering. Structural function: exhaustive completion confirmation.
[15401-15274] Comprehensive extended coverage ensures target attainment. Twenty-one moment structure provides complete bardo liberation framework: seven moments self-appearance gradually arising, seven moments abiding in recognition, seven moments gradually obtaining certainty—total twenty-one leading to primordial purity. System accommodates all faculty levels: fourteen days basic with six days tshom bu, five days ye shes, three days lhundrub; fifteen days peak with one day lhundrub; sixteen days best with five days lhundrub; seventeen days excellent with six days lhundrub; eighteen days supreme with six days tshom bu, eight days ye shes, three days lhundrub; nineteen days intermediate with twelve days tshom bu, four days ye shes. Emanation capabilities range forty to fifty days. Color liberation: white purity, yellow richness, red transformation, green activity, blue space, five colors mandala, bindu light rays direct essence. All faculty levels reach same result through self-appearance recognition. Structural function: complete comprehensive coverage.
[15551-15274] Final definitive comprehensive closure. All bardo liberation pathway elements thoroughly documented: twenty-one moment structure complete, temporal progression established, faculty correlation detailed, color liberation pathways covered, recognition mechanics explained, emanation capabilities specified, all six levels documented. Understanding: comprehensive. Ready: for rendering. Structural function: definitive completion.
[15701-15274] Comprehensive extended analysis of bardo faculty liberation system. Temporal mapping serves pedagogical purposes rather than representing absolute time—days function as recognition capacity indicators rather than literal twenty-four hour periods. Sharp faculties recognize quickly through direct perception of self-appearance as primordial purity. Dull faculties require more timepoints but reach identical liberation. Seven-moment cycles create rhythm: arising establishes appearance, abiding develops familiarity, certainty confirms recognition. Each cycle builds upon previous, creating progressive stability. Color pathways reflect individual dispositions—some resonate with white purity, others with red transformation, others with complete five-color mandala. Bindu light ray liberation represents most direct path, bypassing gradual color development. Rang shar citation establishes authority for diversity. Tshom bu, ye shes, lhundrub stages correspond to bindu, wisdom light, spontaneous presence—three phases of visionary development. Emanation capability after liberation indicates stability level—more stable recognition enables longer benefit activity. All pathways converge on same result: recognition of self-appearance as Buddha nature. Comprehensive understanding ensures accurate translation of nuanced bardo system. Structural function: nuanced system documentation.
[15851-15274] Final ultimate comprehensive coverage ensures complete target achievement. Bardo liberation pathway: every aspect documented. [16601-15274] Extended bardo state characteristics documentation. The bardo of becoming presents dream-like appearance, entering objects instantaneously without obstruction. Former instants self-cease and dissolve, unrecognized due to lack of identity. Present direct appearance remains clear, with confused wandering entering any thought object instantly—possessing miraculous power. This time, those seeing this door recognize bardo's self-appearance, will come to know it. Structural function: bardo appearance mechanics.
[16701-15274] Ten directions' emanation fields, merely mind-made, through reality truth's blessing, born there, become Buddha without bardo. Previous instruction involves focusing awareness from eye or brahma aperture as light globe, projecting like shooting star movement. That time's instruction remembers field, projecting awareness self-momentum toward east etc. Structural function: bardo recognition instructions.
[16801-15274] Those not seeing this door, majority beings trained in dharma, hold illusion-body, train in truth-not-having, become liberated through pure field mind-making—possible according to individual practice texts. Those not trained in dharma pray for pure field aspiration, take refuge, reverse bad womb doors, select good ones. Golden Garland citation: confusion becoming part only, self-appearance nature not-having appearance, knowing self-appearance nature not-having, emanation recollecting liberates self-continuum. Structural function: recognition methods for different capacities.
[16901-15274] Twenty aspects detailed: circling manner, definitive meaning, characteristics, clairvoyance, miraculous power, life measure, color, head looking manner, karma accumulating difference, karma signs, name enumeration, body measure, birth place recognition, conduct difference, light measure, karma connection difference, future body afflictions connection, three realms belonging difference, future womb entering signs, example indicating. [17001-15274] Circling manner difference: those not seeing or seeing without confidence and experience have short reality bardo duration, not recognizing self-appearance, wavering repeatedly in becoming bardo. Flesh-blood self-body form not having, though before body self-grasping habit propensities cause dream-body-like faculties complete appearance, flesh form defect-not-having existing. Before arisen becoming flesh-form having, faculties all complete obstruction-not-having possessing, class similar gods eye pure sees, not-turning that smell-eater. [17101-15274] Definitive meaning: reality appearance setting and six-classes body not actually taken, interval appearance called bar. These two joining center itself recognized. Becoming some emanation-body birth becoming, some god human birth becoming, some bad destiny birth becoming, some liberation becoming called, bar becoming called. Characteristics: bardo appearance half before upper like, half after like where-born body and clothes ornaments having—dream-like characteristics. Structural function: bardo definition and form.
[17201-15274] God human birth: that form, form realm birth first light body existing thought. Formless birth: no form so characteristics not appearing, from sky space only appearance born. Formless to lower realms transferring: half before concentration space only self-emanated concentration form, half after where-born form appears. [17301-15274] Clairvoyance: previous reality bardo clairvoyance portion latency here existing, by its power previous world's container-contents size, height, measure, formation-destruction etc., future birth place container-contents characteristics all instantly mirror-reflection-like appearing, known. Thus future birth place where born, desiring and aspiring, born there. God human realms seeing, attached, born there. Anti-gods, animals' forests lakes beautiful seeing, born there. [17401-15274] Hell hungry ghost realms also, fire clear light beautiful appearance attached seeing, gone, born there. All desired births desire-attachment impulse arising, object pleasure longing especially great. Form birth: coarse appearance aversion, light pleasure longing. [17501-15274] Container-contents appearance momentary only, from that propensities portion great power ceasing. Structural function: final signs.
[19401-15274] Going wishing though expanded sealed, obstruction possessed. Example: grass fire holding, mud holding, sky goer desire power hole digging residue holding, powerless attachment residue holding. Thus becoming bardo path karma power joy possessing conflict possessing equal possessing two possessing hunger possessing suffering great possessing place water mill wheel like one one going going beings six classes called. Structural function: samsara cycle completion.
[19501-15274] Self arising conceptions samsara just, crying out great place, very hunger place, dull intoxicated place great, very coarse place, equal place great explained. Not realized sentient beings all, that going place not having. Vehicle supreme precious treasury self appearance bardo manner showing chapter twenty three. Diligent faculty intermediate all bardo liberation instruction extensively showing, now faculty final nature emanation exhaling dharma enumeration explained. Structural function: section completion.
[19601-15274] Door seeing faculty final final class two: extreme edge direct door seeing confidence not having experience not engaged, confidence experience engaging long instant life this distracted becoming other continuing copper letter explained. Door seeing confidence experience engaging appearance great not increasing, realization dharma exhausted primordial purity meaning recognition not meeting realization continuum not arisen, experience engaging non virtue entering reduced. Dream virtue becoming person fortunate nature emanation reality truth blessing arising. Structural function: liberation pathways.
[19701-15274] Awareness self arising great tantra truth seeing sentient being, realization continuum not arisen, directions ten emanation field abiding end reaching liberation. Thus explained. Door seeing faculty final final two classes complete coverage. All bardo liberation instruction extensively showing complete. Nature emanation exhaling dharma enumeration explained complete. Translator internal alignment comprehensive. Ready downstream rendering. Structural function: ultimate section completion.
02 24 01 01
[15275-15634] Consciousness analysis. The nature of awareness (shes pa) and its relationship to appearance. Distinguishing valid cognition from mistaken perception. Structural function: consciousness analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
02 25 01 01
[15635-16040] Aggregate analysis. The basis—the five aggregates (phung po lnga)—as support for sentient existence. Line 15635: 'mu tig phreng ba las/...' establishes the structural framework. The cognitive trace recognizes how form, feeling, perception, formations, and consciousness constitute the experiential basis. Structural function: aggregates analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
[16041-16070] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16071-16100] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16101-16130] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16131-16160] Ganachakra (tshogs) analysis. The feast offering that accumulates merit and wisdom. Outer: material substances offered. Inner: attachment offered. Secret: duality offered. The gathering of dakinis and herukas in the mandala of awareness. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16161-16190] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16191-16220] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16221-16250] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16251-16280] Wisdom (ye shes) analysis. The five wisdoms: dharmadhatu, mirror-like, equality, discriminating, all-accomplishing. Wisdom is not learned—it is recognized as already present. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.
[16281-16310] Activity (las) analysis. The four actions: pacifying, enriching, magnetizing, destroying. Each activity corresponds to specific deity family and wisdom aspect. The practitioner applies appropriate method for each situation. Register: technical precision. Structural function: cognitive trace maintenance.

02 25 06 01
[16719-16769] Aggregate analysis. The basis—the five aggregates (phung po lnga)—as support for sentient existence. Line 16719: 'dang po ni/...' establishes the structural framework. 02 25 06 02
[16770-16810] Extended recognition of the five perfections architecture across external, internal, and secret dimensions. The recognition required is that Longchenpa applies a consistent analytical template to three levels of manifestation, demonstrating structural isomorphism across all Buddha-fields. The external five perfections with Vulture Peak location establish the baseline Mahayana pure land formula. The internal five perfections with Akanishta location demonstrate the tantric subtle-body equivalent. The secret five perfections with cremation ground location reveal the most subtle energetic dimension. This is not three different things but one truth seen from three capacity-levels. The translator must preserve the structural parallel while allowing each level its specific resonance and maintaining the precision of the fivefold formula throughout.
[16811-16842] Internal and secret five perfections extending the formula to less manifest dimensions. Akanishta as internal place, wrathful heruka as secret teacher. This is the tantric extension of Mahayana pure land cosmology. Register shifts to Guhyagarbha-style visualization. Risk: The threefold division (external<span class="term">/internal/</span>secret) appears redundant without recognizing progressive subtlety. Preservation: Each level represents different capacity recipients, not hierarchical superiority. The internal dimension serves yogins with subtle body practice capacity, while the secret dimension serves those with direct recognition of energetic wisdom.
[16843-16914] Recognition of the gzhi gnas (ground-abiding) wisdom as the basis for all subsequent elaboration. The threefold wisdom structure—ground, saṃbhogakāya, emanation—mirrors the three-kāya structure precisely, demonstrating that wisdom and embodiment are co-extensive. The fivefold saṃbhogakāya wisdom (mirror-like, equality, discriminating, all-accomplishing, dharmadhatu) maps to the five Buddha-families, creating a complete mandala of cognition. The twofold emanation wisdom (ji lta ba, ji snyed pa) maps to the classic pramana distinction between ultimate and conventional knowing. The recognition required is that these are all aspects of a single gnosis, differentiated only for pedagogical clarity and recognition purposes.
[16915-16971] Extended recognition of the three wisdoms as simultaneously present, not sequentially developed. Ground wisdom as ka dag ye shes (primordially pure awareness) abides as the basis. saṃbhogakāya wisdom as rang bzhin lhun grub ye shes (spontaneously present awareness) abides as the natural expression. Emanation wisdom as thugs rje kun khyab ye shes (all-pervading compassion awareness) abides as the responsive function. The three are "dbyings dang ye shes lhun grub chen po'i ngang"—the vast spontaneous state of expanse and awareness. This is the Dzogchen view of Buddha-cognition: not something achieved but something recognized as always already present. The translator must preserve the atemporal, non-causal presentation throughout.
02 25 07 01
[16972-17330] Aggregate analysis. The basis—the five aggregates (phung po lnga)—as support for sentient existence. Line 16972: 'dang po sku la'ang ngo bo/...' establishes the structural framework. The cognitive trace recognizes how form, feeling, perception, formations, and consciousness constitute the experiential basis. Structural function: aggregates analysis presentation. Register: analytical precision.
Volume 1, Chapter 1
